original: sbom po dang phra mor so sor snang ba'i rnam pa tha dad pas phung po dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i chos ston to //
analyzed: sbom po dang phra mor so sor snang ba'i rnam pa tha dad pas phung po dang / khams dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i chos ston to //
translated: The Buddha teaches the Dharma in the aspect of two truths, the conventional and the ultimate, in order to show the two kinds of disciples, those of the Great Vehicle and those of the Lesser Vehicle, the two kinds of paths, the Great Vehicle and the Lesser Vehicle, and the two kinds of results, the state of a Buddha and the state of a Hearer or Solitary Realizer.🔽He teaches the Dharma in the aspect of two kinds of aggregates, the gross and the subtle, in order to show the aggregates, the elements, the sense bases, the four noble truths, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so forth.

original: bsod nams dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba gzugs su snang zhing sgyu ma dang 'dra ba dang / gnyis kyi rnam pa thams cad kyis stong zhing gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa dag pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyang 'khor ba'i rnal 'byor du ston to //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ting nge 'dzin las byung ba gzugs su snang zhing sgyu ma dang 'dra ba dang / gnyis kyi rnam pa thams cad kyis stong zhing gnyis su med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa dag pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyang 'khor ba'i rnal 'byor du ston to //
translated: He teaches the cyclic existence of the yoga of the bodhisattvas, which is the appearance of form that arises from merit and concentration, which is like an illusion, and which is the ultimate truth of pure Buddhahood, which is empty of all aspects of duality and is nondual.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dpyad pa bcu drug pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dpyad pa bcu drug pa'o /
translated: This concludes the sixteenth chapter of the commentary on the noble Lankāvatāra-sūtra, called “The Ornament of the Essence,” called “The Examination of Dependent Origination.”

original: // / khro gros chen po mu stegs byed thams cad kyis rnam pa brgyad du rnam par brtags te ngas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: // / khro gros chen po mu stegs byed thams cad kyis rnam pa brgyad du rnam par brtags te ngas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The great thinkers, the tīrthikas, imagine it in eight ways, but I do not.

original: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight ways?

original: de la blo gros chen po la la ni rab tu rtsom pa las rnam par ldog pa mi rtag pa nyid ces zer te /
analyzed: de la blo gros chen po la la ni rab tu rtsom pa las rnam par ldog pa mi rtag pa nyid ces zer te /
translated: Among them, some say that impermanence is the reversal of what was begun.🔽Mahāmati, what is called “what was begun” is birth.

original: blo gros chen po rab tu rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin te zhes pa ni mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis rtag pa @228b rnams kyi 'bras bu skyed par rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po rab tu rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba yin te zhes pa ni mu stegs byed pa rnams kyis rtag pa @228b rnams kyi 'bras bu skyed par rtsom pa ste /
translated: The tīrthikas think that the permanent causes produce results.

original: de bzhin du byed pa ni mi rtag go zhes rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa ni mi rtag go zhes rtog pa ste /
translated: In the same way, the creator is impermanent.

original: de dag rim gyis dngos por skyes pa rnams kyang skye ba med par rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: de dag rim gyis dngos por skyes pa rnams kyang skye ba med par rnam par rtog go //
translated: Thus, they imagine that things that arose gradually are also unborn.

original: kha cig ni dbyibs rnam par ldog pa mi rtag pa nyid ces zer ro zhes pa ni ji ltar rdzas su rtsom pa'i yan lag tu sbyor ba la sbyor ba dang ldan pa gzhigs nas glo bur du 'ongs te gnod pa 'gal ba las byung nas gang gi
analyzed: kha cig ni dbyibs rnam par ldog pa mi rtag pa nyid ces zer ro zhes pa ni ji ltar rdzas su rtsom pa'i yan lag tu sbyor ba la sbyor ba dang ldan pa gzhigs nas glo bur du 'ongs te gnod pa 'gal ba las byung nas gang gi
translated: Just as when a chariot is assembled as a component of a substance, it is suddenly destroyed by a person who comes and damages it through a conflict of opposing forces.

original: tshe yan lag rnam pa'i cha phye ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: tshe yan lag rnam pa'i cha phye ba de'i tshe /
translated: When the parts of the chariot are separated,🔽the substance of the chariot, such as the axle, is destroyed.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas dbyig pa la sogs pas 'jig par byed pa de lta bu ni yan lag can gyi rdzas kyi dbyibs ni 'jig pa ste /🔽rdzu 'phrul ma ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas dbyig pa la sogs pas 'jig par byed pa de lta bu ni yan lag can gyi rdzas kyi dbyibs ni 'jig pa ste / rdzu 'phrul ma ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: But the substance of the parts is not destroyed.🔽Some say: Form itself is impermanent.

original: kha cig ni gzugs nyid mi rtag pa zhe'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar me lce dang glog la sogs pa'i gzugs ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs nyid mi rtag pa zhe'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar me lce dang glog la sogs pa'i gzugs ni rtag pa'o //
translated: The form of a flame, lightning and so on is permanent.

original: kha cig ni gzugs 'gyur ba'i bye brag gzhan mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs 'gyur ba'i bye brag gzhan mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: Some say: Another specific transformation of form is impermanence.

original: chos thams cad bar chad med par rgyun du rang gi ngang gis rnam par grol bar 'o ma las zhor 'gyur ba'i bye brag tha dad pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad la yang mi mthong ba gzhig pa mi rtag pa nyid 'jug ce'o zhes bya ba la
analyzed: chos thams cad bar chad med par rgyun du rang gi ngang gis rnam par grol bar 'o ma las zhor 'gyur ba'i bye brag tha dad pa bzhin du dngos po thams cad la yang mi mthong ba gzhig pa mi rtag pa nyid 'jug ce'o zhes bya ba la
translated: All things are uninterruptedly liberated by their own nature, like the different things that come from milk, such as curd.

original: / snga ma ni ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can gyi lta ba thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go /
analyzed: / snga ma ni ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can gyi lta ba thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go /
translated: The former is the view of the Naiyāyikas and the Vaiśeṣikas, which the Omniscient One has in mind.

original: 'di ni grangs can gyi lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni grangs can gyi lta ba ste /
translated: This is the view of the Sāṃkhyas.

original: ji ltar ba tan dza la'i 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar ba tan dza la'i 'grel pa las /
translated: As the commentary on the Vākyapadīya says,

original: yon tan 'jug pa ni mi brtan pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan 'jug pa ni mi brtan pa ste /
translated: “The engagement of the qualities is unstable.

original: yon tan 'di dag bdag la yud tsam du yang mi gnas so zhes so //
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag bdag la yud tsam du yang mi gnas so zhes so //
translated: These qualities do not remain in the self even for a moment.”

original: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang de bzhin du dngos po thams cad la mi mthong ba gzhig pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang de bzhin du dngos po thams cad la mi mthong ba gzhig pa ni mi rtag pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Omniscient One also says, “The destruction of all things that are not seen is impermanence.”

original: rang gi dang gis 'byung ba ni 'o ma las zho dang dar ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba'i dngos po 'byung ba ni sngon gyi gzugs yongs su spangs te chos gzhan skye'o zhes so //
analyzed: rang gi dang gis 'byung ba ni 'o ma las zho dang dar ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba'i dngos po 'byung ba ni sngon gyi gzugs yongs su spangs te chos gzhan skye'o zhes so //
translated: The arising of what is naturally occurring is the arising of a thing that is a transformation, like curd from milk, or alcohol from flour. The arising of another thing is the arising of another thing after abandoning its previous form.🔽Some imagine impermanence as the nonexistence of a thing, meaning that the previous thing does not exist, and they imagine things such as potsherds and charcoal.🔽Some imagine the nonexistence of a thing as impermanent, like the Kshapanakas and the Aulūkyas.🔽Some imagine impermanence as the transformation of a thing, like the Samkhyas.🔽Some imagine impermanence as the transformation of a thing and the nonexistence of a thing, like the Nirgranthas.

original: kha cig ni dngos po mi rtag par rtog go zhes bya ba ni dngos po snga ma med cing gyo mo dang sol ba la sogs pa'i dngos po kun rtog go //
analyzed: kha cig ni dngos po mi rtag par rtog go zhes bya ba ni dngos po snga ma med cing gyo mo dang sol ba la sogs pa'i dngos po kun rtog go //
translated: Some imagine impermanence as the transformation of a thing and the nonexistence of a thing and the transformation of a nonthing, like the Lokāyatas.🔽Some imagine impermanence as the transformation of a thing, the transformation of a nonthing, and the transformation of both, like the Aupaniṣadas.🔽Some imagine impermanence as the transformation of a thing, the transformation of a nonthing, and the transformation of both, and as the nonexistence of a thing and the nonexistence of a nonthing, like the Mīmāṃsakas.🔽Some imagine impermanence as the transformation of a thing, the transformation of a nonthing, the transformation of both, the nonexistence of a thing, and the nonexistence of a nonthing, and as the transformation of both, like the Vātsīputrīyas.

original: kha cig ni dngos po'i dngos po med pa mi rtag par rtog go zhes pa ni ji ltar ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can lta bu ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni dngos po'i dngos po med pa mi rtag par rtog go zhes pa ni ji ltar ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can lta bu ste /
translated: Some imagine impermanence as the transformation of a thing, the transformation of a nonthing, the transformation of both, the nonexistence of a thing, the nonexistence of a nonthing, and the transformation of both, and as the transformation of a thing and the nonexistence of a nonthing, like the Sāṃkhyas.🔽Some imagine impermanence as the transformation of a thing, the transformation of a nonthing, the transformation of both, the nonexistence of a thing, the nonexistence of a nonthing, the transformation of both, the transformation of a thing, and the nonexistence of a nonthing, like the Lokāyatas.

original: rtag par 'gyur ba dang / mi rtag par 'gyur ba dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'gyur ba dang / @229a * //
analyzed: rtag par 'gyur ba dang / mi rtag par 'gyur ba dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'gyur ba dang / @229a * //
translated: Some imagine impermanence as the transformation of a thing, the transformation of a nonthing, the transformation of both, the nonexistence of a thing, the nonexistence of a nonthing, the transformation

original: rtag par 'gyur ba yang smra bar mi bya ba dang / mi rtag par 'gyur ba yang smra bar mi bya ba dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag par 'gyur ba yang smra bar mi bya ba dang / rim pa dang rnam pa la ltos te thams cad thams cad du smra bar mi bya ba dang bdun du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtag par 'gyur ba yang smra bar mi bya ba dang / mi rtag par 'gyur ba yang smra bar mi bya ba dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag par 'gyur ba yang smra bar mi bya ba dang / rim pa dang rnam pa la ltos te thams cad thams cad du smra bar mi bya ba dang bdun du byed pa'o //
translated: One should not say that it is permanent, nor that it is impermanent, nor that it is both permanent and impermanent, nor that it is neither permanent nor impermanent.

original: dpyod pa can rnams kyi dngos po rnams ni spyi dang khyad par du tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dpyod pa can rnams kyi dngos po rnams ni spyi dang khyad par du tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The realists say that entities are differentiated as universals and particulars, and that they are undifferentiated as universals.

original: dngos po gzugs ni gcig po la //
analyzed: dngos po gzugs ni gcig po la //
translated: The form of an entity is one,

original: brtags te gzugs ni 'dod pa bzhin /🔽rim dang cig car 'jug pa yis //
analyzed: brtags te gzugs ni 'dod pa bzhin / rim dang cig car 'jug pa yis //
translated: but it is imagined to be four forms, according to desire.

original: tshig gi rnam pa gzhan med do //🔽ji ltar kha dog 'dres pa la //
analyzed: tshig gi rnam pa gzhan med do // ji ltar kha dog 'dres pa la //
translated: There is no other way of speaking🔽than by gradual or instantaneous engagement.🔽Just as a color is held to be a color

original: 'dod pa bzhin du kha dog 'dzin //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du kha dog 'dzin //
translated: according to desire, even though it is a mixture of colors,

original: de bzhin dngos po sna tshogs phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos po sna tshogs phyir //
translated: in the same way, because of the variety of entities,

original: tha dad tha dad mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: the difference and non-difference are not apprehended.

original: ji ltar su zhig gcig shes nas //
analyzed: ji ltar su zhig gcig shes nas //
translated: Just as someone, knowing one thing,

original: yang dag yang bar shes pa ni //
analyzed: yang dag yang bar shes pa ni //
translated: knows everything,

original: dus kyi tha dad mi 'byed pa //
analyzed: dus kyi tha dad mi 'byed pa //
translated: Time does not distinguish them.

original: de bzhin sgra yang mi 'byed do //🔽goms pas ji ltar gcig pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin sgra yang mi 'byed do // goms pas ji ltar gcig pa ni //
translated: Sound is not distinguished in the same way.🔽Just as by habit one goes to a different place,

original: tha dad yul du 'gror zin kyang //
analyzed: tha dad yul du 'gror zin kyang //
translated: even though it is the same,

original: tha dad yul gyis mi 'byed pa //
analyzed: tha dad yul gyis mi 'byed pa //
translated: the place is not distinguished by the difference.

original: de bzhin sgra la 'byed pa med //
analyzed: de bzhin sgra la 'byed pa med //
translated: Sound is not distinguished in the same way.

original: ces pa chos can rnams ni rtag pa la /
analyzed: ces pa chos can rnams ni rtag pa la /
translated: The subject is permanent.

original: chos rnams ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par mi rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par mi rtag pa nyid de /
translated: The properties are impermanent, not different and not non-different.

original: nyam chung ba dang / nyams che ba'i lha sbyin yang de 'di nyid do //
analyzed: nyam chung ba dang / nyams che ba'i lha sbyin yang de 'di nyid do //
translated: The weak and strong Devadatta are just that.

original: yi ge yang ring po dang thung du de nyid do //
analyzed: yi ge yang ring po dang thung du de nyid do //
translated: The letters are just long and short.

original: gzhan gyi rang gis mi rtag pa nyid dang gis ni mi rtag pa nyid ces te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang gis mi rtag pa nyid dang gis ni mi rtag pa nyid ces te /
translated: The other is impermanent by nature and impermanent by itself.

original: dpyod pa can lo rgyus la ni tha dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa can lo rgyus la ni tha dad pa med pa'o //
translated: The Naiyāyikas do not distinguish them.

original: gzugs 'gyur ba mi rtag pa nyid ni smra ba po thams cad la mtshungs te bum pa me dang phrad pa na sngo ba ni ldog / dmar pa ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs 'gyur ba mi rtag pa nyid ni smra ba po thams cad la mtshungs te bum pa me dang phrad pa na sngo ba ni ldog / dmar pa ni skye ba'o //
translated: The impermanence of changing form is the same for all speakers. When a pot meets fire, the blue stops and the red arises.

original: skye ba mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas de'i tshe la sogs pa'i rdzas rtag pa de dag la gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba mi rtag pa nyid ni dngos po thams cad kyi nang du 'dus pas de'i tshe la sogs pa'i rdzas rtag pa de dag la gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: Since birth is included among all impermanent things, at that time those permanent substances such as life are not different from impermanent things.

original: rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i snga ma'i rnam pa bzhin du phyi ma'i rang bzhin skye ba ste /
analyzed: rdul phra mo la sogs pa'i snga ma'i rnam pa bzhin du phyi ma'i rang bzhin skye ba ste /
translated: The nature of the later moment arises in the same way as the previous nature of the subtle particle and so on.🔽The nature of the later moment arises in the same way as the previous nature of the subtle particle and so on.

original: phrad pa'i dus dang 'bral ba'i dus su yang rang bzhin gzhan skye ba ni de dag gi de lta bur mi rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: phrad pa'i dus dang 'bral ba'i dus su yang rang bzhin gzhan skye ba ni de dag gi de lta bur mi rtag pa nyid de /
translated: At the time of contact and at the time of separation, the nature of the later moment arises in the same way as the previous nature of the subtle particle and so on.

original: phrad pa dang bral bar tha dad par 'byed pa na byed pa med pa rnams kyi byed pa skye ba na de bzhin du g-yo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid rnams yul gzhan du 'pho ba'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid @229b thob po //
analyzed: phrad pa dang bral bar tha dad par 'byed pa na byed pa med pa rnams kyi byed pa skye ba na de bzhin du g-yo ba med pa'i mtshan nyid rnams yul gzhan du 'pho ba'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid @229b thob po //
translated: When they are differentiated as separate, contact and separation, the activity of those that are devoid of activity arises. In that case, those that are characterized by immobility obtain a nature that is a special kind of movement to another place.

original: g-yos pa dang / g-yos pa med pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i dus kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rnams la gcig par mi rigs te /
analyzed: g-yos pa dang / g-yos pa med pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i dus kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa rnams la gcig par mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical that those that possess the characteristics of different times, such as movement and immobility, are the same.

original: shing dang thal ba la sogs pa dang 'o ma dang zho dang mar sar pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shing dang thal ba la sogs pa dang 'o ma dang zho dang mar sar pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like wood, ashes, etc., and milk, curd, fresh butter, etc.

original: des na thog ma dang tha ma'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par tha dad par phye na rim pa dang / yul dang dus tha dad par phye ba'i khyad par gyis skye ba de dag rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyis skad cig pa thob par yid ches so //
analyzed: des na thog ma dang tha ma'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par tha dad par phye na rim pa dang / yul dang dus tha dad par phye ba'i khyad par gyis skye ba de dag rang bzhin gyi khyad par gyis skad cig pa thob par yid ches so //
translated: Therefore, if one analyzes the difference in the nature of the beginning and end, one will believe that the arising of those things that are analyzed as having different stages, places, and times are momentary by nature.

original: rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rim pas rdul phra mo'i rnams sngar phrad par 'byung ba rnam par 'jig pa yang rdul gsum la sogs pa'i rim gyis yin te /
analyzed: rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rim pas rdul phra mo'i rnams sngar phrad par 'byung ba rnam par 'jig pa yang rdul gsum la sogs pa'i rim gyis yin te /
translated: The destruction of the arising of the atoms, etc., by the stages of the dyads, etc., is also by the stages of the triads, etc.

original: de ltar na skye ba mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na skye ba mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, arising is impermanence.

original: de dag la nam rdul phra mo'i mthar thug par yan lag dang bral bar 'gyur ba de na skye ba med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid du thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: de dag la nam rdul phra mo'i mthar thug par yan lag dang bral bar 'gyur ba de na skye ba med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid du thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
translated: When they reach the ultimate atom, which is partless, then the non-arising of all things should be considered the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: de bzhin du yang sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra mo rnams rtag pa nyid na su mi rtag par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang sa la sogs pa'i rdul phra mo rnams rtag pa nyid na su mi rtag par 'gyur /
translated: Likewise, if the subtle particles of earth, etc. are permanent, what is impermanent?

original: rdul phra mo ma gtogs par sbom po'i rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra mo ma gtogs par sbom po'i rdzas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no gross substance apart from the subtle particles.

original: btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs par phye ba dang / phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ba na khang pa dang sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
analyzed: btsos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs par phye ba dang / phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ba na khang pa dang sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
translated: When the gross is distinguished as cooked or uncooked, shaken or unshaken, covered or uncovered, etc., and when it is distinguished as having different directional parts, then it is like a house, an army, a forest, etc., and does not exist as a real entity.

original: ne yi ya yi ka dang khyad par can la sogs pa rnams kyi byed pa dang ldan pa'i 'dus pa'i rdul phra mo rnams kyang cha tha dad par phye ba ni rtag pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ne yi ya yi ka dang khyad par can la sogs pa rnams kyi byed pa dang ldan pa'i 'dus pa'i rdul phra mo rnams kyang cha tha dad par phye ba ni rtag pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One has in mind that the subtle particles of the Saṃkhyas, Vaiśeṣikas, etc., which are endowed with activity, also do not exist as permanent, when distinguished as having different parts.

original: grangs can dang ksha pa na ka la sogs pa rnams la ni med pa mi skyel med pa mi 'gag pa ste /
analyzed: grangs can dang ksha pa na ka la sogs pa rnams la ni med pa mi skyel med pa mi 'gag pa ste /
translated: For the Sāṃkhyas, Kāśmīri Vaibhāṣikas, etc., the non-existent does not arise and the non-existent does not cease.

original: yan lag can dang / yon tan dang las rnams sngar med pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa med do zhe na su'i mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yan lag can dang / yon tan dang las rnams sngar med pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa med do zhe na su'i mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: If you say that the whole, the quality, and the action do not have a prior non-existence that is origination and destruction, then whose impermanence is it?

original: de de ltar na mu stegs byed thams cad kyi mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig mar 'jig pa ma gtog par rdzas dang yon tan dang las dang spyi dang khyad par la sogs pa rnams kyi ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de de ltar na mu stegs byed thams cad kyi mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig mar 'jig pa ma gtog par rdzas dang yon tan dang las dang spyi dang khyad par la sogs pa rnams kyi ni mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, for all the non-Buddhist schools, impermanence is not tenable for substances, qualities, actions, universals, particularities, etc., except for momentary destruction.

original: yod pa dang med pa las skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽dngos po mi rtag pa'i phyir mi rtag pa tha dad pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las skye ba med pa'i phyir ro // dngos po mi rtag pa'i phyir mi rtag pa tha dad pa mi rung ste /
translated: Because origination from existent and non-existent things does not exist.

original: dngos @230a * //
analyzed: dngos @230a * //
translated: Because things are impermanent, impermanence that is different is not tenable.

original: po gzhan skye ba na snga ma'i dngos po ci'i phyir na rnam par 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: po gzhan skye ba na snga ma'i dngos po ci'i phyir na rnam par 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: When another thing is produced, why does the prior thing disintegrate?

original: 'on te rang nyid mi ldog na gnas pa can ni sus kyang rnam par gzhig par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te rang nyid mi ldog na gnas pa can ni sus kyang rnam par gzhig par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does not revert to itself, then no one can destroy that which has endurance.

original: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yang mi rtag pa nyid du bya mi nus te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yang mi rtag pa nyid du bya mi nus te /
translated: Also, impermanence cannot be made to have the characteristic of a non-thing.

original: dngos po med pa byed pas na byed pa nyid dag par byas par gyur par rtogs so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa byed pas na byed pa nyid dag par byas par gyur par rtogs so //
translated: Since it is the cause of the non-existence of entities, it is understood to be the cause of the purification of action.

original: de'i phyir rim pa dang / dbyibs dang yon tan dang las dang / spyi dang khyad par dang / chos gzhan du skye ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig mar 'jig pa ma gtogs par mi rung ngo zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //🔽phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir gnyis kyi rnam pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / bya ba dang byed pa por mngon par 'brel pa kun brtags pa thams cad mi rung ste thog ma med pa'i sems de bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang rab rib kyi rnam pa dang gzugs brnyan
analyzed: de'i phyir rim pa dang / dbyibs dang yon tan dang las dang / spyi dang khyad par dang / chos gzhan du skye ba'i mi rtag pa nyid ni skad cig mar 'jig pa ma gtogs par mi rung ngo zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o // phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir gnyis kyi rnam pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / bya ba dang byed pa por mngon par 'brel pa kun brtags pa thams cad mi rung ste thog ma med pa'i sems de bzhin nyid ma yin pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthu las rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang rab rib kyi rnam pa dang gzugs brnyan
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One intended that order, shape, quality, action, generality, particularity, and other phenomena are not tenable as impermanent apart from momentary destruction.

original: la sogs pa bzhin du byis pa rnams la gnyis kyi rnam pa'i 'khor so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: la sogs pa bzhin du byis pa rnams la gnyis kyi rnam pa'i 'khor so sor snang ngo //
translated: Because external objects do not exist, all imagined things that are related as cause and effect in the aspect of duality, and as action and agent, are untenable. Like dreams, illusions, the aspects of eye disease, and reflections, etc., the circle of the aspect of duality appears separately to fools due to the power of the maturation of beginningless predispositions that are not suchness.

original: de la gzhan gyi dbang gi shes pa la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos gang rtog pa de dag ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dbang gi shes pa la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos gang rtog pa de dag ni mi rung ste /
translated: In this regard, the phenomena of arising, enduring, ceasing, etc., that are imagined in the dependent consciousness are not tenable.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus kyi gnas tha dad pa dang bral ba skad cig pa snang ba ni mngon sum nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus kyi gnas tha dad pa dang bral ba skad cig pa snang ba ni mngon sum nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the momentary appearance, which is free from the difference of location in the prior and subsequent times, is direct perception itself.

original: der skad cig pa drug tu gnas pa'am /
analyzed: der skad cig pa drug tu gnas pa'am /
translated: Whether it endures for six moments or

original: skad cig pa drug cu rtsa bzhir gnas pa yang rung ste mi rtogs so //
analyzed: skad cig pa drug cu rtsa bzhir gnas pa yang rung ste mi rtogs so //
translated: whether it endures for sixty-four moments, it is not cognized.

original: ji ltar se gol gyi sgra la der mngon sum nyid chad ma'o //
analyzed: ji ltar se gol gyi sgra la der mngon sum nyid chad ma'o //
translated: Just as the sound of a finger snap is direct perception itself, without interruption.

original: rim du snang ba med pa'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bya ba dang byed pa po la sogs par 'brel par kun brtags pa rnams skad cig ma gtogs par dngos po gzhan med do //
analyzed: rim du snang ba med pa'i phyir skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams la bya ba dang byed pa po la sogs par 'brel par kun brtags pa rnams skad cig ma gtogs par dngos po gzhan med do //
translated: Apart from the moment, there is no other thing that is related to the phenomena of arising, enduring, ceasing, etc., as action and agent, etc., which are imagined in that.

original: ji ltar dge 'dun chen po ba rnams kyis klog pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dge 'dun chen po ba rnams kyis klog pa /
translated: Just as the Mahāsāṃghikas recite:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All formations are momentary.

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang 'byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang 'byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: How can it be unstable? That which arises is just that which acts.

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: And that is also called the agent.

original: ces so // rdul phra mo rnams dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don med pas de 'pho ba'i dus la skad cig drug gi mtshan nyid kyi skad cig pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ces so // rdul phra mo rnams dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi don med pas de 'pho ba'i dus la skad cig drug gi mtshan nyid kyi skad cig pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the subtle particles are beyond the senses, and there are no external objects, the momentariness characterized by six moments is not possible in the context of their transference.

original: @230b yongs su grub pa gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i chud pa der yang skad cig ma'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: @230b yongs su grub pa gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i chud pa der yang skad cig ma'i rgyun yang dag par rig pa ste /
translated: In that cognition free from the aspects of the two thoroughly established natures, the continuum of moments is perfectly known.

original: der brjod du med pas skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa der mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: der brjod du med pas skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa der mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since it is inexpressible there, the conceptual thoughts of arising, abiding, ceasing, and so on do not occur there.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad pas phye ste shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i de nas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad pas phye ste shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i de nas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa /
translated: When, through analysis with wisdom, the coarse and subtle are distinguished by the different directional parts and are not observed as objects of cognition, then there is no thought and no appearance.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa yang dag par rig pa /
translated: The ultimate truth, nondual and perfectly known,🔽is the ultimate reality of all phenomena.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa nyid gnas so //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa nyid gnas so //
translated: He abides in the non-conceptuality of entity and non-entity.

original: de yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus kyi sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal med pa la sogs tha dad pa dang / sred pa dang thar pa tha dad pas 'byed pa na skad cig ma'i rgyun 'byung ba bstan te /
analyzed: de yang snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus kyi sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal med pa la sogs tha dad pa dang / sred pa dang thar pa tha dad pas 'byed pa na skad cig ma'i rgyun 'byung ba bstan te /
translated: Moreover, when he distinguishes the former and latter times, the suffering and non-suffering, etc., and the craving and liberation, he teaches the arising of the stream of moments.

original: gser rin po che la sogs pa bzhin du snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gser rin po che la sogs pa bzhin du snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du gnas pa ste /
translated: Like gold, a precious gem, etc., he abides in the concentration of non-appearance.

original: mig la sogs pa'i yul dang bral zhing /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i yul dang bral zhing /
translated: He is free from the objects of the eye, etc.

original: skad cig pa gzhan du gser la sogs pa bzhin du mtshams sbyor bar byed pa nyid de mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lag mthil gyi sgra la sogs pa lta bur ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig pa gzhan du gser la sogs pa bzhin du mtshams sbyor bar byed pa nyid de mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lag mthil gyi sgra la sogs pa lta bur ni ma yin no //
translated: Like gold, etc., he is connected to another moment, but not like the sound of a palm-string, etc., to the consciousness of the eye, etc.

original: de'i phyir mu stegs byed thams cad kyi rtag pa dang bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang dang / longs spyod pa po ji lta bu yin pa de lta bu byed pa dang / longs spyod pa po dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir mu stegs byed thams cad kyi rtag pa dang bdag dang / byed pa po dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang dang / longs spyod pa po ji lta bu yin pa de lta bu byed pa dang / longs spyod pa po dang /
translated: Therefore, the permanence, self, creator, Brahmā, Īśvara, and so on of all tīrthikas, the creator and enjoyer of all,

original: dbang po ni sems nyid de sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bas na chud pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bde bar gshegs pa dang / gtogs 'dod dang / lha chen po dang / tshangs pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dag pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po ni sems nyid de sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bas na chud pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bde bar gshegs pa dang / gtogs 'dod dang / lha chen po dang / tshangs pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi dbang po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dag pa yin te /
translated: the sense faculties are the mind itself. Since all sentient beings are the essence of the tathāgata, the nature of the essence is the sugata, Īśvara, Maheśvara, Brahmā, Īśvara, and so on.

original: spyi dang khyad par du brtags na de bzhin no //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par du brtags na de bzhin no //
translated: When examined in general and in particular, that is so.

original: des na / chud pa byed pa'i sbyin pa zhi srid pa //
analyzed: des na / chud pa byed pa'i sbyin pa zhi srid pa //
translated: Therefore, the creator of the essence is the generosity of peace and existence.

original: yul phyad spyad po de dbang sna tshogs te //
analyzed: yul phyad spyad po de dbang sna tshogs te //
translated: The various sense faculties are the enjoyer of the object.

original: bde gshegs 'phrog 'phrog can tshangs rnal 'byor dbang //
analyzed: bde gshegs 'phrog 'phrog can tshangs rnal 'byor dbang //
translated: The tathāgatas, Īśvara, Brahmā, and Īśvara are the nature of purity.

original: de las tha dad sa chu me rlung gis /
analyzed: de las tha dad sa chu me rlung gis /
translated: Earth, water, fire, and wind are different from that.

original: brtsams pa'i 'jig rten lus ni ma yin te //
analyzed: brtsams pa'i 'jig rten lus ni ma yin te //
translated: The world that is created is not the body.

original: sbom po phyogs kyi chas ni stong pa ste //
analyzed: sbom po phyogs kyi chas ni stong pa ste //
translated: The world is empty of the parts of the directions.

original: nam mkha' las ni skyes pa'i me tog bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkha' las ni skyes pa'i me tog bzhin //
translated: Like a flower born from the sky,

original: ma skyes pa ni rtag tu yod pa min //🔽'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal @231a * //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni rtag tu yod pa min // 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal @231a * //
translated: The unborn is never existent.

original: bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las mi rtag pa nyid dpyad pa bcu bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las mi rtag pa nyid dpyad pa bcu bdun pa'o //
translated: The third chapter of the commentary on the noble Descent into Laṅkā, called “The Lamp for the Path to Awakening,” is finished.

original: sha thang ste mthar phyin pa'i rgya mtsho lta bu le'u gsum pa rdzogs sho /
analyzed: sha thang ste mthar phyin pa'i rgya mtsho lta bu le'u gsum pa rdzogs sho /
translated: The third chapter, which is like the ocean, is complete.

original: // / rin chen 'byung gnas rgyal mthar phyin mthong nas //
analyzed: // / rin chen 'byung gnas rgyal mthar phyin mthong nas //
translated: Having seen the end of the ocean of the exhaustion of flesh,

original: rgyal dga' yun ring nan tan dbugs phyin thob //
analyzed: rgyal dga' yun ring nan tan dbugs phyin thob //
translated: The king was delighted and obtained the sigh of relief of long-standing practice.

original: ded dpon bzhin du bdag gis dga' sa rnyed //
analyzed: ded dpon bzhin du bdag gis dga' sa rnyed //
translated: Like a captain, I have found delight.

original: mdo sde'i don ni bdag dang gzhan gyi blo //
analyzed: mdo sde'i don ni bdag dang gzhan gyi blo //
translated: The meaning of the sūtras, the mind of self and other,

original: rgyas shing smra ba du mas brjod pa las //
analyzed: rgyas shing smra ba du mas brjod pa las //
translated: Having been expanded and spoken by many,

original: thugs rje yis ni gzhan la phan mdzad pa //
analyzed: thugs rje yis ni gzhan la phan mdzad pa //
translated: Through compassion, benefitting others,

original: rab byams mchod byed dpal bzang de ltar ro //
analyzed: rab byams mchod byed dpal bzang de ltar ro //
translated: Is like that of the glorious good one who makes offerings out of love.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāmati made a request to the Blessed One:

original: 'gog pa'i go rims kyis mtshams sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i go rims kyis mtshams sbyar ba'i mtshan nyid la mkhas pa gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the sequence of cessation, what is the characteristic of skill in the characteristics of the cessation of the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas?

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i lan ni blo gros chen pos drug nas bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la /
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pa'i lan ni blo gros chen pos drug nas bzung ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la /
translated: To that, the omniscient one's reply is: Mahāmati asked, and the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ste zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ste zhes pa'o //
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas enter into the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: sa drug tu rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba so sor rtog cing ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gog par snyoms par 'jug pa na 'khor ba las skyo nas rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa drug tu rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba so sor rtog cing ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gog par snyoms par 'jug pa na 'khor ba las skyo nas rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the six grounds, they discern dependent origination and enter into the meditative absorption of the cessation of ignorance and so forth, becoming weary of saṃsāra and abiding in the bliss of complete peace.

original: bdun la ni sems skad cig sems skad cig la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid gsal bas snyoms par 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis dpyad pas dngos po rnams kyi mtshan ma'i
analyzed: bdun la ni sems skad cig sems skad cig la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid gsal bas snyoms par 'jug ste zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyis dpyad pas dngos po rnams kyi mtshan ma'i
translated: On the seventh, the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas enter into meditative concentration on the nature of the identity of all things, moment after moment of thought.

original: gnas dang / mtshan ma'i dngos po mi rung ste /
analyzed: gnas dang / mtshan ma'i dngos po mi rung ste /
translated: This is because, through the analysis of wisdom, the sign of things is not suitable as a basis or as a thing with a sign.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las /
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
analyzed: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
translated: If the characterized were different,

original: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: the characteristic would be without a characterized.

original: gcig na de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
analyzed: gcig na de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
translated: If they were the same, those two would not be established.

original: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
analyzed: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
translated: If they were different, there would be no other.

original: ces pa'o // ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ces pa'o // ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs te /
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs te /
translated: The characteristic of form is permanent.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas mtshan nyid ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And that the Tathagata has fully awakened to as not being a characteristic.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ma yin @231b no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshan nyid med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams ma yin @231b no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshan nyid med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: The sūtra says that the samādhi of signlessness is not entered by them.

original: ci'i slad du zhes pa dang thams cad mkhyen pas rgyu gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i slad du zhes pa dang thams cad mkhyen pas rgyu gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: Why is that? The omniscient one states another reason:

original: de dag gis 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gis 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa can gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba'o //
translated: Their entry into the absorption of cessation is characterized by manifest effort, falling into the signs of grasped and grasper.

original: rgyu gnyis kyis 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ste /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis kyis 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid du lhung ste /
translated: By two causes, the noble śrāvakas’ entry into the absorption of cessation is characterized by manifest effort.

original: phyi rol gyi mtshan nyid du mngon par chags pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i dus na phyi rol gyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi mtshan nyid du mngon par chags pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i dus na phyi rol gyi mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are attached to external signs and when they arise from meditative absorption, they grasp external signs.

original: btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par ni shes rab kyis dpyad pas 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i mtshan ma mi mthong ste /
analyzed: btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa'i khyad par ni shes rab kyis dpyad pas 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i mtshan ma mi mthong ste /
translated: The difference of the bodhisattva who is the chief of the venerable is that, by the analysis of wisdom, he does not see the signs of subject and object.

original: de ltar na de dag la yang nan tan med par bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sems skad cig sems skad cig la yod mod kyi sems can gyi don du snag ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag la yang nan tan med par bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin sems skad cig sems skad cig la yod mod kyi sems can gyi don du snag ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Thus, even for them, without the earnest practice, the samādhi of non-appearance and non-thought exists in every moment of thought. However, for the sake of sentient beings, they enter into the samādhi of appearance.

original: cis na dus thams cad du snang ba med pa nyid du snyoms par mi 'jug ces de skad du thugs dogs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: cis na dus thams cad du snang ba med pa nyid du snyoms par mi 'jug ces de skad du thugs dogs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Why is it that they do not always enter into the samādhi of non-appearance? Having thought this, he says:

original: de bas na de dag ni chos thams cad bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni chos thams cad bye brag med pa'i mtshan nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, they attain the characteristic of the non-distinction of all phenomena.

original: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dus thams cad du gnas na ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la tha dad par phye bas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi khyad par dang / sems can gyi don du snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnams med par sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro /
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dus thams cad du gnas na ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la tha dad par phye bas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi khyad par dang / sems can gyi don du snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnams med par sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro /
translated: If one were to remain at all times in the concentration of no appearance, one would become a buddha without the distinctions of the accumulations of merit and wisdom that come from the different levels and transcendent perfections and without the distinctions of the concentration of appearance for the sake of sentient beings.

original: sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid med par thob par 'gyur zhes pa ni snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid med par thob par 'gyur zhes pa ni snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: One would attain the absence of the characteristics of multiplicity, which is the concentration of no appearance.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo mi sems shing mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo mi sems shing mi dmigs so //
translated: One would not be thinking or observing the coarse and subtle aspects that are to be understood through analysis with wisdom.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid khong du chud pas zhes pa ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin te spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba yongs su shes nas sa gong nas gong ma'i khyad par rnams kyis snyoms par 'jug🔽pa yin no //🔽sa bcus spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa bag chags dang bcas pa mnyam par @232a * //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid khong du chud pas zhes pa ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin te spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba yongs su shes nas sa gong nas gong ma'i khyad par rnams kyis snyoms par 'jug pa yin no // sa bcus spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa bag chags dang bcas pa mnyam par @232a * //
translated: By penetrating the individual characteristics of virtue and nonvirtue is the meditative stabilization with appearances. Having fully understood what is to be abandoned and what is to be adopted, one enters into meditative equipoise by means of the distinctions of the higher and lower levels.

original: mi 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can dang shes rab kyis dpyad de nyon mongs pa dang las kyi sgrib pa spang bar bya ba chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas spong ngo //
analyzed: mi 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can dang shes rab kyis dpyad de nyon mongs pa dang las kyi sgrib pa spang bar bya ba chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas spong ngo //
translated: By means of the ten levels, one abandons the ignorance that is not an affliction, along with its imprints, which is characterized by non-equipoise. By means of wisdom, one abandons the obscurations of affliction and karma by fully understanding the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: bdag tu chags pa med pa'i phyir gzung ba rnam par ldog go //
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa med pa'i phyir gzung ba rnam par ldog go //
translated: Because there is no attachment to a self, the apprehended is reversed.

original: gzung ba thams cad yongs su spangs pas sems can thams cad snying rjes rjes su yongs su gzung ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gzung ba thams cad yongs su spangs pas sems can thams cad snying rjes rjes su yongs su gzung ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The perfection of generosity is the accumulation of merit, because it completely embraces all sentient beings with compassion, while completely abandoning all grasping.

original: gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir mi gnyis pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir mi gnyis pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the purity of morality, because it is nondual, free from the concepts of duality.

original: de de bzhin du gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas 'khrugs pa med pa'i phyir bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin du gnyis su med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas 'khrugs pa med pa'i phyir bzod pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is patience, because it is unshakable, since one has attained nondual meditative absorption.

original: mi gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa'i phyir brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor la brtson pa'i phyir brtson 'grus so //
translated: The perfection of effort is effort, because one is dedicated to the nondual yoga.

original: gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni bsam gtan no //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni bsam gtan no //
translated: The perfection of meditation is meditation, because the one-pointed mind is nondual, free from the concepts of duality.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad de 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i mtshan ma la mi dmigs shing bsam pa med pa dang / snang ba med cing mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad de 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i mtshan ma la mi dmigs shing bsam pa med pa dang / snang ba med cing mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid ni shes rab bo //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is wisdom, because it is nondual, free from the concepts of duality, and because it is the nonconceptual, nonapparent, nondual reality that is analyzed by wisdom and not apprehended as the signs of either subject or object.

original: bdun du ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun khong du chud pas kyang snying rje ba'i phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can gyi don byed do //
analyzed: bdun du ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun khong du chud pas kyang snying rje ba'i phyir shes rab dang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can gyi don byed do //
translated: In the seventh, they are compassionate because they have mastered the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment. Thus, by the perfections of wisdom and means, they work for the welfare of living beings.

original: brgyad du sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba mi 'byung bar rtogs shing /
analyzed: brgyad du sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba mi 'byung bar rtogs shing /
translated: In the eighth, they realize that dependent origination is like an illusion and does not occur.

original: byed pa dang byed pa po dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang bral ba dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog cing snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa rnams thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyi phyir sad par mdzad pa /
analyzed: byed pa dang byed pa po dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang bral ba dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog cing snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa rnams thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyi phyir sad par mdzad pa /
translated: Free from action, agent, apprehender, and apprehended, they do not conceptualize non-entity and abide in the concentration of non-appearance. They are awakened by the omniscient ones.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing 'jig rten thams cad la dmigs te gzhan gyi don du smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing 'jig rten thams cad la dmigs te gzhan gyi don du smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: They enter into the concentration of appearance and focus on the entire world. For the sake of others, they perfect the perfection of aspiration.

original: dgur ni chos dang don dang nges tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas sems can gyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba shes pa'i phyir chos ston pas stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed
analyzed: dgur ni chos dang don dang nges tshig dang spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas sems can gyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba shes pa'i phyir chos ston pas stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed
translated: On the ninth, by attaining the samadhi of the analytical knowledges of dharma, meaning, etymological interpretation, and confidence, he teaches the Dharma by knowing the thoughts and dispositions of sentient beings, and thus perfects the perfection of power.

original: do // bcur ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad rnyed cing bsod nams dang ye @232b shes kyi tshogs kyi khyad par thob pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ye shes kyi pha🔽rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: do // bcur ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad rnyed cing bsod nams dang ye @232b shes kyi tshogs kyi khyad par thob pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: On the tenth, he attains the samadhis of light and no light, and by attaining the special accumulations of merit and wisdom, he perfects the perfection of wisdom for attaining omniscience.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos thams cad du dbang bskur bar dbang bskur ba dang / rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams kyi chos thams cad la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos thams cad du dbang bskur bar dbang bskur ba dang / rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams kyi chos thams cad la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus he is consecrated with the consecration of omniscience in all dharmas, and he enters into the equanimity of all dharmas as a lord of yoga.

original: sa dang po dang sa drug la ni khams gsum pa sems dang yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam ste zhes pa ni khams gsum mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sa dang po dang sa drug la ni khams gsum pa sems dang yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa tsam ste zhes pa ni khams gsum mthong ba ste /
translated: On the first and sixth grounds, one sees the three realms as mind, mentation, and consciousness.🔽As for that,

original: de la / sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
analyzed: de la / sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
translated: mind is the foundation consciousness.

original: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
analyzed: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
translated: Mentation is the very thought of “I.”

original: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
translated: That which apprehends objects

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
translated: is called consciousness.

original: zhes pas na khams gsum sems tsam du mthong ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pas na khams gsum sems tsam du mthong ba ste /
translated: Thus, one sees the three realms as mind only.

original: phyi rol gyi don med par sems nyid bslad pa'i mthu las gnyis kyi rnam par snang ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med par sems nyid bslad pa'i mthu las gnyis kyi rnam par snang ngo //
translated: Without external objects, the mind itself appears in the aspect of duality through the power of delusion.🔽The three realms are devoid of self and “mine.”

original: khams gsum pa bdag dang bdag gi med pa ni gnyis su smra ba rnams kyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa'i brtag pa'i skyes bu mang ngo //
analyzed: khams gsum pa bdag dang bdag gi med pa ni gnyis su smra ba rnams kyi bdag tu rnam par rtog pa'i brtag pa'i skyes bu mang ngo //
translated: The non-Buddhists imagine many selves.

original: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa skyes bu gcig tu rnam par brtags pa de lta bu ni sems kyi rgyud ma gtogs par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa skyes bu gcig tu rnam par brtags pa de lta bu ni sems kyi rgyud ma gtogs par mi rung ngo //
translated: The non-Buddhists who speak of non-duality imagine a single being such as Brahmā or Īśvara.

original: rtag pa ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med do //
analyzed: rtag pa ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med do //
translated: Since it is permanent and unarisen, it does not exist, like the son of a barren woman.

original: gnyis su med par smra ba rnams la ni grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes lan du mar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med par smra ba rnams la ni grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes lan du mar bshad pa'o //
translated: For those who advocate nonduality, the error of oneness would follow for liberation and nonliberation, for the rich and the poor, and so on.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas sa dang po dang drug tu gnyis su med pa'i sems kyi skad cig gi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas sa dang po dang drug tu gnyis su med pa'i sems kyi skad cig gi ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Having fully understood the selflessness of phenomena and persons, one enters into the meditative concentration of the nondual mind on the first and sixth stages.

original: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said here:

original: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
analyzed: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
translated: The seven stages are the mind.

original: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the meditative concentration of nonappearance.

original: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te //
analyzed: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te //
translated: The two stages are the abode.

original: sa gzhan nga yi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sa gzhan nga yi rang bzhin no //
translated: The other stages are my nature.

original: zhes pa'o // dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ni sa brgyad du snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ni sa brgyad du snyoms par 'jug pa ste /
translated: In the meditative concentration of nonappearance, which is nonconceptual regarding entity and nonentity, one enters into meditative concentration on the eighth stage.

original: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said here:

original: dngos med dngos po med kyang min //
analyzed: dngos med dngos po med kyang min //
translated: Non-entity is not non-existent as an entity.

original: yod dang med par mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: yod dang med par mi dmigs pa //
translated: Existence and non-existence are not observed.

original: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan du //
analyzed: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan du //
translated: This is the practice of the middle way,

original: nga dang gzhan gyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: nga dang gzhan gyis bshad pa'o //
translated: Taught by me and others.

original: @233a * // zhes pa 'di ni dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: @233a * // zhes pa 'di ni dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the concentration of the middle way.

original: rnam par shes pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: The concentration of consciousness is as stated here:

original: phyi yi dngos po bsal nas su //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po bsal nas su //
translated: Having eliminated external entities,

original: shes pa tsam du 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: shes pa tsam du 'jug pa ste //
translated: One engages in mere consciousness.

original: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan du //
analyzed: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan du //
translated: This is the practice of the middle way,

original: nga dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nga dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
translated: Taught by me and others.

original: zhes bya ba ste de ltar sems dang yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho nar rnam par rtog pa ni sa brgyad du dngos po dang dngos po med pa la rnam par mi rtog pa snang ba med pa'i dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin ni ldog go
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste de ltar sems dang yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa kho nar rnam par rtog pa ni sa brgyad du dngos po dang dngos po med pa la rnam par mi rtog pa snang ba med pa'i dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin ni ldog go
translated: Thus, the conceptualization as only mind, thought, and mental consciousness ceases on the eighth ground, and the non-conceptual concentration of the middle way, free from appearances, regarding entity and non-entity, is attained.

original: // ji ltar le'u 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: // ji ltar le'u 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: As stated in this chapter:

original: bcu po pa ni dang po yin //
analyzed: bcu po pa ni dang po yin //
translated: The tenth is the first,

original: dang po pa ni brgyad po yin //
analyzed: dang po pa ni brgyad po yin //
translated: The first is the eighth,

original: dgu po yang ni bdun pa ste //
analyzed: dgu po yang ni bdun pa ste //
translated: The ninth is the seventh,

original: bdun po pa yang brgyad po yin //
analyzed: bdun po pa yang brgyad po yin //
translated: The seven are also the eight.

original: gnyis po pa ni gsum po yin //
analyzed: gnyis po pa ni gsum po yin //
translated: The two are also the three.

original: bzhi po pa ni lnga po yin //
analyzed: bzhi po pa ni lnga po yin //
translated: The four are also the five.

original: gsum po yang ni drug yin te //
analyzed: gsum po yang ni drug yin te //
translated: The three are also the six.

original: snang ba med la rim ci yod //
analyzed: snang ba med la rim ci yod //
translated: What sequence is there in the absence of appearance?

original: ces te / gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pas sa dang por yang yod pas na snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: ces te / gang zag dang chos la bdag med par rtogs pas sa dang por yang yod pas na snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: Since the absence of appearance is also on the first stage, because of the realization of the selflessness of the person and of the dharmas, it is the samadhi of the absence of appearance.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung bar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung bar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of the conceptualization of the apprehending subject and the apprehended object.

original: sems tsam yod par mngon par chags pa ni sa brgyad pa na ldog go zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: sems tsam yod par mngon par chags pa ni sa brgyad pa na ldog go zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
translated: It should be understood that the Omniscient One has in mind that the attachment to the existence of mind only is eliminated on the eighth stage.🔽If the realization of the nonduality of the samadhi is not so, then how else would the samadhi of the absence of appearance be the faculties of the eighth stage?

original: gal te ting nge 'dzin la khyad par gnyis su med pa rtogs pa med na ni gzhan du ji ltar na sa brgyad kyi dbang po rnams kyi snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur sa brgyad du dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pa kho🔽nas khyad par te /
analyzed: gal te ting nge 'dzin la khyad par gnyis su med pa rtogs pa med na ni gzhan du ji ltar na sa brgyad kyi dbang po rnams kyi snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur sa brgyad du dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pa kho🔽nas khyad par te /
translated: The difference of the eighth stage is only the equality of entity and nonentity.

original: der dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no conceptualization of entity and non-entity there.

original: snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i sems khong du chud kyang sa bdun po'i dbang po rnams la yang rnam par shes pa yod par mngon par chags pa phra'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa sgra'i rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: snang ba med pa gnyis su med pa'i sems khong du chud kyang sa bdun po'i dbang po rnams la yang rnam par shes pa yod par mngon par chags pa phra'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa sgra'i rjes su dpag pas rjes su dpag go //
translated: Although one has penetrated the non-appearance, non-dual mind, the subtle attachment to the existence of consciousness in the faculties of the seven stages is inferred by inference from the intention of the Omniscient One, following the words.

original: snang ba med pa'i rim ci yod //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i rim ci yod //
translated: What is the sequence of non-appearance?

original: ces bya ba ni sa bcu rnams la snang ba med pa ste chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pas sa dang po'i dbang po rnams la yang phyi rol gyi don med pa'i stong pa nyid yod do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sa bcu rnams la snang ba med pa ste chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pas sa dang po'i dbang po rnams la yang phyi rol gyi don med pa'i stong pa nyid yod do //
translated: This is the non-appearance on the ten stages, the emptiness of external objects even in the faculties of the first stage due to the realization of the selflessness of phenomena and persons.

original: yongs su shes nas snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin mnyam par rtogs pa'i phyir sa bdun gyi dbang @233b po rnams kyi bar du yang gnyis mi snang ba'i sems rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yongs su shes nas snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin mnyam par rtogs pa'i phyir sa bdun gyi dbang @233b po rnams kyi bar du yang gnyis mi snang ba'i sems rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Having fully understood, the concentration of non-appearance is realized equally, up to the faculties of the seven stages, the concentration of realizing the mind of non-appearance of duality.

original: brgyad po'i dbang po rnams kyi khyad par ni dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: brgyad po'i dbang po rnams kyi khyad par ni dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The difference between the eight masteries is the concentration of nonperception, which is nonconceptual with regard to entity and nonentity.

original: 'on te de ltar na ni de bzhin du sa bcu rnams kyi snang ba med pa'i rim med pa de bzhin du lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin du phye ba med pas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rim kyang ga las 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar na ni de bzhin du sa bcu rnams kyi snang ba med pa'i rim med pa de bzhin du lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin du phye ba med pas sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rim kyang ga las 'gyur /
translated: If that is so, then the ten stages would be without the order of nonperception, and likewise, there would be no division of the bodhisattvas into those with superior concentration, and so how could there be any order of the stage of a buddha?

original: de ni der thams cad mkhyen pas snga ma nyid du spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni der thams cad mkhyen pas snga ma nyid du spangs pa ste /
translated: That is rejected by the Omniscient One in the first verse:🔽The supreme abode of the great mastery

original: dbang mchog chen po'i gnas kyi mchog /'og min gnas su rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: dbang mchog chen po'i gnas kyi mchog /'og min gnas su rnam par mdzes //
translated: is the beautiful Akaniṣṭha realm.

original: der ni theg pa rnams ston pa //
analyzed: der ni theg pa rnams ston pa //
translated: There the vehicles are taught

original: sa gzhan nga yi rang bzhin sa //
analyzed: sa gzhan nga yi rang bzhin sa //
translated: and the other stages are my nature.

original: zhes rgya cher ro //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher ro //
translated: This is stated extensively.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs tha dad pas phye ba na pha rol tu phyin pa rnams las sa'i khyad par du gyur to //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs tha dad pas phye ba na pha rol tu phyin pa rnams las sa'i khyad par du gyur to //
translated: The stages are distinguished by the different collections of merit and knowledge, and so they are different from the perfections.

original: de bzhin du yang sgrib pa thams cad la phan 'dogs nus pa'i thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang sgrib pa thams cad la phan 'dogs nus pa'i thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, he becomes omniscient, able to help all beings.

original: sa bcu'i dbang po rnams la ni ngar las g-yogs pa lta bur shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad snang ste /
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang po rnams la ni ngar las g-yogs pa lta bur shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad snang ste /
translated: On the ten grounds, the bodhisattva's mind is like a mirror, reflecting all the mandalas of the buddhas' bodies.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi khyad par ni sgrib pa med pas gsal ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi khyad par ni sgrib pa med pas gsal ba'o //
translated: The difference between the buddhas, the omniscient ones, and the Bhagavans lies in the fact that they are free of obscurations and are therefore clear.

original: de yi 'od zer sna tshogs pa ;🔽/ yid 'od zhi ba rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: de yi 'od zer sna tshogs pa ; / yid 'od zhi ba rab tu 'byung //
translated: The various rays of light🔽issue forth, pacifying the minds of beings.

original: de dag srid gsum sprul par byed //🔽srid pa gsum po kha cig sprul //
analyzed: de dag srid gsum sprul par byed // srid pa gsum po kha cig sprul //
translated: Some emanate the three worlds,🔽some emanate the three worlds

original: kha cig snga nas sprul pa ste //
analyzed: kha cig snga nas sprul pa ste //
translated: and some emanate the three worlds

original: de ni theg pa rnams ston pa //
analyzed: de ni theg pa rnams ston pa //
translated: and teach the vehicles.

original: de ni nga yi rang bzhin sa //
analyzed: de ni nga yi rang bzhin sa //
translated: This is my nature.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde 'dir rgya cher te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde 'dir rgya cher te /
translated: This is taught extensively in this sutra.

original: de lta bu der yang dbang po la sogs pas byas pa'i nyes pa ji ltar mi 'gyur de lta bu'i rnam pa ni cho 'phrul yin gyi sems can rnams la sngar med pa'i sprul pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu der yang dbang po la sogs pas byas pa'i nyes pa ji ltar mi 'gyur de lta bu'i rnam pa ni cho 'phrul yin gyi sems can rnams la sngar med pa'i sprul pa yin te /
translated: Such a transformation is a magical display, but it is not a previously nonexistent emanation for sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni de bzhin gshegs pa phyung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni de bzhin gshegs pa phyung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: Whether or not the Tathāgata has appeared, the essence of the Tathāgata in all sentient beings

original: chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid de ni ye nas gnas pa'o //
translated: is primordially present.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa'i glo bur gyis gnyis kyi rnam pa bslad pa spang bar bya ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa'i glo bur gyis gnyis kyi rnam pa bslad pa spang bar bya ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: It is the natural luminosity that is to be purified of the adventitious stains of the two obscurations,🔽which are to be eliminated by the wisdom that analyzes and understands them.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par bya ste /🔽sems can rnams kyi @234a * //
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par bya ste /🔽sems can rnams kyi @234a * //
translated: The coarse and subtle aspects of the two obscurations are to be distinguished.

original: dmigs bden bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa skad cig pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin du chud pa mang po brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid gser rin po che la sogs pa bzhin du dri ma
analyzed: dmigs bden bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa skad cig pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin du chud pa mang po brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid gser rin po che la sogs pa bzhin du dri ma
translated: The ultimate truth is the non-dual, correct understanding of the absence of the object of observation and the absence of the object of thought. It is the nature of the continuum of the instants of the many firm essences, like a precious gold, etc.,

original: med pa rnams so //
analyzed: med pa rnams so //
translated: which are stainless.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams rnal 'byor goms par byed pa na so sor bdag gis rig pa'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams rnal 'byor goms par byed pa na so sor bdag gis rig pa'i khyad par du 'gyur te /
translated: When the yogis are cultivating yoga, there is a special individual understanding.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: As the Bhagavān said:🔽“Just as the flames of a single fire

original: me gcig gi zhes pa'i shing gi me lce rnams ring po dang thung du la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me gcig gi zhes pa'i shing gi me lce rnams ring po dang thung du la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: are long and short, etc.,

original: des na brtags pa bdag dang / gcig po dang byed pa por smra ba rnams las khyad par ro //
analyzed: des na brtags pa bdag dang / gcig po dang byed pa por smra ba rnams las khyad par ro //
translated: Therefore, it is different from the proponents of the self of the imagined, the one, and the creator.

original: rtag pa dang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams ni ma skyes pa'i phyir byed pa por mi rigs te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams ni ma skyes pa'i phyir byed pa por mi rigs te /
translated: Brahmā, Īśvara, etc., are not reasonable as creators because they are not produced.

original: ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Since it is unborn, it is like the son of a barren woman.

original: gcig por ni grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa tha dad pa med pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: gcig por ni grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa tha dad pa med pa'i skyon no //
translated: The error is that there would be no difference between the liberated and the unliberated, the rich and the poor, and so on.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ji ltar na gzhan gyi sdug bsngal byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ji ltar na gzhan gyi sdug bsngal byed /
translated: If one is free from attachment, how can one cause suffering to others?

original: yang na rtsed mo la mos par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yang na rtsed mo la mos par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or else, one would be devoted to play.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig na ni de'i mi shes pa yang sus byas /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig na ni de'i mi shes pa yang sus byas /
translated: If one is not free from attachment, who created that ignorance?

original: des na ji tsam du sems mnyam par 'jog par byed pa de tsam du ma rig pa'i gdon gyi mtha' las rtag pa dang bdag gir rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du sems can rnams la snang ngo //
analyzed: des na ji tsam du sems mnyam par 'jog par byed pa de tsam du ma rig pa'i gdon gyi mtha' las rtag pa dang bdag gir rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du sems can rnams la snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, to the extent that one settles the mind in meditative equipoise, to that extent the demon of ignorance, with its various aspects of permanence and mine, will appear to sentient beings, like a whirling firebrand or a ghost.

original: gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen las chos thos nas shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
