analyzed: gang gi tshe dge ba'i bshes gnyen las chos thos nas shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When, having heard the Dharma from a spiritual friend, one analyzes it with wisdom and breaks it down into coarse and subtle parts, one does not observe it.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la gnas so //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la gnas so //
translated: At that time, one abides in the ultimate truth, which is free from thoughts and appearances.

original: snying rje'i bag chags kyis sad nas //
analyzed: snying rje'i bag chags kyis sad nas //
translated: Awakened by the latent tendencies of compassion,

original: gzhan gyi don du snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: one enters into the samādhi that has appearances for the sake of others.

original: ji ltar sa brgyad du thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis sad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sa brgyad du thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis sad par bya ba ste /
translated: Just as on the eighth ground, one is awakened by the omniscient ones.

original: gang dag la snying rje'i sa bon med pa de dag la ni snang ba med pa'i sems nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag la snying rje'i sa bon med pa de dag la ni snang ba med pa'i sems nyid mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: For those who lack the seed of compassion, nirvāṇa is the mind itself without appearances.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos @234b rnams la gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa nyan thos @234b rnams la gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said to the noble hearers:

original: de dag ting 'dzin myos pas myos //
analyzed: de dag ting 'dzin myos pas myos //
translated: They are intoxicated by the intoxication of samādhi,

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na 'khod //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na 'khod //
translated: Abiding in the uncontaminated realm.

original: ces pa'o // skad cig pa'i sems kyi rgyud 'brel ba ni brten zhing zad pa med par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ces pa'o // skad cig pa'i sems kyi rgyud 'brel ba ni brten zhing zad pa med par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: The continuum of momentary mind is connected without interruption, and the Omniscient One intends that it is not a basis and does not end.

original: yang ji ltar se gol gyi sgra dang glog la sogs pa rnams la 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan phyir mtshams sbyor ba med pa ltar sems kyi skad cig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ji ltar se gol gyi sgra dang glog la sogs pa rnams la 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan phyir mtshams sbyor ba med pa ltar sems kyi skad cig pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, just as the sound of a finger snap or lightning and so on are momentary and similar, they do not connect to another moment. The mind is not momentary.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas ni skad cig ma'i rgyun la sems rtag pa'o zhes dgongs kyi /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas ni skad cig ma'i rgyun la sems rtag pa'o zhes dgongs kyi /
translated: The Omniscient One intends that the continuum of moments is the permanent mind.

original: mu stegs byed kyi rtag pa dang gcig pa dang gnyis su med pa la ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: mu stegs byed kyi rtag pa dang gcig pa dang gnyis su med pa la ni ma yin no ;
translated: It is not the permanence, oneness, and nonduality of the tīrthikas.

original: / des na sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: / des na sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni rtag pa dang chad pa dang bral ba /
translated: Therefore, the buddhas are free from permanence and annihilation.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog cing mtha' gnyis rnam par spong ba gnyis su med pa'i sems la dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog cing mtha' gnyis rnam par spong ba gnyis su med pa'i sems la dgongs pa ste /
translated: They are free from the two extremes of conceptualizing things and nonthings. They intend the nondual mind.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: As it says in the Definitive Explanation of the Intent:

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig go zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni ston pas btags pa'i tshig go zhes pa ste /
translated: Son of a good family, this ‘conditioned’ and ‘unconditioned’ is a word for a designation by a teacher.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas ma yin par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas ma yin par dpyad pa'o //
translated: This concludes the analysis of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: blo gros chen po sa brgyad pa la ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gang gis yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar ting nge 'dzin gyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba de la rnam par 'dzin to zhes pa ni gzhan gyi don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sngon gyi
analyzed: blo gros chen po sa brgyad pa la ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa yin te / byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gang gis yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar ting nge 'dzin gyis sangs rgyas rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba de la rnam par 'dzin to zhes pa ni gzhan gyi don du byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sngon gyi
translated: Mahāmati, on the eighth ground, it is the nirvāṇa of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.🔽Bodhisattvas, by means of samādhi, take hold of the bliss of the samādhi of the buddhas, by which they do not pass into complete nirvāṇa.

original: smon lam dang snying rje'i sa bon yod pas so //
analyzed: smon lam dang snying rje'i sa bon yod pas so //
translated: This is because bodhisattvas have the seed of compassion and previous aspirations for the sake of others.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis rab tu sad par mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis rab tu sad par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, they are awakened by the omniscient ones.

original: gzhan du ni sems can gyi bya ba yang rgyun chad par 'gyur zhing 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir nan tan mi byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni sems can gyi bya ba yang rgyun chad par 'gyur zhing 'tshang rgya ba'i phyir nan tan mi byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the activities of sentient beings would be interrupted and they would not strive for enlightenment.

original: gal te phyir sad par mi mdzad na /
analyzed: gal te phyir sad par mi mdzad na /
translated: If he did not awaken from that absorption,

original: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi gdung yang chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi gdung yang chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the lineage of the Tathāgata would be broken.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos gang dag la snying rje'i sa bon yod pa yang rab tu sad pa na sangs rgyas su bsgyur nus kyi zhi ba phyogs gcig gi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni ma yin no //🔽ji ltar dgongs pa nges par @235a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos gang dag la snying rje'i sa bon yod pa yang rab tu sad pa na sangs rgyas su bsgyur nus kyi zhi ba phyogs gcig gi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni ma yin no // ji ltar dgongs pa nges par @235a * //
translated: Even those noble śrāvakas who have the seed of compassion can be turned into buddhas when it is awakened, but those who are free from attachment to the one-sided peace of nirvāṇa cannot.

original: 'grel pa las /
analyzed: 'grel pa las /
translated: As the noble Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says,

original: tshig gi dbang pos yongs su gsol pa /
analyzed: tshig gi dbang pos yongs su gsol pa /
translated: the Lord of Speech requested,

original: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: “Omniscient one, please explain🔽the bodhisattva levels,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag sangs rgyas kyi che ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag sangs rgyas kyi che ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang ston te /
translated: the inconceivable greatness of the buddha bhagavāns,

original: de'i phyir de dag yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da'o //
translated: Therefore, they do not pass into complete nirvana.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bde bas phrogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bde bas phrogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas are carried away by the bliss of samadhi.

original: de bas na de dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they have the idea of nirvana.

original: ji ltar bdun brgya pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar bdun brgya pa las /
translated: As the Sapta§atikd says,

original: 'di nyid mya ngan 'das pa ste //
analyzed: 'di nyid mya ngan 'das pa ste //
translated: This itself is nirvana,

original: gang 'di bsam pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: gang 'di bsam pa med pa nyid //
translated: Which is the absence of thought.

original: ces so // rnam par rtog pa zad nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad du mi skye ba la bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces so // rnam par rtog pa zad nas byang chub sems dpa'i sa brgyad du mi skye ba la bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When conceptualization is exhausted, on the eighth Bodhisattva stage, one attains the acceptance that entities are not produced.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems la ni zad pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems la ni zad pa med do //
translated: The minds of the Bodhisattvas are inexhaustible.

original: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa zad pa ni de dag gi thar pa ste gser dri ma dang bral ba bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyis nyon mongs pa zad pa ni de dag gi thar pa ste gser dri ma dang bral ba bzhin no //
translated: The exhaustion of the afflictions by means of wisdom is their liberation, like gold freed from dross.

original: blo gros chen pos sa bdun du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi shes shing sa'i go rims dang mtshams sbyar ba la mi mkhas pas mu stegs byed kyi lta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mu stegs
analyzed: blo gros chen pos sa bdun du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi shes shing sa'i go rims dang mtshams sbyar ba la mi mkhas pas mu stegs byed kyi lta ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mu stegs
translated: The great intelligent one asked, “In the seven grounds, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not know the general and specific characteristics, and they are not skilled in the sequence of the grounds and their connections. Therefore, they are like tīrthikas who are attached to the view of self and entities of the self.”🔽

original: can thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyi sems bkag ste 'khod kyi /
analyzed: can thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyi sems bkag ste 'khod kyi /
translated: The Bodhisattvas, the great beings, on the seventh stage, do not know the specific and general characteristics, and are not skilled in the sequence of the stages and in the connection, therefore, the minds of the tirthikas who are desirous of liberation are blocked and they do not proceed.

original: de dag la ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu 'byed pa'i shes rab ni med do //
analyzed: de dag la ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rab tu 'byed pa'i shes rab ni med do //
translated: But they do not have the wisdom which discriminates the specific and general characteristics of things.

original: der khyad par ni chos dang / don dang nges tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rab tu thob pas chos rab tu shes so //
analyzed: der khyad par ni chos dang / don dang nges tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rab tu thob pas chos rab tu shes so //
translated: There, the difference is that they know the Dharma through the attainment of the analytical knowledges of the Dharma, of meaning, of etymology, and of ready speech.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun khong du chud pas lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang / chos rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su brtags pas 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la gnas pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun khong du chud pas lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang / chos rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su brtags pas 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la gnas pa dang /
translated: He cultivates the application of mindfulness of the body by investigating the body's resistance, by comprehending the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, and by abiding in the freedom from desire that comes from investigating the resistances to the body, feelings, mind, and dharmas, and by abiding in their cessation.

original: 'du 'dzis gyur bar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: 'du 'dzis gyur bar lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates the application of mindfulness of the body in a way that is free from worldly concerns.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dang yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa dang yang sbyar ro //
translated: The same is applied to feelings, etc.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni skad cig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni skad cig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The general characteristics are momentariness, etc.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni lus 'di la skra dang so la sogs pa yod de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni lus 'di la skra dang so la sogs pa yod de /
translated: The specific characteristics are that this body has hair, nails, etc.

original: de la rdul phra mo'i tshogs la mi mdzes pa bsgom mo //
analyzed: de la rdul phra mo'i tshogs la mi mdzes pa bsgom mo //
translated: One should meditate on the ugliness of the collection of atoms that make it up.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And so:

original: gzugs @235b ni rdul phran gzhigs pa dang // rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs @235b ni rdul phran gzhigs pa dang // rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: Form is analyzed into atoms, and atoms are partless.

original: zhes par gang zag la bdag med par sngar byas te chos la bdag med par 'jug go //
analyzed: zhes par gang zag la bdag med par sngar byas te chos la bdag med par 'jug go //
translated: Having previously established the selflessness of persons, one should enter into the selflessness of dharmas.

original: de ltar bstan pa yang snang ba med pa ste sa rnams kyi go rims khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa yang snang ba med pa ste sa rnams kyi go rims khong du chud par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the teaching is not in the absence of appearance, but in the order of the stages.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa na gzhan la phan pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi khyad par 'byung ba rnams kyis sa bcu'i dbang po sgrib pa ma lus par spangs te
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa na gzhan la phan pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi khyad par 'byung ba rnams kyis sa bcu'i dbang po sgrib pa ma lus par spangs te
translated: When one abides in the concentration with appearance, the special collections of merit and intuition arise from the perfections such as generosity which are for the benefit of others, and the obscurations of the ten stages are completely abandoned.

original: / phan pa thams cad spyod pa'i thams cad mkhyen cing sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: / phan pa thams cad spyod pa'i thams cad mkhyen cing sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Then, one becomes omniscient and a Buddha, who practices all that is beneficial.

original: des nas rnams kyi go rims bstan par bya'i /
analyzed: des nas rnams kyi go rims bstan par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, the order of the stages should be taught.

original: don dam pa ni 'di la gang yang 'jug pa'am ldog pa med do //
analyzed: don dam pa ni 'di la gang yang 'jug pa'am ldog pa med do //
translated: But in reality, there is neither entry nor exit here.

original: snang ba med la rim ci yod //
analyzed: snang ba med la rim ci yod //
translated: What order can there be in the absence of appearance?

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: de'i phyir shes rab dang snying rje dang gzhan la phan pa'i bsod nams kyi khyad par tshogs dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa rnams dang 'khor ba mtha' dag shes pa rnams kyis mi shes pa dang sdug bsngal yongs su zad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes rab dang snying rje dang gzhan la phan pa'i bsod nams kyi khyad par tshogs dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa rnams dang 'khor ba mtha' dag shes pa rnams kyis mi shes pa dang sdug bsngal yongs su zad de /
translated: Therefore, the one who has the special wisdom, compassion, and merit of benefiting others, who has completed the stages of the accumulations and perfections, and who knows all of saṃsāra, is the one who does not know suffering and completely exhausts it.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i rnal 'byor shin tu rnam par dag pa na bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs nus pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnal 'byor gyi dbang po kho na sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i rnal 'byor shin tu rnam par dag pa na bdag dang gzhan la phan 'dogs nus pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnal 'byor gyi dbang po kho na sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the yoga of benefiting oneself and others is completely pure, the one who is able to benefit oneself and others, the omniscience of the lord of yoga alone, becomes the essence of the Buddha.

original: mu stegs byed rnams kyi bya ba ni rnal 'byor zhes bya ba shes rab dang / thabs dang nyon mongs pa zad pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: mu stegs byed rnams kyi bya ba ni rnal 'byor zhes bya ba shes rab dang / thabs dang nyon mongs pa zad pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The activity of the tīrthikas is called “yoga,” which is the exhaustion and separation from the afflictions of wisdom and method.

original: ji srid snying du zad 'gyur pa //
analyzed: ji srid snying du zad 'gyur pa //
translated: As long as the heart is exhausted,

original: de srid yid ni dgag par bya //
analyzed: de srid yid ni dgag par bya //
translated: the mind should be stopped.

original: de ni bsam gtan ye shes te //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan ye shes te //
translated: That is the concentration of wisdom.

original: lhag ma gzhan ni gzhung rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma gzhan ni gzhung rgyas pa'o //
translated: The rest is the extensive text.

original: yid ni rgod cing mi brtan pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni rgod cing mi brtan pa'o //
translated: The mind is agitated and unstable.

original: gang phyir gang phyir 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: gang phyir gang phyir 'byung ba ni //
translated: When it arises, it arises from that.

original: de phyir de phyir sdom pa na //
analyzed: de phyir de phyir sdom pa na //
translated: When it is restrained, it is restrained in that.

original: de tshe bdag nyid dbang du 'gyur //
analyzed: de tshe bdag nyid dbang du 'gyur //
translated: At that time, one becomes self-controlled.

original: spro ba gzung ba'i blo yis ni //
analyzed: spro ba gzung ba'i blo yis ni //
translated: With a mind that grasps enthusiasm,

original: khad kyis khad kyis spangs nas su //
analyzed: khad kyis khad kyis spangs nas su //
translated: gradually abandoning,

original: yid ni bdag la gnas byas te //
analyzed: yid ni bdag la gnas byas te //
translated: the mind should be placed in the self.

original: cung zad bsam par yang mi bya //
analyzed: cung zad bsam par yang mi bya //
translated: One should not think even a little.

original: zhes so // sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor gyi khyad par ni shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad pa phye ba na /🔽gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam @236a * //
analyzed: zhes so // sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor gyi khyad par ni shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad pa phye ba na / gang gi tshe mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam @236a * //
translated: The special non-dual yoga of the Buddhists, when analyzed by wisdom and the coarse and subtle aspects are distinguished,

original: pa med cing snang ba med pa yang dag par rig pa rang nyid kyis gnas te /
analyzed: pa med cing snang ba med pa yang dag par rig pa rang nyid kyis gnas te /
translated: at that time, when there is no apprehension, then without thought and without appearance, the correct knowledge itself abides.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun brjod du med par rang gi rig pa mngon sum du bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun brjod du med par rang gi rig pa mngon sum du bya'o //
translated: The momentary continuum should be made manifest by one's own awareness, inexpressible.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The lord of yogins who has entered into samādhi with appearances will teach the Dharma.

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas sngar smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas sngar smras pa /
translated: As it was said by the Omniscient One before:

original: dbang phyug chen po'i gnas kyi mchog /'og min shin tu rnam par mdzes //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i gnas kyi mchog /'og min shin tu rnam par mdzes //
translated: The supreme abode of Maheśvara, Akaniṣṭha, is extremely beautiful.

original: der ni theg pa rnams ston pa //
analyzed: der ni theg pa rnams ston pa //
translated: There, the vehicles are taught.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher ro //
translated: And so on extensively.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i mngon par rtogs pa'i le'u bzhi pa ste rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i mngon par rtogs pa'i le'u bzhi pa ste rdzogs so /
translated: The fourth chapter of the commentary on the noble Descent into Laṅkā, composed by Jñānaśrībhadra, is complete.

original: // / de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāmati said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rtag gam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rtag gam /
translated: Blessed One, are the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas permanent?

original: de ste mi rtag gam ci lags /
analyzed: de ste mi rtag gam ci lags /
translated: Or are they impermanent?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Mahāmati, the Tathāgata is not permanent, nor is he impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: gnyi gar yang nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi gar yang nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there would be a fault in both cases.

original: blo gros chen po gnyi gar yang nyes par 'gyur ba ni rtag tu zin na rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo gros chen po gnyi gar yang nyes par 'gyur ba ni rtag tu zin na rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Mahāmati, in both cases there would be a fault. If he were permanent, he would be a cause.

original: blo gros chen po mu stegs byed thams cad kyi rgyu rnams ni ma byas pa rtag pa ste zhes pa ni tshangs pa dang dbang po rgyu rnams ni ma byas par smra la /
analyzed: blo gros chen po mu stegs byed thams cad kyi rgyu rnams ni ma byas pa rtag pa ste zhes pa ni tshangs pa dang dbang po rgyu rnams ni ma byas par smra la /
translated: Mahāmati, the causes of all tīrthikas are unmade and permanent. This means that Brahmā and Īśvara are said to be unmade causes.

original: rtag pa la sogs par yang kun rtog par byed de /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs par yang kun rtog par byed de /
translated: They also conceive of permanence and so on.

original: de dag gi ma byas pa'i rgyu ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med do //
analyzed: de dag gi ma byas pa'i rgyu ni mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du med do //
translated: Their unmade causes are like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rtag par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rtag par mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, it is not suitable for the Tathāgata to be permanent.

original: mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: He is also not impermanent.

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid thams cad byas pas mi rtag pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid thams cad byas pas mi rtag pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa yang mi rtag par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Just as all the characteristics of the aggregates are impermanent because they are produced, the Tathāgata would be impermanent.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa'i phyir gser lta bur mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes yongs su mi zad de /
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa'i phyir gser lta bur mngon par rtogs pa'i ye shes yongs su mi zad de /
translated: But the Tathāgata is permanent, and the gnosis that realizes him is inexhaustible, like gold.

original: de de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'i rnam grangs yod do //
analyzed: de de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa'i rnam grangs yod do //
translated: In this way, there is a synonym for the permanence of the Tathāgata.

original: sems kyi gnyis kyi rnam pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / gzugs @236b brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du bslad pa'i mthu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi gnyis kyi rnam pa ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / gzugs @236b brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du bslad pa'i mthu las byung ba'o //
translated: The two aspects of mind arise from the power of delusion, like a dream, an illusion, blurred vision, a reflection, and so on.

original: des na mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang las kyi mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i shes pa 'khor bar snang ngo //
analyzed: des na mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang las kyi mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i shes pa 'khor bar snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, from the power of ignorance and karma that is not in equipoise, consciousness appears as the various different aspects of saṃsāra, like a spinning firebrand, a mirage, a dream, and so on.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de phyi rol gyi rnam par phye ba na mi dmigs pa de na rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi don dang bral ba'i sems kyi skad cig pa'i rgyun tsam gnyis su med pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa rtag pa gnas so //
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de phyi rol gyi rnam par phye ba na mi dmigs pa de na rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi don dang bral ba'i sems kyi skad cig pa'i rgyun tsam gnyis su med pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa rtag pa gnas so //
translated: When, by means of wisdom, one analyzes and distinguishes external appearances, one does not perceive them. Then, the continuum of the momentary mind, free from permanence, self, and external objects, is merely nondual, nonconceptual, and nonapparent. That is the ultimate truth, which is permanent and stable.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun rtag pas rtag gi / yang mu stegs byed pas bdag dang tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang rdul phra mo'i rdzas la sogs par kun brtags par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun rtag pas rtag gi / yang mu stegs byed pas bdag dang tshangs pa dang / dbang po dang rdul phra mo'i rdzas la sogs par kun brtags par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is permanent because the continuum of moments is permanent, but not because it is imagined to be a self, Brahmā, Īśvara, subtle particles, substances, and so forth, as the tīrthikas imagine.

original: kun brtags par mi rung ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
analyzed: kun brtags par mi rung ba ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
translated: What is not suitable to be imagined is non-existent like the horns of a rabbit, because it is unproduced.

original: phyi rol gyi rdzas kyang sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na khang pa dang sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rdzas kyang sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na khang pa dang sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid de /
translated: Also, external substances, when analyzed into coarse and subtle parts, are empty like houses, armies, forests, and so forth.

original: des na mu stegs byed kyi rtag pa ni rang bzhin gcig pa rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na mu stegs byed kyi rtag pa ni rang bzhin gcig pa rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the permanence of the tīrthikas is not the same as the permanence of nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is not impermanent.

original: byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa ste /
translated: All that is created is impermanent,

original: phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid se gol gyi sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid se gol gyi sgra bzhin no //
translated: like the sound of a finger snap.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i bum pa dang rtsig pa la sogs pa lta bu skad cig pa gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i bum pa dang rtsig pa la sogs pa lta bu skad cig pa gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the case that a moment of form, etc., is connected to another moment, as is the case with a pot, a wall, etc.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / gzung bar snang ba'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / gzung bar snang ba'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The other-dependent is like a dream, a magical creation, etc., and has the characteristic of the appearance of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos dang bral ba snga ma'i skad cig gi 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes brtags pa'i chos yin gyi /
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos dang bral ba snga ma'i skad cig gi 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes brtags pa'i chos yin gyi /
translated: It is a phenomenon that is imagined to be this way: “If this exists, that exists,” in the sense of the subsequent existence of this after the prior moment, and it is free from the phenomena of arising, enduring, ceasing, etc.

original: lung bstan pa la sogs pas byed pa dang / byed pa por mngon par 'brel te /
analyzed: lung bstan pa la sogs pas byed pa dang / byed pa por mngon par 'brel te /
translated: It is connected to the agent and the action in the sense of being the object of expression, etc.

original: skye ba kun brtags pa lta bur ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba kun brtags pa lta bur ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that birth is like an imagined entity.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig pa yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis po med pas sus kyang mi skyed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig pa yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa gnyis po med pas sus kyang mi skyed do //
translated: When one moment exists, the second moment does not exist. Therefore, nothing generates anything.

original: skye ba na yang skyed pa gzhan med de /
analyzed: skye ba na yang skyed pa gzhan med de /
translated: When something is generated, there is no other generation.

original: chos thams cad mi byed cing byed pa dang / byed pa po dang bral ba dang / dus @237a * //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi byed cing byed pa dang / byed pa po dang bral ba dang / dus @237a * //
translated: All phenomena are devoid of activity, agent, and action.

original: chud pa rnams dus thams cad du skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'gyur zhing de bzhin gshegs pa dang ma skyes pa dang mi gnyis pa'i rang bzhin pa rnams ni dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang mi byed do //
analyzed: chud pa rnams dus thams cad du skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'gyur zhing de bzhin gshegs pa dang ma skyes pa dang mi gnyis pa'i rang bzhin pa rnams ni dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang mi byed do //
translated: All things that are limited by time are in a continuum of moments at all times. The Tathāgata, the unborn, and the nature of nonduality are not produced by any faculty, etc.

original: des na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su brtags pa'i sems kyi chos nyid de ni ye gnas pa ste /
analyzed: des na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su brtags pa'i sems kyi chos nyid de ni ye gnas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the reality of mind, which is imagined as conditioned or unconditioned, is primordial.

original: sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can te zhes bya bas na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa rnams ni dag pa dang ma dag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can te zhes bya bas na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa rnams ni dag pa dang ma dag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Those who are filled with the naturally luminous mind are neither pure nor impure.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa de dag bslad pas nye bar skyes pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa glo bur gyi nyes pa spangs pas de dag gser lta bu ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa de dag bslad pas nye bar skyes pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa glo bur gyi nyes pa spangs pas de dag gser lta bu ste /
translated: Those who are naturally pure, when they are defiled, are like gold, because they are free from the accidental faults that arise from the appearance of duality.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa'i rnam grangs rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rin po che gser la sogs pa bzhin no //🔽ji ltar sa dang po'i dbang po snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas shing bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su dag pas lus la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid so sor snang ba rnams kyi sems kyi skad cig la gnyis kyi rnam
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa'i rnam grangs rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rin po che gser la sogs pa bzhin no // ji ltar sa dang po'i dbang po snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas shing bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su dag pas lus la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid so sor snang ba rnams kyi sems kyi skad cig la gnyis kyi rnam
translated: Therefore, the Tathagatas are like precious gold, etc., by way of the synonyms of permanence.

original: pa so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: pa so sor snang ngo //
translated: Just as on the first stage, the bodhisattva, abiding in the samadhi of light and darkness, with the appearance of the faculty, by the purification of the accumulation of merit, sees the appearance of the characteristics of the body, etc., in the moment of the mind, in the appearance of duality.

original: de ltar snang ba med cing mi gnyis pa'i yongs su grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa rnams la gnyis kyi rnam pa so sor mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar snang ba med cing mi gnyis pa'i yongs su grub pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa rnams la gnyis kyi rnam pa so sor mi snang ngo //
translated: Thus, for those who abide in the non-dual perfect meditative stabilization, which is non-appearance, the aspects of duality do not appear.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba dang / rjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa phan tshun du ltos pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad thams cad bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa brjod du med pa las ldog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba dang / rjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa phan tshun du ltos pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad thams cad bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa brjod du med pa las ldog pa ste /
translated: All conventions of the aspects of duality, such as the grasper and the grasped, the expression and the expressed, the action and the agent, the permanent and the impermanent, are absent in the non-conceptual and non-appearance of the ultimate truth, which is non-dual, the inexpressible, and the opposite of the expressible.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no conception of things and non-things.

original: des na phan tshun du ltos pa'i dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas gnyis la ltos pa'i yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang /🔽mi rtag pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bdag dang / bdag med par gyur ba dang / gcig pa dang du ma la sogs par smra bas brtags pa de lta bu thams @237b cad ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa /
analyzed: des na phan tshun du ltos pa'i dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa dang / gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pas gnyis la ltos pa'i yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / bdag dang / bdag med par gyur ba dang / gcig pa dang du ma la sogs par smra bas brtags pa de lta bu thams @237b cad ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa /
translated: Therefore, since there is no conceptualization of things and non-things, both and neither, and so on, which are mutually dependent, all such designations by those who speak of existence and non-existence, permanence and impermanence, virtue and non-virtue, self and selflessness, singularity and multiplicity, and so on, in dependence on the two, are absent in the inconceivable and non-apparent ultimate truth, which is non-dual.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa las ldog go //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa las ldog go //
translated: It is the perfect knowledge of the non-conceptualization of things and non-things, which turns away from conceptualization.

original: skad cig gi rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: skad cig gi rnam par rtog pa med mod kyi /
translated: Although there is no conceptualization of moments,

original: 'on kyang skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang skad cig pa ste /
translated: nevertheless, it is momentary.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus kyi rim pa tha dad pas phye ba na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba sdug bsngal dang thar bas phye ba la gcig par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus kyi rim pa tha dad pas phye ba na 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'da' ba sdug bsngal dang thar bas phye ba la gcig par mi rung ngo //
translated: When the stages of the former and latter times are distinguished, it is not suitable to say that cyclic existence and nirvana are the same, since they are distinguished by suffering and liberation.

original: skye ba yang med de byed pa dang byed pa por mngon par 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba yang med de byed pa dang byed pa por mngon par 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is there arising, because there is no connection between the agent and the action.

original: rnal 'byor rnams kyi sems kyi yang dag par rig pa snga ma 'og tu skad cig pa skad cig par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor rnams kyi sems kyi yang dag par rig pa snga ma 'og tu skad cig pa skad cig par byed pa ste /
translated: The correct knowledge of the mind of the yogis is the prior cause of the subsequent moment.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gog pa'i chos su brtags pa skad cig mar 'jig pa la rim gyis 'byung ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du mi skye ba ni stong pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'gog pa'i chos su brtags pa skad cig mar 'jig pa la rim gyis 'byung ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du mi skye ba ni stong pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the phenomena of arising and cessation are imputed to the momentary disintegration, the non-arising of things that occur in sequence is not emptiness, like the horns of a rabbit and so on, because they do not exist.

original: des ni mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i rtag pas smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni mu stegs kyis brtags pa'i rtag pas smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This refutes the eternalist assertions of the tīrthikas.

original: ji ltar la la 'khrul te zhi ba dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba pa dang / gtogs 'dod la sogs pa'i lta bar lhung nas bdag la sogs pa bzhin du sems kyang rtag go zhes bcab pa la sogs pa thos pa shin tu nyung ba rnams rtag go //
analyzed: ji ltar la la 'khrul te zhi ba dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba pa dang / gtogs 'dod la sogs pa'i lta bar lhung nas bdag la sogs pa bzhin du sems kyang rtag go zhes bcab pa la sogs pa thos pa shin tu nyung ba rnams rtag go //
translated: and some, having fallen into the views of the Samkhyas and so on, say that the mind is permanent like the self and so on.

original: kha cig ni mi skye ba la chad par smra bar ltung bas sems ri bong gi rva lta bur yongs su rtog cing rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin gyi dbang lta bur yongs su grub pa yang rtog go //
analyzed: kha cig ni mi skye ba la chad par smra bar ltung bas sems ri bong gi rva lta bur yongs su rtog cing rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin gyi dbang lta bur yongs su grub pa yang rtog go //
translated: Some, having fallen into the extreme of annihilationism with regard to the unarisen, imagine the mind to be like a rabbit's horns, and imagine the mind to be like a magical creation, a dream, and so on.

original: des na sems kyi rgyud rnams kyi rnam grangs rtag pa nyid de /
analyzed: des na sems kyi rgyud rnams kyi rnam grangs rtag pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the continuum of the mind is permanent.

original: gser la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par dge ba rnam par zad pa med cing sangs rgyas kho na'o //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa bzhin du rnam par dge ba rnam par zad pa med cing sangs rgyas kho na'o //
translated: Like gold and so on, it is pure, inexhaustible, and only a Buddha.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i dpyad pa le'u lnga pa ste rdzogs s+ho /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i dpyad pa le'u lnga pa ste rdzogs s+ho /
translated: The fifth chapter of the commentary on the noble Descent into Laṅkā composed by Jñānaśrībhadra, the analysis of permanence and impermanence, is complete.

original: // / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa /
analyzed: // / de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāmati made a request to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'jug pa dang / ldog pa bde bar gshegs pas bdag la bshad du gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams 'jug pa dang / ldog pa bde bar gshegs pas bdag la bshad du gsol /
translated: “Bhagavān, please explain to me the engagement and disengagement of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, O Sugata.”

original: bdag ma mchis na gang @238a * //
analyzed: bdag ma mchis na gang @238a * //
translated: “If there is no self, who engages or disengages?

original: zhig 'jug pa'am ldog par 'gyur na byis pa rnams ni 'jug pa dang / ldog pa la gnas pas sdug bsngal zad pa khong du ma chud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhig 'jug pa'am ldog par 'gyur na byis pa rnams ni 'jug pa dang / ldog pa la gnas pas sdug bsngal zad pa khong du ma chud pa'i phyir /
translated: Since childish beings abide in engagement and disengagement, they do not understand the cessation of suffering.”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu mi shes so zhes bya ba ni grangs can la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i mu stegs can rnams kyis ji ltar ha cang mgyogs pa'i lus ni 'khor bar 'jug go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu mi shes so zhes bya ba ni grangs can la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i mu stegs can rnams kyis ji ltar ha cang mgyogs pa'i lus ni 'khor bar 'jug go //
translated: The phrase they do not understand nirvana refers to the non-Buddhist tīrthikas who speak of external objects, such as the Sāṃkhyas. They imagine that the self, which is very swift, enters saṃsāra.

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i khyad par shes pas ldog go zhes rtog go //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i khyad par shes pas ldog go zhes rtog go //
translated: They imagine that it exits due to the knowledge of the differences between the self and its nature.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po med par bdag yod pas ji ltar na 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po med par bdag yod pas ji ltar na 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: How can the self enter saṃsāra if external things do not exist and the self exists?

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu tha dad par shes pas kyang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu tha dad par shes pas kyang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
translated: How can it exit due to the knowledge of the differences between the self and its nature?

original: re lde dang rtsig pa la sogs pa tha dad par shes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: re lde dang rtsig pa la sogs pa tha dad par shes pa bzhin te /
translated: It is like the knowledge of the differences between a fence, a wall, and so on.

original: des na mu stegs byed pa rnams la sdug bsngal zad pa khong du chud pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar na mya ngan las 'das zhes gzhan gyi sems shes pa la ltos te /
analyzed: des na mu stegs byed pa rnams la sdug bsngal zad pa khong du chud pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar na mya ngan las 'das zhes gzhan gyi sems shes pa la ltos te /
translated: Therefore, since the tīrthikas do not understand the exhaustion of suffering, how can they understand nirvana? This is in consideration of the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: 'phags pa blo gros chen pos thams cad mkhyen pa la gsol bar brtag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros chen pos thams cad mkhyen pa la gsol bar brtag go //
translated: One should understand that the noble Mahāmati requests the knowledge of omniscience.

original: de'i phyir 'khor bder sdug bsngal ji bzhin pa dang / de ji ltar ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor bder sdug bsngal ji bzhin pa dang / de ji ltar ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One has taught the suffering of cyclic existence just as it is and how it is to be reversed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord has said:

original: blo gros chen po de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Mahamati, therefore, etc.”

original: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyur gyur pa skye ba dang 'gro ba thams cad byed par 'jug ste byas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyur gyur pa skye ba dang 'gro ba thams cad byed par 'jug ste byas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mahamati, the tathiigatagarbha, which is the cause of virtue and nonvirtue, engages in creating all births and destinies.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa ste /
translated: The tathiigatagarbha is the naturally luminous mind,

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'byung zhing bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyun gyi dbang dang / dam pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pas dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'du byed kyis btab pa nyam nga ba'i 'gro bar 'jug go //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'byung zhing bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyun gyi dbang dang / dam pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pas dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'du byed kyis btab pa nyam nga ba'i 'gro bar 'jug go //
translated: which arises in a continuum of moments and, by the power of the continuum of self and other, and by the imprints of virtuous and nonvirtuous formations, which are taught to be the holy Dharma and the unholy Dharma, enters into the destinies of woe.

original: gar mkhan bzhin pa ni gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba ste /
analyzed: gar mkhan bzhin pa ni gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba ste /
translated: Like an actor, it appears in various forms.

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang / rab rib kyi rnam pa dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang / rab rib kyi rnam pa dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a dream, a magical creation, a mirage, a reflection, and so on.

original: bdag dang bdag gi spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang bdag tu mngon par chags pa'i mu stegs byed rnams kyi rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa @238b bzhin du med do //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi spangs pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang bdag tu mngon par chags pa'i mu stegs byed rnams kyi rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa @238b bzhin du med do //
translated: The extreme of the tīrthikas’ eternalism is the abandonment of “self” and “mine.” Eternalism does not exist, like the son of a barren woman, because it is not produced.

original: rim dang cig car gyis don byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
analyzed: rim dang cig car gyis don byed pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
translated: It does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit, because it is contradictory for something to be both permanent and to perform a function gradually or instantaneously.

original: ltos pa'i mi rgyu med pa dang gzhan gyis btang ba'i bye brag med pa'i phyir cis na rim gyis byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ltos pa'i mi rgyu med pa dang gzhan gyis btang ba'i bye brag med pa'i phyir cis na rim gyis byed par 'gyur /
translated: Why would it perform a function gradually, because it would be devoid of the distinctions of dependence, cause, and other conditions?

original: gang byed par 'gyur ba yang de thog ma nyid du cis na ma byas cig car yang de'i don gyi bya ba byed par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang byed par 'gyur ba yang de thog ma nyid du cis na ma byas cig car yang de'i don gyi bya ba byed par mi rigs te /
translated: Why would it not perform its function from the very beginning? It is also not tenable that it performs its function instantaneously.

original: dus gsum gyi dngos po thang cig tu byas par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi dngos po thang cig tu byas par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not observed that the entities of the three times are made into one moment.

original: byas nas kyang yang byed pa med pa'i phyir byed pa dang bcas pa dang byed pa med pa dag ngo bo nyid gcig par mi rigs te ;
analyzed: byas nas kyang yang byed pa med pa'i phyir byed pa dang bcas pa dang byed pa med pa dag ngo bo nyid gcig par mi rigs te ;
translated: And because, having been made, it is not made again, it is illogical that that which has an agent and that which does not have an agent are the same entity.

original: / gang dang gang dag rim pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de dag gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / gang dang gang dag rim pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de dag gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: Because whatever has a different order and different characteristics is not the same.

original: shing dang thal ba la sogs pa'i rim pa tha dad pa dang / mtshan nyid dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: shing dang thal ba la sogs pa'i rim pa tha dad pa dang / mtshan nyid dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, like the different orders and different characteristics of wood and ashes and so on.

original: de'i phyir mu stegs byed rnams kyi bdag bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs tha dad par phye ba ni de dag gi rtag par mi rigs te des na rjes su dran pa dang / shes pa dang 'ching ba dang / thar pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa skad cig tu 'jig pa la rung gi rtag cing mi 'gyur ba la ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mu stegs byed rnams kyi bdag bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs tha dad par phye ba ni de dag gi rtag par mi rigs te des na rjes su dran pa dang / shes pa dang 'ching ba dang / thar pa dang / bde ba la sogs pa skad cig tu 'jig pa la rung gi rtag cing mi 'gyur ba la ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is illogical that the self of the tīrthikas is permanent, because it is differentiated as pleasure, pain, and so on. Thus memory, cognition, bondage, liberation, pleasure, and so on are tenable in momentary disintegration, but not in permanence and immutability.

original: rtog pa'i rgyun du bdag med par rtsod pa zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa'i rgyun du bdag med par rtsod pa zhi ba'o //
translated: The continuity of conceptualization is pacified in the absence of self.

original: gang dag tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa la gcig par yang bdag rnam gnyis su med par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa la gcig par yang bdag rnam gnyis su med par rtog pa ste /
translated: Those who think that Brahma, Ishvara, and so forth are the self in two ways,

original: de ltar 'di thams cad ni tshangs pa'o zhes pa dang / thams cad 'di ni zhi bdag ste //
analyzed: de ltar 'di thams cad ni tshangs pa'o zhes pa dang / thams cad 'di ni zhi bdag ste //
translated: saying, “All of this is Brahma,” and “All of this is peaceful,”

original: zhi ba las ni rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: zhi ba las ni rab tu 'byung //
translated: and “From peace, one emerges,”

original: 'byung po kun la zhi ba yod //
analyzed: 'byung po kun la zhi ba yod //
translated: and “All beings have peace,”

original: zhi ba gang yin de nga nyid //🔽ces so // gtogs 'dod kyis kyang smras pa /🔽bdag ni 'byung po kun la gnas //
analyzed: zhi ba gang yin de nga nyid // ces so // gtogs 'dod kyis kyang smras pa / bdag ni 'byung po kun la gnas //
translated: and “I am that which is peace,”🔽and “I am in all beings,”

original: 'byung po kun kyang bdag la ste //
analyzed: 'byung po kun kyang bdag la ste //
translated: and “All beings are in me,”

original: bdag ldan de ltar sus rig pa //
analyzed: bdag ldan de ltar sus rig pa //
translated: and “Whoever knows that I exist in that way

original: kun du mnyam par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: kun du mnyam par mthong ba'o //
translated: sees everything as equal,”

original: zhes de skad ces pa de dag la grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i glags so //
analyzed: zhes de skad ces pa de dag la grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa gcig pa'i glags so //
translated: are all equally vulnerable to the charge that they are liberated or not liberated, wealthy or poor, and so on.

original: spyi dang khyad par du brtags pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bzhin du gal te de dag kyang de skad du 'chad na ni de'i tshe bshad pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par du brtags pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bzhin du gal te de dag kyang de skad du 'chad na ni de'i tshe bshad pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are explained in the same way as the essence of the Tathāgata, then the explanations would not be different.

original: sems can mang po'i @239a * //
analyzed: sems can mang po'i @239a * //
translated: The mind-streams of many sentient beings

original: sems kyi rgyun skad cig pa rnams kyang me bzhin du gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun skad cig pa rnams kyang me bzhin du gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: are momentary and non-dual like fire.

original: de bzhin du tsha ba dang rab tu snang ba la sogs pa'i chos dang mthun pas gcig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tsha ba dang rab tu snang ba la sogs pa'i chos dang mthun pas gcig pa'o //
translated: In the same way, they are one because of being similar to the properties of heat, light, and so forth.

original: gsal ba tha dad pas kyang tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: gsal ba tha dad pas kyang tha dad pa ste /
translated: They are different because of the difference in manifestation.

original: rtsva dang lo ma dang seng ldeng la sogs pa'i me bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsva dang lo ma dang seng ldeng la sogs pa'i me bzhin no //
translated: Like the fires of grass, leaves, and khadira wood, and so forth.

original: de dag gi ni ji ltar thos pa las byung ba me'i me stag phra mo yar ba bzhin du 'gyur ba de dag las rnam par shes pa stug po 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag gi ni ji ltar thos pa las byung ba me'i me stag phra mo yar ba bzhin du 'gyur ba de dag las rnam par shes pa stug po 'byung ste /
translated: From those, consciousness arises like a spark from a fire, as heard.

original: de dag nyid kyi rjes su rnam par 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi rjes su rnam par 'jig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those very ones are said to be destroyed, and so forth.

original: ji ltar lha chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar lha chen pos smras pa /
translated: As it is said by the Great God:

original: ji ltar shing la me gnas dang // sa yi nang du chu yod pa //🔽de ltar thams cad lus rnams su //
analyzed: ji ltar shing la me gnas dang // sa yi nang du chu yod pa // de ltar thams cad lus rnams su //
translated: Just as fire abides in wood, and water in the earth,🔽so,🔽in the same way,

original: zhi ba dag pa rnam par gnas //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhi ba dag pa rnam par gnas // zhes pa ste /
translated: the peaceful and pure abides in all bodies.

original: de ni chud pa'i bdag nyid la brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de ni chud pa'i bdag nyid la brtags pa'o //
translated: This is the examination of the nature of the vessel.

original: sngags kyi bdag dang sems pa can //
analyzed: sngags kyi bdag dang sems pa can //
translated: The self of mantra and the embodied being

original: skyes bu rnam pa gnyis zhes bya //
analyzed: skyes bu rnam pa gnyis zhes bya //
translated: are said to be of two kinds.🔽Beyond mantra and mantra itself,

original: sngags las 'das dang sngags nyid dang ; / dbang phyug mchog la rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: sngags las 'das dang sngags nyid dang ; / dbang phyug mchog la rnam gnyis so //
translated: and the supreme lord are twofold.

original: gtogs 'dod kyis kyang smras pa /
analyzed: gtogs 'dod kyis kyang smras pa /
translated: Bhāradvāja said:

original: shes pa 'di la nye brtan te //
analyzed: shes pa 'di la nye brtan te //
translated: “Relying on this knowledge,

original: nga yi chos mthun phyin pa rnams //🔽mtho ris su yang mi skye zhing //
analyzed: nga yi chos mthun phyin pa rnams // mtho ris su yang mi skye zhing //
translated: those who have attained my Dharma🔽will not be reborn in the higher realms

original: rab tu 'jig ni god mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rab tu 'jig ni god mi 'gyur //
translated: and will not be destroyed.

original: bha dra ha ris kyang rig sngags kyi mtha' dang mthun par smras pa /
analyzed: bha dra ha ris kyang rig sngags kyi mtha' dang mthun par smras pa /
translated: Bhādrahaira also spoke in accordance with the end of the knowledge mantra:

original: de yi tshor ba gcig po yang //
analyzed: de yi tshor ba gcig po yang //
translated: “Even that single feeling

original: rnam pa mang po rab tu 'byed //
analyzed: rnam pa mang po rab tu 'byed //
translated: is differentiated into many kinds.

original: 'jig pa 'byung ba'i me mdag ni //
analyzed: 'jig pa 'byung ba'i me mdag ni //
translated: The embers of destruction and origination

original: chu yi phung por chu bzhin du //
analyzed: chu yi phung por chu bzhin du //
translated: are like water in a mass of water.

original: de phyir da rdo rig gnas pa //
analyzed: de phyir da rdo rig gnas pa //
translated: Therefore, now, O knower of reality,

original: gsal ba'i grong ni mi 'gyur bas //🔽sprin rnams char dang ldan pa ni //
analyzed: gsal ba'i grong ni mi 'gyur bas // sprin rnams char dang ldan pa ni //
translated: the city of clarity does not change.🔽Like clouds full of rain

original: rlung las 'byung ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rlung las 'byung ba bzhin du'o //
translated: come from the wind.

original: gsum gyi gzugs su de snang ba //
analyzed: gsum gyi gzugs su de snang ba //
translated: It appears in the form of the three

original: mur smra tha dad rnams la ni //
analyzed: mur smra tha dad rnams la ni //
translated: to the various extremists.

original: mchog ni yongs su 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: mchog ni yongs su 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The supreme one is completely transformed,

original: lta ba tha dad kyis ni bcings //
analyzed: lta ba tha dad kyis ni bcings //
translated: bound by different views.

original: zhi zhing rig bdag tshangs pa ste //
analyzed: zhi zhing rig bdag tshangs pa ste //
translated: The peaceful, self-aware lord Brahmā

original: de las byung ba'i ma rig pa //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i ma rig pa //
translated: arises from that ignorance.

original: des ni srin po bzhin du ming //
analyzed: des ni srin po bzhin du ming //
translated: By that, like a demon,

original: gang smra mi nus pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang smra mi nus pa rnams so //
translated: those who cannot speak are named.🔽Just as the pure sky

original: ji ltar nam mkha' rnam par dag / ri rab 'khrul pa'i skyes bu yis //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' rnam par dag / ri rab 'khrul pa'i skyes bu yis //
translated: is imagined by a confused person on Mount Meru🔽to be filled with

original: ri mo rnam pa sna tshogs kyis //🔽kun du gang ba sems pa'o //
analyzed: ri mo rnam pa sna tshogs kyis // kun du gang ba sems pa'o //
translated: various kinds of pictures,

original: de ltar tshangs pa bdud rtsi 'di //🔽'gyur ba med pa ma rig pas //
analyzed: de ltar tshangs pa bdud rtsi 'di // 'gyur ba med pa ma rig pas //
translated: in the same way, this nectar of Brahmā🔽is made turbid by ignorance,

original: rnyog pa lta bur byas pas na //
analyzed: rnyog pa lta bur byas pas na //
translated: which is unchanging.

original: tha dad gzugs su snang ba @239b ste ;
analyzed: tha dad gzugs su snang ba @239b ste ;
translated: Therefore, it appears in different forms.

original: / zhes bya ba tshangs pa'i rgyud du zhib po //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba tshangs pa'i rgyud du zhib po //
translated: Thus it is said in the Tantra of Brahmā.

original: de de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rtag pa'i bdag dang bral ba /
analyzed: de de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rtag pa'i bdag dang bral ba /
translated: Thus, the essence of the Tathāgata is devoid of a permanent self,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dang mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i mthu las 'khor ba sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa snang ngo //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dang mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i mthu las 'khor ba sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa snang ngo //
translated: and the ignorance that does not posit equality in the continuum of self and others arises from the power of the maturation of karma, and the various appearances of cyclic existence manifest.

original: bdag gi yang phyi rol gyi don gang yang med de /
analyzed: bdag gi yang phyi rol gyi don gang yang med de /
translated: Also, there are no external objects at all.

original: khyad par can la sogs pas brtags pa sa'i rdzas sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyad par can la sogs pas brtags pa sa'i rdzas sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the coarse and subtle substances of earth that are imputed by the Vaiśeṣikas and others are analyzed, they become empty, like a house, an army, a forest, and so on.

original: des na gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral zhing skad cig gi rgyun 'byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba de khong du ma chud pas gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen gyi bya ba dang ldan par 'jug na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o
analyzed: des na gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral zhing skad cig gi rgyun 'byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba de khong du ma chud pas gsum 'dus pa'i rkyen gyi bya ba dang ldan par 'jug na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o
translated: Therefore, since the essence of the Tathāgata, which is free from the aspect of duality and arises as a continuum of moments, is not understood to be naturally luminous, it is said, “If it engages in the activity of the condition of the assembly of the three . . .”

original: // de la gsum 'dus pa ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las gsum 'dus pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor ba 'jug ldog go zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: // de la gsum 'dus pa ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / las gsum 'dus pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor ba 'jug ldog go zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: The three-fold assembly is the assembly of the three: ignorance, craving, and karma. The meaning of the statement that the wheel of life turns and stops is to be understood as the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: rgyu la mngon par chags shing zhen pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyis ni khong du ma chud do zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams rgyur yongs su rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu la mngon par chags shing zhen pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyis ni khong du ma chud do zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams rgyur yongs su rtog pa ste /
translated: The non-Buddhists, who are attached to and cling to the cause, do not understand. The non-Buddhists imagine that the cause is permanent, a self, Brahma, Ishvara, and so forth.

original: rtog pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtog pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Imagination is non-arisen, like the son of a barren woman and so forth.

original: gcig pa yang grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa tha dad pa med pa'i skyon te sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig pa yang grol ba dang / ma grol ba dang / phyug pa dang / dbul ba la sogs pa tha dad pa med pa'i skyon te sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The error of identity is that there would be no difference between the liberated and the non-liberated, the rich and the poor, and so forth, as explained before.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig na ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal ces na byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig na ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal ces na byed par 'gyur /
translated: If one were free from attachment, one would not act for the sake of others.

original: rtse mo yang de la ji ltar na yod /
analyzed: rtse mo yang de la ji ltar na yod /
translated: If one were free from attachment, how could one have the peak?

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig na ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig na ni /
translated: If one is not free from attachment,

original: ma shes pa sus byas /
analyzed: ma shes pa sus byas /
translated: who is it that does not understand?

original: de'i phyir thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags rnam pa mang pos bsgos pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bsgrags pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa'i gnas ngan len gyi bag chags rnam pa mang pos bsgos pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bsgrags pa /
translated: Therefore, the so-called ālaya consciousness, which is infused with the many habitual propensities of the negative tendencies of conceptual thought since beginningless time,

original: ma rig pa'i gnas las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i gnas las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: is the so-called seven consciousnesses that arise from the abode of ignorance.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las rnam pa sna tshogs su rnam par shes pa bdun dang lhan cig tu rgya mtsho chen po'i rlabs bzhin du rtag tu @240a * //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las rnam pa sna tshogs su rnam par shes pa bdun dang lhan cig tu rgya mtsho chen po'i rlabs bzhin du rtag tu @240a * //
translated: From the perspective of one’s own and others’ continua, the seven consciousnesses always arise together like waves in a great ocean.

original: lus kyi rgyun mi 'chad pa /
analyzed: lus kyi rgyun mi 'chad pa /
translated: The continuum of the body is uninterrupted.

original: mi rtag pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba /
translated: It is free from the fault of impermanence.

original: bdag tu smra ba las rnam par log pa /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba las rnam par log pa /
translated: It is the opposite of the proponents of a self.

original: shin tu rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is a single consciousness that is utterly pure by nature.

original: ji ltar rmi lam gyi dus na der gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa med par yang yul dang / yul can gyi dngos po sna tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid snang ba de lta bu gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang ma rig pa yongs su smin pa'i mthu las /
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam gyi dus na der gzugs la sogs pa'i yul dang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa med par yang yul dang / yul can gyi dngos po sna tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pu nyid snang ba de lta bu gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang ma rig pa yongs su smin pa'i mthu las /
translated: Just as in a dream, although there are no objects such as forms and no consciousnesses such as the eye consciousness, the mere consciousness appears in the aspect of various objects and subjects, in the same way, at the time of not waking from sleep, due to the power of the full ripening of ignorance,

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba ;
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba ;
translated: the body, enjoyments, and abode appear.

original: / kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste //🔽rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: / kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste // rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: The all-base is the source of all.

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: It is like the ocean and its waves.

original: zhes par 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes par 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what the Bhagavān has said.🔽“There is no external object that is observed.” The Bhagavān has also said this:

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs dmigs pa med do zhes yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du gsungs pa gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs dmigs pa med do zhes yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du gsungs pa gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: When form is analyzed into particles,

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: the particles are partless.🔽What then is the object of observation?🔽And:

original: 'on dmigs pa ni ci zhig / ces pa dang / phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: 'on dmigs pa ni ci zhig / ces pa dang / phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: Although external things do not exist,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang // zhes pa ste /
translated: Mind appears in two aspects.🔽When, through analysis with wisdom, the coarse and subtle aspects are distinguished, then, like a house, an army, a forest, and so on, it is seen to be empty.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo'i cha tha dad par phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par mthong ba de na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi rnam par ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo'i cha tha dad par phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par mthong ba de na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi rnam par ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the alaya consciousness is eliminated in two aspects.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i sems kyi rgyud gnyis su med pa gser ltar dri ma dang bral ba 'ba' zhig la 'khor ba gzhag par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i sems kyi rgyud gnyis su med pa gser ltar dri ma dang bral ba 'ba' zhig la 'khor ba gzhag par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Samsara is posited in just the continuum of mind, which is naturally completely pure, nondual, and free of stains like gold.

original: / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jig pa rnams ni skad cig pa dag ste /
analyzed: / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'jig pa rnams ni skad cig pa dag ste /
translated: The consciousnesses of the eye and so on are momentary.

original: skad cig pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor bar mi byed pas sems nyid la srid pa dang thar ba'i dus su 'jug pa yod do //
analyzed: skad cig pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor bar mi byed pas sems nyid la srid pa dang thar ba'i dus su 'jug pa yod do //
translated: Since they do not connect to another moment, it is the mind itself that enters into the states of samsara and nirvana.

original: rnam par shes pa bdun ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / nyon mongs pa'i yid rtag tu ngar byed par 'jug pa dang bdun no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdun ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / nyon mongs pa'i yid rtag tu ngar byed par 'jug pa dang bdun no //
translated: The seven consciousnesses are the six consciousnesses of eye, etc., and the seventh, the afflicted mind, which is always engaged in self-inflation.

original: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na bdun po rnams kyi snang ba med do //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na bdun po rnams kyi snang ba med do //
translated: When one is in the concentration of non-perception, there is no perception of the seven.

original: de dag ni yul med pas ma rig pa yongs su smin pa'i mthu 'ba' zhig las mgo 'khor ba @240b dang ; brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'khor bar sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa snang ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni yul med pas ma rig pa yongs su smin pa'i mthu 'ba' zhig las mgo 'khor ba @240b dang ; brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du 'khor bar sna tshogs tha dad pa'i rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa snang ngo //
translated: Since they have no object, the various different aspects of consciousness appear in the cycle of existence, like a whirling firebrand, only through the power of the full development of ignorance.

original: de bzhin du rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i rim pa'i khyad par du rlabs tha dad pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes par 'gyur ba'i rim pa'i khyad par du rnam par shes pa bdun dang yul rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i rim pa'i khyad par du rlabs tha dad pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes par 'gyur ba'i rim pa'i khyad par du rnam par shes pa bdun dang yul rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as waves are different in the ocean, depending on the differences in the force of the wind, in the same way, the seven consciousnesses and their objects arise, depending on the differences in the force of the development of the store consciousness.

original: mi rtag pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba ni brtan pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba ni brtan pa'o //
translated: It is stable because it is free from the fault of impermanence.

original: bdag tu smra ba las rnam par log pa ni skad cig pa'i rgyun du 'byung ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bsgrags pa glo bur gyi gnyis kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral te gser lta bur dri ma med par rang bzhin yongs su dag pa
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba las rnam par log pa ni skad cig pa'i rgyun du 'byung ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa zhes bsgrags pa glo bur gyi gnyis kyi dri ma thams cad dang bral te gser lta bur dri ma med par rang bzhin yongs su dag pa
translated: The self-proclaimed is completely turned away from the so-called foundation consciousness that arises in a continuum of moments, is free from all stains of the two adventitious ones, and is stainless like gold, the completely pure nature.

original: ste lan du mar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ste lan du mar bshad pa'o //
translated: This has been explained many times.

original: bdun po skad cig pa yin te /
analyzed: bdun po skad cig pa yin te /
translated: The seven are momentary.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa'i rgyu las skyes pa dbyibs kyi byad dang bye brag la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa'i rgyu las skyes pa dbyibs kyi byad dang bye brag la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas yang dag pa ma yin par kun du rtog pa bshad pa ste /
translated: The so-called observation of shape and particulars arisen from the cause of false imagination is as explained by the noble Maitreya: False imagination...

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog cing //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog cing //
translated: False imagination

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: And mind and mental factors of the three realms,

original: de na don mthong rnam par shes //
analyzed: de na don mthong rnam par shes //
translated: There, consciousness sees objects.

original: de yi khyad par sems las byung //
analyzed: de yi khyad par sems las byung //
translated: Its particulars are mental factors.
