original: zhes pa'o // bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis 'khrugs te mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa yongs su smin pa dang / rtag pa dang / bdag dang bdag gir chags pa dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i sems las byung ba rnams las las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyu rnams kyi khams gsum par snang ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis 'khrugs te mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa yongs su smin pa dang / rtag pa dang / bdag dang bdag gir chags pa dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i sems las byung ba rnams las las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyu rnams kyi khams gsum par snang ba skyed par byed do //
translated: From the mind that is afflicted with the views of permanence and annihilation, attachment to self and to what is mine, passion, hatred, and so forth, the causes of the various actions are produced, and they generate the appearance of the three realms.

original: rmi lam dang mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du der yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rang gi snang ba nyid la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'jug go //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du der yul dang yul can gyi dngos po rang gi snang ba nyid la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams 'jug go //
translated: Like a dream, a whirling firebrand, a swoon, and so forth, the consciousnesses of the eye and so forth engage there in the appearance of the subject and object, which is just one's own appearance.

original: de dag gi phyi rol gyi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pas bskyed pa'i yul la dmigs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gi phyi rol gyi dmigs pa med pa'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pas bskyed pa'i yul la dmigs pa rnams so //
translated: Since there is no external object, they are the consciousnesses that apprehend objects produced by unreal imagination.

original: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par chags shing zhe na pa ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pas sgra dang don brjod pa'i rnam pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma la mngon par chags shing zhe na pa ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pas sgra dang don brjod pa'i rnam pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: Attachment to names and signs is produced by the aspect of the expression of sound and meaning through false imagination.

original: ming ni gzugs la sogs @241a * //🔽pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ming ni gzugs la sogs @241a * // pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Name is the expression of form, etc.

original: de la mtshan ma ni mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa dang / bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma ni mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa dang / bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Sign is the characteristic of beauty, ugliness, woman, man, etc.

original: mngon par chags pa'i rgyu ni rang gi sems snang ba'i gzugs dang mtshan nyid khong du chud pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa'i rgyu ni rang gi sems snang ba'i gzugs dang mtshan nyid khong du chud pa ste /
translated: The cause of attachment is the understanding of the characteristic of the form that appears to one's own mind.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i gzugs rab rib can dang rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i gzugs rab rib can dang rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du khong du chud par byed do //
translated: One understands that the form that appears to one's own mind is like the consciousness of one who has an eye disease, a dream, a magical creation, etc.

original: bde dang sdug bsngal mi myong bar zhes pa ni 'khor ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal mi myong bar zhes pa ni 'khor ba'i nyid mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Not experiencing pleasure and pain is because of the non-linking of cyclic existence.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams skad cig pa kho na'i phyir skad cig pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams skad cig pa kho na'i phyir skad cig pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba med de /
translated: Because eye consciousness and so on are momentary, they do not link to another moment.

original: des na thar ba'i rgyu ma yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na thar ba'i rgyu ma yin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore the Buddha did not intend that they are causes of liberation.

original: de'i phyir 'di bzhin du sems skad cig pa gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor bas 'khor bar 'khor na rang gis byas pa'i las kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal des myong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di bzhin du sems skad cig pa gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor bas 'khor bar 'khor na rang gis byas pa'i las kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal des myong ngo //
translated: Therefore, if the mind cycles in samsara by linking to another moment, it experiences the pleasure and pain created by itself.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams skad cig pas na srid pa gzhan du bde ba dang sdug bsngal mi myong ngo zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams skad cig pas na srid pa gzhan du bde ba dang sdug bsngal mi myong ngo zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: Since eye consciousness and so on are momentary, they do not experience pleasure and pain in another life. This is the intended meaning of the Omniscient One.

original: mthong ba'i chos la tshor ba'i las kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba rnams zhes pa ni zhing dang bsam pa'i bye brag las shes pa rnams ni mthong ba'i chos la tshor ba'i las kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la tshor ba'i las kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba rnams zhes pa ni zhing dang bsam pa'i bye brag las shes pa rnams ni mthong ba'i chos la tshor ba'i las kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The statement “Those who experience pleasure and pain through the karma of feeling in this life” means that those who know the distinctions of field and attitude experience pleasure and pain through the karma of feeling in this life.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang dag 'gog pa mya ngan med //
analyzed: gang dag 'gog pa mya ngan med //
translated: those who are in cessation are not miserable.

original: byams pa dgra bcom 'bras bu las //🔽phan gnod de dag la byas pa'i //
analyzed: byams pa dgra bcom 'bras bu las // phan gnod de dag la byas pa'i //
translated: Maitreya, having attained the fruit of arhatship,🔽immediately experiences the results

original: 'bras bu mod la myong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu mod la myong bar 'gyur //
translated: of the benefit and harm done to those.

original: zhes bya mod kyi thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don ni lus rnam par zhig pa na dbang po'i shes pa de dag la skad cig pa gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor ba med do //
analyzed: zhes bya mod kyi thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don ni lus rnam par zhig pa na dbang po'i shes pa de dag la skad cig pa gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor ba med do //
translated: The meaning of the Omniscient One’s intention is that when the body disintegrates, those sense consciousnesses do not link to another moment.

original: skyes nas tshor ba'i las gang gis rgyud chad pa las yang lus dang dbang po rnams gzhan nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes nas tshor ba'i las gang gis rgyud chad pa las yang lus dang dbang po rnams gzhan nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, by the karma that produces feeling upon birth, the body and sense faculties arise again from the severed continuum.

original: sems ni skad cig gi rgyun du 'byung zhing rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dus su chad pa med pas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa myong ngo //
analyzed: sems ni skad cig gi rgyun du 'byung zhing rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dus su chad pa med pas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa myong ngo //
translated: Since the mind arises in a continuum of moments and is uninterrupted at the time of cause and effect, it experiences pleasure, pain, and so on.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'byung bas na rtag pa'i bdag tu smra ba rnam par spangs so //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'byung bas na rtag pa'i bdag tu smra ba rnam par spangs so //
translated: Since it arises in a continuum of moments, it is free from the assertion of a permanent self.

original: ji ltar se gol gyi @241b sgra dang glog la sogs pa'i skad cig pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skad cig pa de ltar de'i chad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar se gol gyi @241b sgra dang glog la sogs pa'i skad cig pa dang / mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi skad cig pa de ltar de'i chad pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as the sound of a finger snap, the momentariness of lightning, and the momentariness of the eye consciousness, etc., are not annihilated,

original: des na rtag pa dang chad par smra ba mu stegs byed dang / nyan thos kyis bslad pa'i skur pa thams cad dang bral zhing sems can rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dag pa'o //
analyzed: des na rtag pa dang chad par smra ba mu stegs byed dang / nyan thos kyis bslad pa'i skur pa thams cad dang bral zhing sems can rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dag pa'o //
translated: so it is with the momentariness of the mind. Therefore, it is free from all the deprecations of the tīrthikas who advocate eternalism and annihilationism, and of the śrāvakas, and it is the purity of the tathāgatagarbha in sentient beings.

original: gnyis su med pa de la spyi dang khyad par du brtags pa na gcig dang du ma'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa de la spyi dang khyad par du brtags pa na gcig dang du ma'i khyad par ro //
translated: When that nonduality is analyzed in terms of the general and the specific, there is the distinction of the one and the many.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal mi myong ba ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal mi myong ba ste /
translated: The eye consciousness, etc., do not experience pleasure and pain.

original: de dag skad cig pa gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir thar pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag skad cig pa gzhan du nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir thar pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Since they are connected to another moment, they are not the cause of liberation.

original: de'i phyir de ltar na sems nyid srid pa dang thar pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na sems nyid srid pa dang thar pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mind itself is the cause of existence and liberation.

original: des btab pa'i las rnam pa lnga dngos dang brgyud pas rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des btab pa'i las rnam pa lnga dngos dang brgyud pas rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The five types of actions that are performed by that [mind] are ripened directly and indirectly.

original: gdon mi za bar tshor ba ni mtshams med pa'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar tshor ba ni mtshams med pa'o //
translated: The inevitable [action] is the immediate [action].

original: bsam pa drag pos khyad par gyi zhing du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang byas pa ni mthong ba'i chos la tshor ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa drag pos khyad par gyi zhing du dge ba dang mi dge ba dang byas pa ni mthong ba'i chos la tshor ba'o //
translated: The action that is done with a strong intention toward a special object, whether virtuous or non-virtuous, is experienced in this life.

original: tshor bar nges pa med pa dang / skyes nas tshor ba dang / rnam grangs gzhan du tshor ba ni de las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: tshor bar nges pa med pa dang / skyes nas tshor ba dang / rnam grangs gzhan du tshor ba ni de las gzhan pa ste /
translated: The action that is not certain to be experienced, the action that is experienced after taking rebirth, and the action that is experienced in a different way than that are other [types of action].

original: de thams cad sems kyi rgyud kyi bag chags la gnas so //
analyzed: de thams cad sems kyi rgyud kyi bag chags la gnas so //
translated: All of these are present as habitual tendencies in the continuum of the mind.

original: thar pa yang shes rab kyis mngon par 'du byed cing yon tan gyi khyad par dang nyon mongs pa zad pa yang sems nyid la yod do //
analyzed: thar pa yang shes rab kyis mngon par 'du byed cing yon tan gyi khyad par dang nyon mongs pa zad pa yang sems nyid la yod do //
translated: Liberation is also formed by wisdom, and the special qualities and the exhaustion of afflictions are also present in the mind itself.

original: ming dang mtshan ma dang kun nas ldang ba'i 'dod chags kyis bskyed cing skyed par byed pa de'i rgyu la dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni bud med dang skyes pa mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa'i mtshan ma la mngon par chags pa'i kun nas ldang ba'i 'dod chags
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma dang kun nas ldang ba'i 'dod chags kyis bskyed cing skyed par byed pa de'i rgyu la dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni bud med dang skyes pa mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa'i mtshan ma la mngon par chags pa'i kun nas ldang ba'i 'dod chags
translated: It is generated and causes the generation of attachment that arises from names, signs, and mental afflictions.🔽It is the cause that is the object of observation.🔽It is the object of observation that is generated by attachment that arises from mental afflictions that are generated by attachment to the signs of beautiful and ugly women and men.

original: kyis gang yul du snang ba bskyed pa der dmigs pa rnams te /
analyzed: kyis gang yul du snang ba bskyed pa der dmigs pa rnams te /
translated: It is the object of observation that is generated by attachment to the signs of beautiful and ugly women and men.

original: sngon gyi bag chags yongs su smin pas btab pa rnams la dgongs par brtag go //🔽zin pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba de dag yongs su zad cing 'gags nas de ma thag tu mi skye zhing zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi sems dang yul rnam par rtog par snang ba bkag ste 'gog pa la snyoms
analyzed: sngon gyi bag chags yongs su smin pas btab pa rnams la dgongs par brtag go // zin pa'i dbang po zhes bya ba de dag yongs su zad cing 'gags nas de ma thag tu mi skye zhing zhes bya ba ni khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi sems dang yul rnam par rtog par snang ba bkag ste 'gog pa la snyoms
translated: It should be understood that it is generated by the ripening of former latent propensities.🔽The phrase “the cessation of the cessation of the sense faculties” refers to the cessation of the cessation of the sense faculties that are appropriated.

original: par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “that does not arise immediately after” refers to the cessation that is entered into by those who are free from attachment to the three realms, and in which the mind and the appearance of the conceptualization of objects are stopped.

original: gzhan dag ni @242a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni @242a * //
translated: The phrase “other than that” refers to the cessation of the cessation of the sense faculties that are appropriated.

original: rang gi blo'i rnam par rtog pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal mi myong ba 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa bsam gtan bzhi dang / bde pa dang rnam par thar pa la mi mkhas pa'i rnal 'byor can rnams ni rnam par thar pa'i blor 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag kyang thar ba'i blor 'gyur ro zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: rang gi blo'i rnam par rtog pa'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal mi myong ba 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa bsam gtan bzhi dang / bde pa dang rnam par thar pa la mi mkhas pa'i rnal 'byor can rnams ni rnam par thar pa'i blor 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag kyang thar ba'i blor 'gyur ro zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Those who enter the meditative attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation, who do not experience the pleasure and pain of their own ideation, and who are skilled in the four meditations and in the liberations, have the idea of liberation.

original: rang gi blos rnam par brtags te bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba'i 'du shes 'gog pa nyid thar ba'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi blos rnam par brtags te bde ba dang sdug bsngal myong ba'i 'du shes 'gog pa nyid thar ba'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who, by their own ideation, imagine the cessation of the idea of the experience of pleasure and pain have the idea of liberation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / bden pa dang / rnam par thar ba la mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba la mu stegs byed rnams kyis brtags pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / bden pa dang / rnam par thar ba la mi mkhas pa zhes bya ba la mu stegs byed rnams kyis brtags pa ste /
translated: The four meditations, the truths, and the liberations are imagined by the tīrthikas.

original: de dag ji ltar rnam par rtog ce na /🔽ji srid snying du zad gyur pa //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rnam par rtog ce na / ji srid snying du zad gyur pa //
translated: How do they imagine them?🔽As long as the heart is exhausted,

original: de srid yid ni dgag par bya //
analyzed: de srid yid ni dgag par bya //
translated: the mind is to be stopped.

original: de ni bsam gtan shes pa ste //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan shes pa ste //
translated: This is the knowledge of meditation.

original: lhag pa gzhan ni gzhung rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa gzhan ni gzhung rgyas pa'o //
translated: The other perfections are as explained in the scriptures.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
translated: The four meditations, the four noble truths, and the three doors of liberation, i.e., emptiness, the absence of marks, and the absence of vows.

original: de la brgyad ni ji ltar chos mngon pa dang / ji ltar sdong po brgyan pa la sogs par rgya cher rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la brgyad ni ji ltar chos mngon pa dang / ji ltar sdong po brgyan pa la sogs par rgya cher rig par bya'o //
translated: Of these, the first eight are to be understood in detail according to the Abhidharma and according to the Alôka and other commentaries.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bsgrags pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po zhes bsgrags pa /
translated: The Essence of the Tathagata is proclaimed to be the foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rab tu ma gyur na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun rnams 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rab tu ma gyur na 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun rnams 'gag pa med do //
translated: If the foundation consciousness has not been transformed, the seven evolving consciousnesses are not stopped.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de rgyu dang de la dmigs pas zhugs pa'i phyir dang zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa bdun kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las 'byung zhing de la dmigs par yang 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de rgyu dang de la dmigs pas zhugs pa'i phyir dang zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa bdun kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las 'byung zhing de la dmigs par yang 'jug pa ste /
translated: Because they are its cause and it is their object. The seven evolving consciousnesses arise from the cause which is the foundation consciousness and they evolve by taking it as their object.🔽As it is said:

original: ji ltar / lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: ji ltar / lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, the enjoyments, and the abode appear.

original: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste //
translated: The universal ground is the universal source.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: It is eightfold, ninefold,

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: like waves in the ocean.

original: zhes bya bar lan mang por bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bar lan mang por bshad pa'o //
translated: This has been explained many times.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po de yang rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa ste /
translated: That essence of the tathāgata is also naturally luminous, but it is obscured by adventitious defilements.

original: 'khor ba'i dus su glo bur gyi gnyis kyi rnam par so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dus su glo bur gyi gnyis kyi rnam par so sor snang ngo //
translated: In the context of saṃsāra, it appears separately as the two.

original: der nyan thos dang mu stegs byed rnams rtag pa dang bdag dang phyi rol gyi don mngon par chags pa ste /
analyzed: der nyan thos dang mu stegs byed rnams rtag pa dang bdag dang phyi rol gyi don mngon par chags pa ste /
translated: There, the hearers and tīrthikas are attached to permanence, self, and external objects.

original: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pas sgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pas sgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: In the same way, the omniscient one has accomplished

original: @242b nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor la rnal 'byor ba thams cad kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes so //
analyzed: @242b nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor la rnal 'byor ba thams cad kyi rnam par shes pa rnams kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir zhes so //
translated: because it is not the object of the consciousnesses of all the yogis of the hearers, solitary realizers, and tīrthikas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni rtag pa dang gcig pa dang du ma dang bdag tu smra ba'i mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni rtag pa dang gcig pa dang du ma dang bdag tu smra ba'i mu stegs can gyi rnal 'byor spyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shes pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: The reality of the tathāgatas is not the object of the knowledge of the yogis who are tīrthikas, who are proponents of permanence, unity, multiplicity, and a self.

original: de ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas par rtag pa na skad cig pa'i rgyun rtag pas rnam grangs su rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas par rtag pa na skad cig pa'i rgyun rtag pas rnam grangs su rtag pa ste /
translated: It is permanent as both conditioned and unconditioned, but is nominally permanent because of the permanence of the continuum of moments.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: As the Sūtra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says,

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni ston pas brtags pa'i tshig go zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni ston pas brtags pa'i tshig go zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: “Son of noble family, ‘conditioned’ and ‘unconditioned’ are terms designated by the Teacher.”

original: 'dus byas su spyod kyang rung 'dus ma byas su spyod kyang rung ste nam 'dus byas pa de ni skad cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas su spyod kyang rung 'dus ma byas su spyod kyang rung ste nam 'dus byas pa de ni skad cig pa'o //
translated: Whether one engages with the conditioned or the unconditioned, if it is conditioned, it is momentary.

original: nam rtag par bsams te 'dus ma byas pa de ni skad cig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nam rtag par bsams te 'dus ma byas pa de ni skad cig pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is thought to be permanent and unconditioned, it is not momentary.

original: de de ltar skad cig tu 'jig pa yod na gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i dus na bsam pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar skad cig tu 'jig pa yod na gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i dus na bsam pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to exist as momentary disintegration, then it would be both conditioned and unconditioned, since it would be imagined to exist in the dependent and the real natures.

original: gal te yang skad cig tu 'jig pa med du zin na ni de'i tshe bde bar gshegs pas rtogs pa dang mu stegs byed par khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: gal te yang skad cig tu 'jig pa med du zin na ni de'i tshe bde bar gshegs pas rtogs pa dang mu stegs byed par khyad par ci yod /
translated: If it were not momentary disintegration, then what difference would there be between the realization of the Tathāgata and the realization of the tīrthikas?

original: kha cig gis ni ji ltar rtag po'i dngos po med pa de ltar skad cig gi dngos po med ces te /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni ji ltar rtag po'i dngos po med pa de ltar skad cig gi dngos po med ces te /
translated: Some say: Just as a permanent thing does not exist, so too a momentary thing does not exist.

original: ji ltar dkon mchog phreng ba las /
analyzed: ji ltar dkon mchog phreng ba las /
translated: As the Ratnāvalī says:🔽When the characteristics of arising, enduring, and disintegrating in a moment are possessed sequentially, then in that way, momentariness is refuted.

original: skad cig gi skye ba dang gnas pa dang rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid rim gyis chos dang ldan pa na de lta bur ni skad cig pa 'grib po zhes 'phags pa klus pos kyis glengs pa ni /
analyzed: skad cig gi skye ba dang gnas pa dang rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid rim gyis chos dang ldan pa na de lta bur ni skad cig pa 'grib po zhes 'phags pa klus pos kyis glengs pa ni /
translated: The noble Nāgārjuna says:

original: skad cig la ni mtha' yod pas //
analyzed: skad cig la ni mtha' yod pas //
translated: Because it has an end in a moment,

original: thog ma bar yang rtogs par gyis //
analyzed: thog ma bar yang rtogs par gyis //
translated: understand it has a beginning and middle.

original: de ltar skad cig gsum dag phyir //
analyzed: de ltar skad cig gsum dag phyir //
translated: Because of these three moments,

original: skad cig mi gnas 'jig rten la //
analyzed: skad cig mi gnas 'jig rten la //
translated: In the world, which does not endure for a second moment,

original: thog ma bar dang tha ma yi //
analyzed: thog ma bar dang tha ma yi //
translated: consider the beginning, middle, and end

original: cha rnams la yang rtog par gyis //
analyzed: cha rnams la yang rtog par gyis //
translated: in terms of the parts.

original: thog ma bar dang mtha' yod kyi //
analyzed: thog ma bar dang mtha' yod kyi //
translated: Since there is a beginning, middle, and end,

original: 'dus la gcig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus la gcig pa med pa'o //
translated: the composite is not one.

original: zhes so // de de ltar grangs can dang ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pa'i skad cig pa drug tu yang mi rung bar gleng ngo //🔽gang dag yang thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi rim par phye ba dang bral ba'i skad cig tu ji ltar se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa ltar chud @243a * //
analyzed: zhes so // de de ltar grangs can dang ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pa'i skad cig pa drug tu yang mi rung bar gleng ngo // gang dag yang thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi rim par phye ba dang bral ba'i skad cig tu ji ltar se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa ltar chud @243a * //
translated: Thus, he argues that the momentary is not tenable in terms of the six, such as the Sāṃkhya and the Naiyāyika.

original: par byed pa de ltar ni gleng ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di mi 'jug go //
analyzed: par byed pa de ltar ni gleng ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di mi 'jug go //
translated: Those who posit the momentary as free from the distinction of the sequence of beginning and end, like the sound of a finger snap, do not engage in this kind of conceptualization.

original: thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi rim par rnam par phye ba dang bral ba'i skad cig pa rnams ni mngon sum gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi rim par rnam par phye ba dang bral ba'i skad cig pa rnams ni mngon sum gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the momentary, free from the distinction of the sequence of beginning and end, is directly perceived.

original: 'dus ma byas par brtags pa'i rtag pas ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yang dag par rig pa'i chos nyid de ni ye gnas so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas par brtags pa'i rtag pas ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yang dag par rig pa'i chos nyid de ni ye gnas so //
translated: The permanence that is examined as unconditioned is the reality of the authentic pristine wisdom that is naturally radiant and has always existed.

original: sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por brtag pa dbang po la sogs par sus kyang mi byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por brtag pa dbang po la sogs par sus kyang mi byed de /
translated: The tathāgata essence is not made by anyone, such as the faculties, to be examined as the essence of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing mi gnyis pa ste rnam pa de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing mi gnyis pa ste rnam pa de lta bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul te /
translated: The tathāgata essence is naturally radiant and nondual. Such an object is the domain of the tathāgatas.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus kyi rim pa tha dad pa dang bral ba skad cig ma'i rgyun myong ba thog ma dang bar dang tha ma'i skad cig pa'i yan lag tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus kyi rim pa tha dad pa dang bral ba skad cig ma'i rgyun myong ba thog ma dang bar dang tha ma'i skad cig pa'i yan lag tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from the different stages of past and future times, free from the concepts of the different parts of the beginning, middle, and end of the stream of moments.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las byung ba /
translated: As it says in the Madhyamaka:

original: gal te skye ba sngar yod la //
analyzed: gal te skye ba sngar yod la //
translated: If birth were to occur first

original: rga ba 'chi ba phyi nas ni //
analyzed: rga ba 'chi ba phyi nas ni //
translated: and aging and death later,

original: skye la rga dang 'chi med de //
analyzed: skye la rga dang 'chi med de //
translated: birth would be without aging and death.

original: skyes kyang 'chi ba med par 'gyur //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: skyes kyang 'chi ba med par 'gyur // zhes pa ste /
translated: If it were born, it would be immortal.

original: gang na de dag thog dang mthar //
analyzed: gang na de dag thog dang mthar //
translated: If birth and death

original: lhan cig rim du mi 'jug na //
analyzed: lhan cig rim du mi 'jug na //
translated: Do not occur at the same time,

original: skye dang 'chi ba'i chos rnams kyi //
analyzed: skye dang 'chi ba'i chos rnams kyi //
translated: In the beginning, in the middle,🔽And at the end,

original: dngos po kun la thams cad du //
analyzed: dngos po kun la thams cad du //
translated: Then all things🔽Would be born and not die.

original: skye ba ci zhig spro bar byed //
analyzed: skye ba ci zhig spro bar byed //
translated: What is the use of being born?🔽What is the use of dying?

original: rga bar 'chi ba de ci zhig / rga dang 'chi ba med par ni //
analyzed: rga bar 'chi ba de ci zhig / rga dang 'chi ba med par ni //
translated: Without aging and death,

original: dngos po gang zhig yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig yod par 'gyur //
translated: What thing could there be?🔽If things did not disintegrate moment by moment, how could the selflessness of persons and phenomena be posited?

original: ces so // gal te skad cig tu 'jig par mi 'gyur na chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa ji ltar na rnam par gzhag /'on te rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi gnyis kyi rnam pa'i skad cig ma rnams kyi dngos po
analyzed: ces so // gal te skad cig tu 'jig par mi 'gyur na chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa ji ltar na rnam par gzhag /'on te rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi gnyis kyi rnam pa'i skad cig ma rnams kyi dngos po
translated: But since things are like dreams and illusions, the momentary things of the dependent nature are not nonexistent.

original: med pa ni yongs su grub pa'i skad cig pa rnams la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar dngos po med de /
analyzed: med pa ni yongs su grub pa'i skad cig pa rnams la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar dngos po med de /

original: don dam pa rang bzhin med pa nyid ni gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid ni /🔽bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa mchog tu dag cing gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig par myong ba ni dngos po med pa ma yin te /

analyzed: dag cing gnyis su med pa mig la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams snang ba med cing gnyis su med pa'i tshul gyis rab tu log par gyur ba rnams ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin du thams cad mkhyen pa la mig la

original: sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga so sor rtog pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: and so on, the five engaging consciousnesses become the gnosis of individual investigation.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid rab tu gyur ba na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid rab tu gyur ba na mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: When the afflicted mind is transformed, it is called the gnosis of equality.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par ye shes pa drug gi nang na yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes su brjod do //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par ye shes pa drug gi nang na yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes su brjod do //
translated: Among the six engaging consciousnesses, the mental consciousness is called the gnosis of activity.

original: de'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rab tu log pas bdun rnams kyang ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rab tu log pas bdun rnams kyang ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, since the consciousness of the ground of all is reversed, the seven consciousnesses are also reversed.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa bdun rnams kyis de'i rgyu dang de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa bdun rnams kyis de'i rgyu dang de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the seven consciousnesses are the cause of the afflictions and they focus on them.

original: gang gi tshe chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba yongs su shes nas chos lnga yongs su shes par gyur ba de'i tshe gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yang dag pa ji lta ba yongs su shes nas chos lnga yongs su shes par gyur ba de'i tshe gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: When one perfectly understands the selflessness of persons and phenomena just as it is and understands the five dharmas, at that time, the gnosis of nonduality becomes only ultimate truth.

original: chos lnga po bshad zin mod kyi /
analyzed: chos lnga po bshad zin mod kyi /
translated: Although the five dharmas have already been explained,

original: gzhung bshad pa'i ched du byas te /
analyzed: gzhung bshad pa'i ched du byas te /
translated: The treatise is composed for the purpose of explaining that.

original: yang sbyar bar bya ba la ming dang mtshan ma dang / rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang sbyar bar bya ba la ming dang mtshan ma dang / rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The subject matter is name, sign, conceptualization, suchness, and right knowledge.

original: nyan thos @244a * //🔽rnams ni gnyis kyi rnam pa yongs su bzung nas rmi lam bzhin du gang la bdag med pa yongs su shes so //
analyzed: nyan thos @244a * // rnams ni gnyis kyi rnam pa yongs su bzung nas rmi lam bzhin du gang la bdag med pa yongs su shes so //
translated: The disciples are of two kinds:🔽those who are attached to the idea of the reality of the external world and those who are attached to the idea of the reality of the internal world.🔽The former are like those who are attached to the idea of the reality of the grasped and the grasper.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba de dag la 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba la mngon par chags pa lta bur kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rab tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba de dag la 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba la mngon par chags pa lta bur kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rab tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The latter are like those who are attached to the idea of the reality of the internal world.

original: des na chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ldog go //
analyzed: des na chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ldog go //
translated: Therefore, by the complete knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena, the obscuration of the knowable is eliminated.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ldog go //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ldog go //
translated: By the complete knowledge of the selflessness of the person, the obscuration of the afflictions is eliminated.

original: de bzhin du yang bdag dang bdag gir chags pa log pa na las kyi sgrib pa ldog ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bdag dang bdag gir chags pa log pa na las kyi sgrib pa ldog ste /
translated: In the same way, when attachment to “I” and “mine” is eliminated, the obscuration of karma is eliminated.

original: de ltar na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su shes pa dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing phan pas thams cad spyod pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su shes pa dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs shing phan pas thams cad spyod pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the concentrations with and without appearances are fully understood, and the accumulations of merit and wisdom through the levels and perfections are completed.

original: rab tu dag pa'i sa la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa khong du chud pa nas bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir bzung ba yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: rab tu dag pa'i sa la gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa khong du chud pa nas bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa'i dngos po med pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la phan pa'i phyir bzung ba yongs su spangs te /
translated: On the pure levels, having realized the selflessness of persons and phenomena, the grasping of all sentient beings is abandoned because of the absence of the things of the self and mine.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of generosity is completed.

original: dri ma med par ni gnyis kyi dri ma spong ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ma med par ni gnyis kyi dri ma spong ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the stainless, the perfection of ethics is completed because the stains of the two are abandoned.

original: 'od byed du ni gnyis kyis 'khrugs pa med pa'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol du phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'od byed du ni gnyis kyis 'khrugs pa med pa'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol du phyin pa'o //
translated: In the Radiant, the perfection of patience, because he is not disturbed by the two.

original: 'od 'phro ba ni gnyis su med pa'i chos la shes rab kyis dpyod par spro ba'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol du phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba ni gnyis su med pa'i chos la shes rab kyis dpyod par spro ba'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi pha rol du phyin pa'o //
translated: In the Radiant, the perfection of vigor, because he is eager to investigate the nondual Dharma with wisdom.

original: shin tu dka' rgyal du ni rgyal bar dka' ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las rgyal bar byed de gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa khong du chud pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu dka' rgyal du ni rgyal bar dka' ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams las rgyal bar byed de gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa khong du chud pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa shas che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the Difficult to Conquer, the perfection of meditation, because he conquers the passions which are difficult to conquer, and because he has a greater share of the perfection of meditation, through his understanding of the selflessness of the individual and of things.

original: mngon par mthun pa dang mi mthun par rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i chos la zab mo shes rab kyis dpyod pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par mthun pa dang mi mthun par rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i chos la zab mo shes rab kyis dpyod pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog tu 'gyur ro //
translated: In the Far-Reaching, the perfection of wisdom, because he investigates with profound wisdom the Dharma which is dependent on both the agreeable and the disagreeable.

original: ring du song bar ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rtogs shing khams gsum gyi @244b 'dod chags dang bral ba shes rab dang snying rje ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don du thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa🔽lhag par 'gyur ro //🔽mi g-yo bar ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / brjod pa dang / rjod par bral zhing dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rtog par byed cing gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa na thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi don du 'gog pa
analyzed: ring du song bar ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun rtogs shing khams gsum gyi @244b 'dod chags dang bral ba shes rab dang snying rje ldan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don du thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par 'gyur ro // mi g-yo bar ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / brjod pa dang / rjod par bral zhing dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i sgyu ma dang 'dra ba'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rtog par byed cing gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa na thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi don du 'gog pa
translated: On the Gone Afar, the perfection of method for the sake of others becomes superior because of realizing the four noble truths and the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment and because of being free from attachment to the three realms, possessing wisdom and compassion.

original: la snyoms par 'jug pa lta bu las sangs par mdzad de /
analyzed: la snyoms par 'jug pa lta bu las sangs par mdzad de /
translated: On the Immovable, the perfection of wisdom becomes superior because of being free from the apprehension of subject and object, action and agent, expression and that which is expressed, and because of being free from the conception of things and non-things, and because of entering into the meditative stabilization of emptiness devoid of the aspect of duality, and because of being roused from cessation for the sake of others by the Omniscient Ones.

original: smon lam gyi rjes su dran pa'i phyir de'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon lam gyi rjes su dran pa'i phyir de'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the recollection of the vow, the perfection of vow is fulfilled.

original: legs pa'i blo gros su ni chos dang don dang / nges tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas sems can mtha' dag gi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba shes shing chos smra ba po stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros su ni chos dang don dang / nges tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pas sems can mtha' dag gi bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba shes shing chos smra ba po stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In Good Intelligence, by attaining the four analytical knowledges of Dharma, meaning, etymological interpretation, and ready speech, one knows the thoughts and dispositions of all sentient beings and becomes a powerful Dharma teacher, so the perfection of power is fulfilled.

original: chos kyi sprin du ni sa bcu por spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa spangs pas dar las g-yogs pa lta bur shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad snang ngo ;
analyzed: chos kyi sprin du ni sa bcu por spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa spangs pas dar las g-yogs pa lta bur shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad snang ngo ;
translated: In Dharma Cloud, on the tenth stage, by eliminating the ignorance that is the affliction to be eliminated on that stage, the entire mandala of objects of knowledge appears as if covered by a cloud, because of the obscuration of ignorance.

original: / thams cad mkhyen pa la ni sgrib pa med pa nyid de khyad par ro //
analyzed: / thams cad mkhyen pa la ni sgrib pa med pa nyid de khyad par ro //
translated: The difference is that in the tenth stage, omniscience is unobstructed.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa'i rgyud thams cad rtsa ba nas phyung ba mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa'i rgyud thams cad rtsa ba nas phyung ba mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa /
translated: It is the ground of those who have completely uprooted all the roots of ignorance in both the afflicted and the unafflicted classes of consciousness, who are completely pure in their freedom from attachment, and who have eliminated the obscurations to knowledge.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po //
translated: It is the ground of those who are masters of the yoga of omniscient gnosis.

original: gzugs sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud rangs par mdzad pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs gzhal du med pa rgyu dang 'bras bus rgyas pa rnams kyi sa'o //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi rgyud rangs par mdzad pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs gzhal du med pa rgyu dang 'bras bus rgyas pa rnams kyi sa'o //
translated: It is the ground of those who have the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and so on, and who have an immeasurable accumulation of qualities, both causes and results, and who delight the minds of infinite sentient beings with their miraculous display of various forms.

original: der thams cad mkhyen pa rnams bzhugs nas sa bcu'i rgyal tshab kyi dbang po rnams la chos kyi sprin gyi dbang bskur bar mdzad de /
analyzed: der thams cad mkhyen pa rnams bzhugs nas sa bcu'i rgyal tshab kyi dbang po rnams la chos kyi sprin gyi dbang bskur bar mdzad de /
translated: It is there that the omniscient ones reside and confer the empowerment of the cloud of Dharma on the lords who are regents of the tenth ground.

original: der ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog tu 'gyur /
analyzed: der ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mchog tu 'gyur /
translated: It is there that the perfection of wisdom becomes supreme.

original: chos lnga dang bdag med pa yongs su shes nas de ltar sa'i go rims su mtshams sbyor ba ni @245a * //
analyzed: chos lnga dang bdag med pa yongs su shes nas de ltar sa'i go rims su mtshams sbyor ba ni @245a * //
translated: Having understood the five dharmas and the two kinds of selflessness, one is connected with the stages of the ten grounds in the following way.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu bar rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu bar rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: This concludes the extensive explanation of the ten grounds in the noble Sutra of the Ten Grounds.

original: chos lnga po ni lan mang por bshad pas na da ni de dag la bdag med par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: chos lnga po ni lan mang por bshad pas na da ni de dag la bdag med par bshad par bya ste /
translated: The five dharmas have been explained many times, so now we will explain the two kinds of selflessness in relation to them.

original: ming dang mtshan ma dang / rtog pa rnams ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i phyir rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma dang / rtog pa rnams ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i phyir rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Name, sign, and conceptualization are unarisen, like dreams, illusions, and so forth, because they are dualistic appearances.

original: de dag ni brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: de dag ni brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang du bsdu'o //
translated: They are included in the imagined and the dependent.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid ni grub par bsdu'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid ni grub par bsdu'o //
translated: Correct wisdom and suchness are included in the consummate.

original: mdor bsdus na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang yongs su dag pa'i chos thams cad ni brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i nang du gtogs so //
analyzed: mdor bsdus na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang yongs su dag pa'i chos thams cad ni brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i nang du gtogs so //
translated: In brief, all phenomena of affliction and purity are included in the imagined, the dependent, and the consummate.

original: de dag dbye na ni chos lnga yongs su bzung ba ste /
analyzed: de dag dbye na ni chos lnga yongs su bzung ba ste /
translated: When they are divided, they are included in the five dharmas.

original: ming dang mtshan ma dang yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma dang yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: name, sign, and conceptualization.

original: phyi rol gyi don du sgro btags te snang ba dang bcas pa la ye shes 'jug cing sgro 'dogs pa ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du sgro btags te snang ba dang bcas pa la ye shes 'jug cing sgro 'dogs pa ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: The engagement of wisdom in the appearance of the superimposition of external objects is a sign.

original: rnam pa de lta bu gzugs la mdzes pa dang mi mdzes par rtog pa ni chos lnga'i nang du gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu gzugs la mdzes pa dang mi mdzes par rtog pa ni chos lnga'i nang du gtogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The conceptualization of the beautiful and the ugly in form, which is of that kind, is a particular conceptualization included among the five dharmas.

original: gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i brtags pa ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang rdul phra mo'i rdzas la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yul med de /
analyzed: gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i brtags pa ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang rdul phra mo'i rdzas la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i yul med de /
translated: The investigation included among the three is the conceptualization of permanence, self, subtle particles, substances, and so on, which are objects that do not exist.

original: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the conceptualization of the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa tsam gyi yul gyi de gnyis kyi khyad par phye ba'o //🔽yang dag pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa tsam gyi yul gyi de gnyis kyi khyad par phye ba'o // yang dag pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: The distinction between those two is the mere appearance and nonappearance of objects.

original: yang dag par lta ba la sogs par lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba la sogs par lam gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Correct wisdom is the characteristic of the path, such as right view and so on, which is analyzed by prajñā.

original: de bzhin nyid ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i bslad pa 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gnyis kyi rnam pa'i bslad pa 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Suchness has the characteristic of stopping the defilement of the two aspects.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes grub pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes grub pa'o //
translated: It is the establishment of nondual intuition.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis ni rab tu phye ste bshad par mdzad /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis ni rab tu phye ste bshad par mdzad /
translated: The Omniscient One has analyzed and explained it.

original: btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas dbus mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ni rab tu phye ba bsdus te 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: btsun gtso 'phags pa byams pas dbus mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las ni rab tu phye ba bsdus te 'chad pa'o //
translated: The noble Maitreya, the chief of the venerable, in the Madhyantavibhanga, has analyzed and explained it in brief.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas zhib tu 'chad pa ni ji ltar snga ma'i le'u las 'byung ba /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas zhib tu 'chad pa ni ji ltar snga ma'i le'u las 'byung ba /
translated: The Omniscient One has explained it in detail, as it occurs in the earlier chapter:🔽The imagined is tenfold,

original: kun du brtags pa rnam bcu ste //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa rnam bcu ste //
translated: the relative is sixfold, and the perfect is without differentiation.🔽Thus it is said.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam pa drug / grub pa la ni dbye ba med //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam pa drug / grub pa la ni dbye ba med //
translated: The perfect is without differentiation,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: as it occurs in the earlier chapter:

original: gzugs ni dbang po lnga rnams don //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbang po lnga rnams don //
translated: Form is the five sense faculties and their objects.

original: zhes par rnam pa bcur dgongs pa'i @245b don du brtag go //
analyzed: zhes par rnam pa bcur dgongs pa'i @245b don du brtag go //
translated: Thus it is imagined in ten aspects.🔽The six consciousnesses beginning with the eye are the six aspects of the relative.🔽The perfect is without differentiation, as it is said:🔽The perfect is without differentiation,🔽as it occurs in the earlier chapter:

analyzed: snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / bya ba dang / byed pa dang / skyed pa dang / bskyed pa dang / rjod pa dang / brjod pa dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa gnyis su rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro // gnyis su med pa la ni rig par bya ba dang / rig pa'i dngos por bdag nyid du yang mi rtogs na /

original: de lta bur chos lnga dang bdag med pa yongs su shes pa dang / sa bcu rtogs pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bur chos lnga dang bdag med pa yongs su shes pa dang / sa bcu rtogs pa dang / snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni thams cad mkhyen pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the gnosis of nonduality is omniscience, which is the complete understanding of the five dharmas and the two kinds of selflessness, the realization of the ten grounds, the attainment of the samādhi of appearance and the attainment of the samādhi of no appearance.

original: des na 'khor ba rnams kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'jug pa dang rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi gnyis kyi rnam pa ldog pa ste /
analyzed: des na 'khor ba rnams kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'jug pa dang rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi gnyis kyi rnam pa ldog pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the ālaya consciousness of those in saṃsāra engages, and the two aspects of the yogis cease.

original: dbang thob pa na nyon mongs pa gnyis kyi rnam pa ldog go //
analyzed: dbang thob pa na nyon mongs pa gnyis kyi rnam pa ldog go //
translated: When one attains mastery, the two afflictive aspects cease.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u drug las de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dpyad pa dang po'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u drug las de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dpyad pa dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter on the tathāgatagarbha in the commentary on the noble Descent into Laṅkā composed by Jñānaśrībhadra.

original: // / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos gsol ba btab pa la /
analyzed: // / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos gsol ba btab pa la /
translated: Then again the bodhisattva mahāsattva Mahāmati made a request to the bhagavān:

original: bdag med pa gnyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of selflessness, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ming dang mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Name, sign, conceptualization, correct knowledge, and suchness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gi so so rang gis rig pa la 'jug pa dang / de la blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa ni gang dag gis ming du brjod cing 'di ni glang po dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / rkang thang dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bdag gi so so rang gis rig pa la 'jug pa dang / de la blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa ni gang dag gis ming du brjod cing 'di ni glang po dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / rkang thang dang /
translated: Mahamati, conceptualization is that by which names are expressed, such as 'this is an elephant, a horse, a chariot, infantry,

original: skyes pa dang / bud med la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa dang / bud med la sogs pa yin te /
translated: a man, a woman, and so on.'

original: de de bzhin du 'di ni gzhan du ma yin no zhes @246a * //
analyzed: de de bzhin du 'di ni gzhan du ma yin no zhes @246a * //
translated: 'It is thus, not otherwise.'

original: mtshan ma gsal bar byed pa de ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma gsal bar byed pa de ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: That which clarifies the sign is conceptualization.

original: blo gros chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes ni gang gis ming dang / mtshan ma med dmigs shing phan tshun glo bur du byung ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa mi 'jug pa rtag pa med pa dang chad pa med pa'i phyir mu stegs byed dang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes ni gang gis ming dang / mtshan ma med dmigs shing phan tshun glo bur du byung ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa mi 'jug pa rtag pa med pa dang chad pa med pa'i phyir mu stegs byed dang /
translated: “Mahāmati, moreover, the perfect pristine awareness is that by which names and signs are not apprehended, and consciousness does not engage because they are mutually adventitious.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung bar mi byed pas yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung bar mi byed pas yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it does not fall into the extremes of eternalism and nihilism, it is called the perfect pristine awareness.”

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes des byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ming dngos por mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes des byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ming dngos por mi byed /
translated: “Moreover, Mahāmati, by that perfect pristine awareness, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not make a name into a thing,

original: mtshan ma dngos por mi byed do //
analyzed: mtshan ma dngos por mi byed do //
translated: and does not make a sign into a thing.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa'i mtha' gnyis su nga par lta ba rnam par spangs pa ming dang mtshan ma'i don mi 'jug par shes pa de lta bu ni de bzhin nyid 'di yin par bshad do //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa'i mtha' gnyis su nga par lta ba rnam par spangs pa ming dang mtshan ma'i don mi 'jug par shes pa de lta bu ni de bzhin nyid 'di yin par bshad do //
translated: That knowledge of the non-engagement of the meaning of names and signs, abandoning the two extremes of superimposition and denial, is explained as this thusness.”

original: blo gros chen po de bzhin nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni snang ba med pa'i rtogs pa'i spyod yul thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba thob ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po de bzhin nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni snang ba med pa'i rtogs pa'i spyod yul thob pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba thob ste /
translated: “Mahāmati, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who abides in suchness, having attained the domain of realization free from appearances, attains the bodhisattva ground of Supreme Joy.🔽Having attained the bodhisattva ground of Supreme Joy, he turns away from all tīrthikas and lower realms.”

original: des byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba thob nas mu stegs can dang ngan song gi 'gro ba thams cad rnam par log pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas g-yengs te /
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba thob nas mu stegs can dang ngan song gi 'gro ba thams cad rnam par log pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sems mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas g-yengs te /
translated: This is the distraction of ignorance due to the mind not being in equipoise,

original: gang gis mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ming du brjod pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi ming du brjod pa ste /
translated: which is expressed in various ways, like dizziness, fainting, and so on.

original: de ni ming du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ming du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: That is the grasping of names.

original: gzugs sngon po la sogs par 'dzin pa ni de'i 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: gzugs sngon po la sogs par 'dzin pa ni de'i 'khrul pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: The grasping of blue forms and so on is the sign of its delusion.

original: gang gis bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: gang gis bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa ni rnam par rtog go //
translated: The grasping of the signs of beauty and ugliness in women, men, and so on is conceptualization.

original: de ltar 'khrul pa'i sems rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par sgro btags pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i gzhan gyi dbang la yang ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa'i chos su 'byed pa rnams ni 'khor ba la yod do //
analyzed: de ltar 'khrul pa'i sems rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par sgro btags pa'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i gzhan gyi dbang la yang ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa'i chos su 'byed pa rnams ni 'khor ba la yod do //
translated: Thus, in the dependent nature, which is the duality superimposed by the various deluded minds, the phenomena of names, signs, and conceptual thoughts are distinguished, and they exist in saṃsāra.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes de ni gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes de ni gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa de bzhin nyid la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When, through wisdom, one analyzes and understands the coarse and subtle [aspects of the dependent nature] and does not observe them, then one abides in suchness, which is free from thoughts and appearances.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu @246b dga' ba thob ste zhes pa ni chos la bdag med pa 'di yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu @246b dga' ba thob ste zhes pa ni chos la bdag med pa 'di yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Having attained the bodhisattva ground Very Joyful, because of thoroughly knowing this selflessness of phenomena,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa bdag nyid kyis gsal bar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa bdag nyid kyis gsal bar bshad pa'o //
translated: it is explained clearly by the Omniscient One himself.

original: des byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba thob nas mu stegs can dang ngan song gi 'gro ba thams cad las rnam par log pa yin te zhes pa ni mu stegs can rnams rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang /
analyzed: des byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba thob nas mu stegs can dang ngan song gi 'gro ba thams cad las rnam par log pa yin te zhes pa ni mu stegs can rnams rtag pa dang / gcig pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi dang /
translated: Having attained the bodhisattva ground Very Joyful, he turns away from all the tirthikas and the lower realms.

original: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags pas chos dang gang zag la bdag med par thar pa'i rgyu mi shes te rtag pa'i bdag tu chags pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags pas chos dang gang zag la bdag med par thar pa'i rgyu mi shes te rtag pa'i bdag tu chags pa'i phyir //
translated: The tirthikas do not know the cause of liberation, the selflessness of phenomena and persons, because they are attached to permanence,🔽unity, a self, a self’s property, and external objects.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems pas sred pa'i mer phye ma leb bzhin du ltung ngo //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs snyems pas sred pa'i mer phye ma leb bzhin du ltung ngo //
translated: They fall into the fire of craving like moths, puffed up with pride in their discipline and austerities.

original: ji ltar rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa /
translated: As it says in the Vajra Garland:

original: gang ba dang / tsha ba dang / thal ba dang / dri ma 'dzin pa la sogs par thar pa la nor par lta bas gzhan dag kyang log pa'i shes pa sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang ba dang / tsha ba dang / thal ba dang / dri ma 'dzin pa la sogs par thar pa la nor par lta bas gzhan dag kyang log pa'i shes pa sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: They are mistaken about liberation, thinking it is a full vessel, a hot ember, ashes, holding stains, and so on. They cause others to engage in wrong knowledge.

original: yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: Again, Mahamati said,

original: bcom ldan 'das rang bzhin gsum po chos lnga'i nang du 'dus sam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rang bzhin gsum po chos lnga'i nang du 'dus sam /
translated: Bhagavān, are the three natures included in the five dharmas?

original: 'on te rang gi mtshan du grub pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi mtshan du grub pa'am /
translated: Or are they established by their own characteristics?

original: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ci lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: What is it? The Bhagavān replied:

original: blo gros chen po 'di nyid kyi nang du rang bzhin gsum dang / rnam par shes pa brgyad dang / bdag med pa gnyis kyang 'dus so //
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di nyid kyi nang du rang bzhin gsum dang / rnam par shes pa brgyad dang / bdag med pa gnyis kyang 'dus so //
translated: Mahāmati, in this very [five dharmas] the three natures, the eight consciousnesses, and the two kinds of selflessness are included.

original: de la ming dang mtshan ma ni yongs su brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ming dang mtshan ma ni yongs su brtags pa'i mtshan nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: Among them, names and signs should be known as the imagined characteristic.

original: gang yang blo gros chen po de la gnas shing zhugs pa'i rnam par rtog pa sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bsgrags pa nyi ma dang 'od zer lhan cig bzhin du dus gcig tu byung ba sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid rang gi rnam par rtog pa khong
analyzed: gang yang blo gros chen po de la gnas shing zhugs pa'i rnam par rtog pa sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bsgrags pa nyi ma dang 'od zer lhan cig bzhin du dus gcig tu byung ba sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid rang gi rnam par rtog pa khong
translated: Moreover, Mahāmati, the conceptual thoughts that abide in and enter that, proclaimed as mind and mental factors, arising simultaneously like the sun and its rays, the nature that causes one to understand the characteristics of various [phenomena] within one's own

original: du chud par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni blo gros chen po gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: du chud par byed pa'i rang bzhin ni blo gros chen po gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya'o //
translated: conceptual thoughts, Mahāmati, is called the dependent.

original: blo gros chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir rang bzhin yongs su grub par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo gros chen po yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir rang bzhin yongs su grub par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Mahamati, you should know that the perfect wisdom and suchness are the fully present nature because they are indestructible.

original: mtshan ni dbyibs te /
analyzed: mtshan ni dbyibs te /
translated: Signs are shapes.

original: bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa'i gzugs so //
translated: They are the forms of women, men, and so forth.

original: de la ming ni gdos pa zhes sam go cha zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de la ming ni gdos pa zhes sam go cha zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Names are such things as bundle or armor.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'dus pa'i gzhan gyi dbang @247a * //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba 'dus pa'i gzhan gyi dbang @247a * //
translated: Imagination is the dependent nature, which is the collection of mind and mental factors.

original: ste ; rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa ni sngar bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ste ; rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa ni sngar bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is produced by causes and conditions, as explained above.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog cing //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog cing //
translated: It is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //🔽zhes par ro //🔽gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i brtags pa ni yul med pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa // zhes par ro // gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i brtags pa ni yul med pa ste /
translated: Mind and mental factors belong to the three realms.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa /
translated: Imagined natures are objects that do not exist, as stated in the following:

original: brtags pa ni yi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: brtags pa ni yi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Imagined natures are by nature

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes te //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes te //
translated: All things are unproduced.

original: gzhan dbang la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: gzhan dbang la ni brten nas su //
translated: They are imagined in dependence on the dependent.

original: mi rnams rnam par rtog pa skye //
analyzed: mi rnams rnam par rtog pa skye //
translated: People give rise to conceptual thoughts.🔽When one abandons the conceptual

original: gang tshe gzhan dbang rnam rtog gi / rnam par spangs te dag pa ni //
analyzed: gang tshe gzhan dbang rnam rtog gi / rnam par spangs te dag pa ni //
translated: nature of the dependent,

original: grub pa de bzhin nyid ces bya //
analyzed: grub pa de bzhin nyid ces bya //
translated: That accomplishment is called suchness.

original: mdo sde mdo sder ngas bstan to //
analyzed: mdo sde mdo sder ngas bstan to //
translated: I have taught the sūtras as sūtras.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes de bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin mi 'jig pa zhes pa ni shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na mi dmigs pa de ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ming dang mtshan ma
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes de bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin mi 'jig pa zhes pa ni shes rab kyis dpyad de sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na mi dmigs pa de ni yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ming dang mtshan ma
translated: The suchness of correct wisdom is the indestructible nature of the fully present. When analyzed by wisdom and dissected into coarse and subtle parts, it is not observed. That is the name of correct wisdom.

original: dang / rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rjes su mi dmigs pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dang / rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rjes su mi dmigs pa'i phyir de bzhin nyid la gnas pa ste /
translated: Because it is not observed in the aftermath of names, signs, and conceptual thoughts, one abides in suchness.

original: yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The fully present suchness of the essence of buddhahood is naturally luminous.

original: de bzhin du glo bur gyi rnam par dang bral ba mi gnyis pa dus thams cad du gnas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du glo bur gyi rnam par dang bral ba mi gnyis pa dus thams cad du gnas so //
translated: In the same way, it is free from adventitious stains, nondual, and always present.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun ni skad cig pa rnams te de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni skad cig pa 'brel pa'i rtag pas rtag pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun ni skad cig pa rnams te de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni skad cig pa 'brel pa'i rtag pas rtag pa ste /
translated: The seven consciousnesses beginning with eye consciousness are momentary. The consciousness of the ground of all, the essence of the tathiigatagarbha, is permanent because it is a permanent continuum.

original: gser rin po che la sogs pa bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gser rin po che la sogs pa bzhin du yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that its nature is completely pure, like a precious gem such as gold.

original: ji ltar mi 'jig pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'jig pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not destroyed?

original: dus thams cad kyi phyir te /
analyzed: dus thams cad kyi phyir te /
translated: Because it is always present.

original: 'khor ba'i dus su /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dus su /
translated: It is present in samsara.

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, resources, and the appearance of the world

original: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste //🔽rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste // rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: arise from the ground of all.

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: It is like the ocean and its waves.

original: zhes bya bar lan du mar bshad pa yin te /🔽mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas bdag dang bdag gir chags pas 'khor bar 'jug go //
analyzed: zhes bya bar lan du mar bshad pa yin te / mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas bdag dang bdag gir chags pas 'khor bar 'jug go //
translated: This has been explained many times.🔽Through non-equipoised ignorance, one enters samsara through attachment to I and mine.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa rnams gnyis zhi bas bdag med pa gnyis skye'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa rnams gnyis zhi bas bdag med pa gnyis skye'o //
translated: Through the pacification of the two, the apprehension of I and mine, the two kinds of no-self are born.

original: blo gros chen po chos lnga po 'di rnams kyi nang du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / sa rnam @247b par dbye ba'i mtshams sbyar ba dang zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi snang ba dang cas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pas sa'i mtshams sbyor bar bshad do //
analyzed: blo gros chen po chos lnga po 'di rnams kyi nang du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / sa rnam @247b par dbye ba'i mtshams sbyar ba dang zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi snang ba dang cas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'byed pas sa'i mtshams sbyor bar bshad do //
translated: and the connection with the divisions of the stages” means that the connection with the stages is explained by the division into the light of the accumulations of merit and wisdom and the samādhi of non-appearance.

original: theg pa chen por bsdus pa'i tshigs bcad ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen por bsdus pa'i tshigs bcad ni /
translated: The verse summarizing the Mahāyāna:🔽The five dharmas, the natures,🔽and the eight consciousnesses themselves,

original: chos lnga dag dang rang bzhin dang // rnam shes brgyad po nyid dag dang // bdag med rnam pa gnyis por ni //
analyzed: chos lnga dag dang rang bzhin dang // rnam shes brgyad po nyid dag dang // bdag med rnam pa gnyis por ni //
translated: and the two kinds of selflessness—

original: theg chen thams cad 'dus pa yin //
analyzed: theg chen thams cad 'dus pa yin //
translated: all the Mahāyāna is included in these.

original: zhes bya ba las chos lnga ni mdo sde brtsams nas lan du mar bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba las chos lnga ni mdo sde brtsams nas lan du mar bshad mod kyi /
translated: Although the five dharmas have been explained many times in the sūtras,

original: 'on kyang ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas mtshan ma dang / gzugs dang / dbyibs su bstan pa de ltar bshad par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas mtshan ma dang / gzugs dang / dbyibs su bstan pa de ltar bshad par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: nevertheless, just as the Omniscient One taught using signs, forms, and shapes, it should be applied to the explanation in that way.

original: bslad pa'i mthus mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du snang ba ste /
analyzed: bslad pa'i mthus mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du snang ba ste /
