translated: Like the appearance of dizziness and fainting, etc. due to the power of a disturbance.

original: de la ming ni gdos pa dang go cha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni gdos pa dang go cha zhes bya'o //
translated: Name is called “form” and “armor.”

original: gang gis yi ge dang / tshig dang / brjod pa'i mtshan nyid rjod cing sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs de ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis yi ge dang / tshig dang / brjod pa'i mtshan nyid rjod cing sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs de ni rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: That which expresses the characteristics of letters, words, and expressions, and the collection of mind and mental factors, is discursive thought.

original: shes rab kyis dpyod pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis gang gi tshe sbom po dang phra mo'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyod pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis gang gi tshe sbom po dang phra mo'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the coarse and subtle signs are not observed by the wisdom of correct knowledge that analyzes,

original: ming dang rnam par rtog pa med cing gnyis kyi rnam pa bslad pa dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa gser la sogs pa bzhin rtag par gnas so //
analyzed: ming dang rnam par rtog pa med cing gnyis kyi rnam pa bslad pa dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba de bzhin nyid yongs su grub pa gser la sogs pa bzhin rtag par gnas so //
translated: then there is no name or discursive thought, free from the disturbance of dualistic appearances, the thoroughly established suchness that is naturally luminous, always present like gold, etc.

original: rang bzhin ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: Nature is the dharmadhātu,

original: srid pa dang thar pa'i gnas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: srid pa dang thar pa'i gnas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o //
translated: the abode of existence and liberation, the essence of the tathāgatas.

original: rnam grangs su kun gzhi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs su kun gzhi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called the “basis of all” in a figurative sense.

original: de gtogs bar rnam par shes pa brgyad po ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang bdun no //
analyzed: de gtogs bar rnam par shes pa brgyad po ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang bdun no //
translated: The eight consciousnesses are the six active consciousnesses, the emotionally tainted mind, and the storehouse consciousness.

original: bdag med pa gnyis pa gnyis ni chos la bdag med pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis pa gnyis ni chos la bdag med pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of selflessness are the selflessness of objects and the selflessness of persons.

original: chos la bdag med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i chos kyi dngos po med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The selflessness of objects is the nonduality of consciousness that is the absence of the reality of things such as form.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa ni gang skad cig pa yin pa de thams cad se gol gyi sgra dang / 'bab chu la sogs pa lta bur bdag dang gang zag la sogs par brtags pa'i rtag pa med do //🔽ma @248a * //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa ni gang skad cig pa yin pa de thams cad se gol gyi sgra dang / 'bab chu la sogs pa lta bur bdag dang gang zag la sogs par brtags pa'i rtag pa med do // ma @248a * //
translated: The selflessness of persons is the absence of the permanence imagined by the non-Buddhists in the momentary mind and mental functions, which are like the sound of a snapping finger or a waterfall.

original: skyes pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i phyir mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: Because of non-arising, like the son of a barren woman.

original: rtag pa ni rim dang / cig car gyi don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang / cig car gyi don byed par 'gal ba'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
translated: Because of the contradiction of permanence with the performance of function either gradually or instantaneously, like the horn of a donkey, it is a non-entity.

original: des na skad cig pa ma yin pa ci'ang med de /
analyzed: des na skad cig pa ma yin pa ci'ang med de /
translated: Therefore, nothing at all is not momentary.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa ma gtogs par gser la sogs pa bzhin du skad cig ma gzhan du mtshams sbyor bas rtag par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa ma gtogs par gser la sogs pa bzhin du skad cig ma gzhan du mtshams sbyor bas rtag par dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Buddha intended that the essence of the tathiigatagarbha is permanent, like gold, etc., because it is connected with other moments, except for the sound of a finger snap, etc.🔽The sutra that explains the Buddha's thought in the SaJldhinirmocana is the definitive meaning.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i nges pa'i don gyi tshul du gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i nges pa'i don gyi tshul du gsungs pa ni /
translated: It says:

original: ming dang mtshan ma kun rtog pa //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma kun rtog pa //
translated: Name, sign, and conceptualization

original: rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid de //
translated: are the characteristics of the two natures.

original: yang dag ye shes de bzhin nyid //🔽yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes de bzhin nyid // yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Correct pristine wisdom and reality

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: are the characteristics of the thoroughly established.

original: gsum gyi nang du lnga bsdu ba ni ming dang / mtshan ma dang / kun du rtog pa rnams brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gsum gyi nang du lnga bsdu ba ni ming dang / mtshan ma dang / kun du rtog pa rnams brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang rang bzhin gnyis kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Name, sign, and conceptualization are the characteristics of the two natures, the imaginary and the dependent.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang de bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid do /
translated: Correct pristine wisdom and reality are the characteristics of the thoroughly established nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //🔽'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u drug pa las chos lnga dpyad pa gnyis pa'o /🔽// / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no // 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u drug pa las chos lnga dpyad pa gnyis pa'o / // / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: because of its complete accomplishment, it is the nature of nondual pristine awareness.

original: gang 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa brjod pa las de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar gyi gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed do zhes gsungs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽blo gros chen pos cir dgongs she na /🔽bye ma'i rnams la ni tshad yod kyi /🔽dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i la tshad med do zhes de lta bur gsol ba la /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa brjod pa las de bzhin gshegs pa 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar gyi gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed do zhes gsungs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽blo gros chen pos cir dgongs she na /🔽bye ma'i rnams la ni tshad yod kyi /🔽dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i la tshad med do zhes de lta bur gsol ba la /
translated: This concludes the second examination, of the five topics, in the treatise “Distinguishing the Middle from Extremes.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said:

original: sgra ji bzhin gyi don du gzung bar mi bya ste zhes so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin gyi don du gzung bar mi bya ste zhes so //
translated: “Do not hold the meaning of the scriptures literally.”

original: skyi bung ba'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa thob par bya ba sla ba'i phyir dpe tsam du mang po gzhag par gsungs so //
analyzed: skyi bung ba'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa thob par bya ba sla ba'i phyir dpe tsam du mang po gzhag par gsungs so //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings of little merit, the Tathāgata taught many parables to make it easy to attain the state of a tathāgata.

original: au du ma w'a ra'i me tog gi dpes ni rab tu dang ba rnams la thob dka' @248b bar gsungs so //
analyzed: au du ma w'a ra'i me tog gi dpes ni rab tu dang ba rnams la thob dka' @248b bar gsungs so //
translated: But for the sake of those of clear minds, he taught that it is difficult to attain.

original: des na sgra ji bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: des na sgra ji bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, do not hold the meaning of the scriptures literally.

original: don gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'i /
analyzed: don gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'i /
translated: You should follow the meaning,

original: ye ge'i rjes su 'brang bar mi bya zhes so //
analyzed: ye ge'i rjes su 'brang bar mi bya zhes so //
translated: but not follow the words.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa du ma la thabs kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas bshad pa'i chos rnams ni dgongs pa'i don tha dad pa du mar 'jug go //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa du ma la thabs kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas bshad pa'i chos rnams ni dgongs pa'i don tha dad pa du mar 'jug go //
translated: The teachings of the Omniscient One are applied in many different ways, with many different intended meanings, in order to understand the many different inclinations of sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis dam pa'i chos ji lta bur rigs pa de lta bur gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhas pa rnams kyis dam pa'i chos ji lta bur rigs pa de lta bur gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the wise should hold the Dharma in accordance with the way it is to be understood.

original: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma'i chos dang mthun par thams cad mkhyen pas sgra'i don du ma ston par mdzad pa ni sangs rgyas rnams mang ba dang / dag pa dang / mi zad pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / gtsang ba kho na ste /
analyzed: gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma'i chos dang mthun par thams cad mkhyen pas sgra'i don du ma ston par mdzad pa ni sangs rgyas rnams mang ba dang / dag pa dang / mi zad pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / gtsang ba kho na ste /
translated: The buddhas are only many, pure, inexhaustible, unconfused, and clean.

original: de ltar na dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i tshig gi dbang po rnams kyi don du ma'i sgra rnams 'byung gi / ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa de kho na nyid gnyis su med cing /
analyzed: de ltar na dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i tshig gi dbang po rnams kyi don du ma'i sgra rnams 'byung gi / ngo bo nyid kyi de bzhin gshegs pa de kho na nyid gnyis su med cing /
translated: Thus, the sounds of many words arise for the sense faculties of the lord of speech who dwells in the samadhi of the maṇḍala of sound, but the essence of the tathāgatas is not the nondual reality,

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa yang dag par rig pa dngos po dang / dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog par ni ma yin te /
translated: the inconceivable, the nonappearance, the nonconceptualization of the perfect knowledge as existent or nonexistent,

original: der gnyis kyi rnam par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad thams cad mi 'jug go //
analyzed: der gnyis kyi rnam par 'jig rten gyi tha snyad thams cad mi 'jug go //
translated: because there the entire worldly convention of the two does not operate.

original: snang ba med ring gnyis su med pa de kho na nyid der de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma'i khyad par du snang ba dper 'jog par mi mdzad do //
analyzed: snang ba med ring gnyis su med pa de kho na nyid der de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma'i khyad par du snang ba dper 'jog par mi mdzad do //
translated: As long as there is no appearance, the nondual reality is not posited as an example by the Tathagatas, even as the sand of the Ganges.

original: 'on kyang byis pa rnams la bye ma la sogs pa'i dpe rnams gsung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa rnams la bye ma la sogs pa'i dpe rnams gsung ngo //
translated: But for the childish, examples such as sand are taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po spyi dang khyad par du dgongs pa na me lta bur sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can zhes gzhag go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po spyi dang khyad par du dgongs pa na me lta bur sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can zhes gzhag go //
translated: When the Tathagatagarbha is intended in general and in particular, it is posited as the Tathagatagarbha of all sentient beings, like fire.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa la ni 'byed pa'i tha snyad yod kyi brjod du med pas na skad cig ma'i rgyun rnams la ni med do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa la ni 'byed pa'i tha snyad yod kyi brjod du med pas na skad cig ma'i rgyun rnams la ni med do //
translated: In the aspect of duality, there is the convention of division, but in the continua of moments, there is no division because of inexpressibility.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas gang g'a'i bye ma dang 'dra bar rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas gang g'a'i bye ma dang 'dra bar rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, in this way, by abandoning the conceptions of existence and nonexistence, it is like the sand of the Ganges, without conceptualization.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las /
translated: As it is said in the Perfection of Wisdom:

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pas mngon par rtogs pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa mnyam pas mngon par rtogs pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The realization of the equality of existence and non-existence is called realization.

original: dri ma dang bral ba zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //🔽stobs bcu dang / mi @249a * //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dri ma med pa'i phyir ro // stobs bcu dang / mi @249a * //
translated: The absence of the stains of desire, hatred, and ignorance is called freedom from stains.

original: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni chos mngon pa las rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i bshad pa ni chos mngon pa las rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so on should be understood in detail according to the Abhidharma.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i stobs ni thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyi blang ba dang dor ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i stobs ni thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyi blang ba dang dor ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The power of what is possible and what is impossible is the knowledge of what should be adopted and what should be abandoned by those with omniscience.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa'i stobs ni dus gsum gyi ye shes kyi stobs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa'i stobs ni dus gsum gyi ye shes kyi stobs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The power of knowledge of death, transmigration, and rebirth is the power of knowledge of the three times, and so on.

original: mdza' ba dang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dang / nyan thos kyi skye po rnams la byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms shin tu gsungs pa'i phyir ye shes kyi mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: mdza' ba dang khong khro ba med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can dang / nyan thos kyi skye po rnams la byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms shin tu gsungs pa'i phyir ye shes kyi mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The equality of intuition is stated thus: Because of the absence of love and hate, because of the teaching of love, compassion, joy, and equanimity toward all beings, both heterodox and Buddhist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku ni sa'i rdul rnams me'i khams dang 'brel yang mi tshig pa bzhin du chos kyi sku mi 'jig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi chos kyi sku ni sa'i rdul rnams me'i khams dang 'brel yang mi tshig pa bzhin du chos kyi sku mi 'jig go //
translated: The Dharma body of the Tathagatas is indestructible, just as the atoms of the earth are indestructible, even though connected with the fire element.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer snang ba zad med pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sprul pa spros pa rnams kyis don gyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od zer snang ba zad med pa zhes bya ba ni mtha' med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sprul pa spros pa rnams kyis don gyi bya ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inexhaustible light of the Tathagata is the performance of benefit by means of emanations in the endless world spheres.

original: srid pa thams cad du 'jug pa'i rgyu chad pa yin pas na 'khor bar 'jug pa yang med ldog pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang bdag tu chags pa dang / las kyi mthu las srid par 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: srid pa thams cad du 'jug pa'i rgyu chad pa yin pas na 'khor bar 'jug pa yang med ldog pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang bdag tu chags pa dang / las kyi mthu las srid par 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: Since the cause for entering all existences is cut off, there is no entering samsara and no exiting.

original: bdag med par 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag med par 'gyur /
translated: The self would be nonexistent.

original: bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pas de bzhin gshegs pa srid par 'jug pa ni chad do //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis yongs su shes pas de bzhin gshegs pa srid par 'jug pa ni chad do //
translated: The Tathagata's entry into existence is cut off by thoroughly knowing the two kinds of selflessness.

original: 'o na ldog par cis na mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ldog par cis na mi 'gyur /
translated: Well then, why does he not exit?

original: thugs rjes sems can gyi don du bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rjes sems can gyi don du bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He remains for the sake of sentient beings through compassion.

original: chos ni lus med de //
analyzed: chos ni lus med de //
translated: Dharmas are not embodied.🔽Embodied beings are subject to destruction, but not disembodied beings.

original: lus dang ldan pa la 'jig pa yod kyi lus dang mi ldan pa la ni ma yin no zhes pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i gnyis su med pa'i chud pa la nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa la 'jig pa yod kyi lus dang mi ldan pa la ni ma yin no zhes pa ni rnam pa de lta bu'i gnyis su med pa'i chud pa la nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no certainty in such a nondual dharma.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang gi dang gi smon lam gyi bden pa mi 'dor ro zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can mtha' dag la phan pa'i smon lam gyi bde ba ni chos nyid thog mar yongs su mkhyen pa'i thugs rje las byung
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang gi dang gi smon lam gyi bden pa mi 'dor ro zhes pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi sems can mtha' dag la phan pa'i smon lam gyi bde ba ni chos nyid thog mar yongs su mkhyen pa'i thugs rje las byung
translated: The truth of the buddhas' aspirations never fails.🔽The truth of the buddhas' aspirations to benefit all sentient beings arises from their primordial knowledge of the nature of reality.🔽They think, Sentient beings are attached to impermanent, suffering, selfless, and empty phenomena, and they experience suffering due to their misconception of them as being permanent, blissful, having identity, and being pure. We will help them understand the truth with our perfect wisdom.

original: ba ste / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i chos rnams la sems can rnams rtags pa dang / bdag dang bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pas sdug bsngal myong ba de dag la bdag cag gis @249b yang dag pa'i ye shes rab tu chud par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa'i tshe na gang smon lam btab pa de nyid sangs rgyas rnams kyi rjes su 'byung ngo
analyzed: ba ste / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i chos rnams la sems can rnams rtags pa dang / bdag dang bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pas sdug bsngal myong ba de dag la bdag cag gis @249b yang dag pa'i ye shes rab tu chud par bya'o zhes byang chub sems dpa'i tshe na gang smon lam btab pa de nyid sangs rgyas rnams kyi rjes su 'byung ngo
translated: The aspirations they make when they are bodhisattvas are fulfilled when they become buddhas.

original: // dag pa'i dngos por gyur pa bdag tu chags pa dang / 'jungs pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / 'dod chen dang / khro ba dang / gti mug dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / le lo'i skyon dang bral ba'i dam pa rnams la ni gzhan la phan pa ma gtogs pa bya ba gzhan ci yod /
analyzed: // dag pa'i dngos por gyur pa bdag tu chags pa dang / 'jungs pa dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / 'dod chen dang / khro ba dang / gti mug dang / g-yo dang / sgyu dang / le lo'i skyon dang bral ba'i dam pa rnams la ni gzhan la phan pa ma gtogs pa bya ba gzhan ci yod /
translated: What other activity can there be for the holy ones, who are free from the faults of attachment to the self, miserliness, harmfulness, sensuality, anger, delusion, deceit, fraud, and laziness, who are pure in their conduct, and who are intent on the welfare of others?

original: bdag tu chags pa rnams la ni bdag gi don du yod kyi /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa rnams la ni bdag gi don du yod kyi /
translated: Those who are attached to the self have the self as their goal.

original: gang la bdag tu chags pa med pa de la gzhan gyi don legs pa'i chos nyid dus kun du rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: gang la bdag tu chags pa med pa de la gzhan gyi don legs pa'i chos nyid dus kun du rnam par gnas so //
translated: But for those who are not attached to the self, the welfare of others is the true goal at all times.

original: des na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the Lord Buddhas are in a non-abiding nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: They are in a nirvana in which the afflictions have been abandoned.

original: gzhan la phan pa mdzad pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa mdzad pa'i phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med do //
translated: But they are not in a nirvana in which they have abandoned the welfare of others.

original: sems can thams cad ji srid du yongs su mya ngan 'das pa de srid du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thugs rje chen pos bzhugs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ji srid du yongs su mya ngan 'das pa de srid du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams thugs rje chen pos bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas remain for as long as all sentient beings have not attained Nirvana.

original: chos bstan pa thams cad kyang mya ngan las 'das pa 'bab pa'i rgyun dum thun par 'jug pa ste zhes pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa ston pas gang zag la bdag med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su mthun no //
analyzed: chos bstan pa thams cad kyang mya ngan las 'das pa 'bab pa'i rgyun dum thun par 'jug pa ste zhes pa ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa ston pas gang zag la bdag med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su mthun no //
translated: All the teachings of the Dharma are in agreement with Nirvana, since they teach the aggregates, elements, sense-spheres, etc. and are in agreement with the Nirvana which is the non-self of the person.

original: chos la bdag med pas nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs te /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pas nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs te /
translated: By the selflessness of the dharmas, the defilements are abandoned with their traces.

original: nyes pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kho na'o //
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kho na'o //
translated: It is only the Buddha who has attained Nirvana, which is the complete liberation from all faults.

original: blo gros chen po gang gi sems snang ba'i phyi rol gyi don yongs su shes pas thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa gnas nga len rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rgyun rnam par log cing rang gi gnas shin tu gyur pa'i thar pa yin te
analyzed: blo gros chen po gang gi sems snang ba'i phyi rol gyi don yongs su shes pas thog ma med pa'i dus kyi spros pa gnas nga len rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rgyun rnam par log cing rang gi gnas shin tu gyur pa'i thar pa yin te
translated: “Mahāmati, liberation is the transformation of one’s own abode, by the cessation of the continuum of the habitual tendencies of conceptualization, which are the grasping of beginningless time, through the thorough understanding of external objects that appear to the mind.🔽Mahāmati, it is not destruction.”

original: / blo gros chen po 'jig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs na thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / blo gros chen po 'jig pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs na thar par 'gyur te /
translated: If one abandons the conceptualization that is the error of permanence, self, purity, and happiness, one will be liberated.

original: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi gnas shin tu rab tu gyur pa ni thar pa yin gyi /
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi gnas shin tu rab tu gyur pa ni thar pa yin gyi /
translated: The transformation of the abode of erroneous conceptualization is liberation.

original: sems @250a * //
analyzed: sems @250a * //
translated: The mind

original: 'jig par 'gyur ba ni thar pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur ba ni thar pa ma yin te /
translated: is not destroyed, and liberation is not the destruction of the mind.🔽Like stainless gold, when one is free from afflictions, that is liberation.

original: gser gyi dri ma med pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang bral na thar pa'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: gser gyi dri ma med pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang bral na thar pa'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: This is the meaning of the Omniscient One’s intention.

original: 'khor ba'i thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' ni rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' ni rnam par rtog pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The beginning and end of cyclic existence are a special kind of conceptualization.

original: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni khyad par dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i ye shes ni khyad par dang bral ba'o //
translated: Nondual intuition is free from distinctions.

original: der ni thog ma dang / tha ma'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir de la 'jig pa dang skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: der ni thog ma dang / tha ma'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir de la 'jig pa dang skye ba'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: Therein, because there is no conceptualization of beginning and end, there is no conceptualization of destruction and origination.

original: skad cig pa'i rgyun rtag pa nyid myong du zin yang brjod du med pa'i phyir snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa 'byung ngo zhes lan grangs mang por bshad pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa'i rgyun rtag pa nyid myong du zin yang brjod du med pa'i phyir snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa rnams kyi chos bstan pa 'byung ngo zhes lan grangs mang por bshad pa'o //
translated: Although the continuity of momentary [moments] is permanent, it is experienced but inexpressible. Therefore, the teaching of the Dharma occurs for those who abide in meditative concentration with illumination. This has been explained many times.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u drug pa las gang g'a'i bye ma dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa dpyad pa gsum pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u drug pa las gang g'a'i bye ma dang 'dra bar de bzhin gshegs pa dpyad pa gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the sixth chapter of the commentary on the noble Descent into Laṅkā, called “The Analysis of the Tathāgata,” which is like the sand of the Ganges.

original: // / 'phags pa blo gros chen pos gsol pa la ci dgongs she na /
analyzed: // / 'phags pa blo gros chen pos gsol pa la ci dgongs she na /
translated: What was the intention of the noble Mahāmati’s request?

original: kha cig ni skad cig pa gzhan du phyir mtshams sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: kha cig ni skad cig pa gzhan du phyir mtshams sbyor ba med de /
translated: Some say: There is no connection to another moment.

original: se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa lta bur de dag gsal bar skad cig pa'o //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa lta bur de dag gsal bar skad cig pa'o //
translated: They are momentary, like the sound of a finger snap.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig par yang yid ches na gang dag yang ri la sogs pa gzung ba snang ba rnams skad cig pa gzhan 'dra ba'i sems skyed par byed pa de dag tha dad med na ji ltar skad cig par rtogs
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams skad cig par yang yid ches na gang dag yang ri la sogs pa gzung ba snang ba rnams skad cig pa gzhan 'dra ba'i sems skyed par byed pa de dag tha dad med na ji ltar skad cig par rtogs
translated: If one believes that eye consciousness and so on are momentary, then how could one understand that those appearing objects such as mountains are momentary, since they generate a mind that is similar to another moment?🔽If they are not different, how could one understand that they are momentary?

original: par 'gyur skad cig pa dang skad cig pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad ji ltar 'jug ces de skad bstan pa kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las dgongs te /
analyzed: par 'gyur skad cig pa dang skad cig pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad ji ltar 'jug ces de skad bstan pa kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa las dgongs te /
translated: How could one apply the conventions of momentary and nonmomentary?🔽The Bhagavān taught this in the context of foundation consciousness and engaging consciousness.

original: der thams cad mkhyen pa'i las ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: der thams cad mkhyen pa'i las ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The omniscient one said this to him:

original: blo gros chen po chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po chos thams cad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Mahāmati, all phenomena are as follows.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang /🔽zag pa med pa dang / zin pa dang / ma zin pa rnams yin te /🔽blo gros chen po mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga sems @250b dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba sems dang yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags rgyas pa'i skye bo rnams kyis dge ba dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / zin pa dang / ma zin pa rnams yin te / blo gros chen po mdor na len pa'i phung po lnga sems @250b dang / yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba sems dang yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags rgyas pa'i skye bo rnams kyis dge ba dang /
translated: virtue and nonvirtue, compounded and uncompounded, mundane and supramundane, reprehensible and irreproachable, contaminated and uncontaminated, appropriated and unappropriated.🔽Mahamati, in brief, the five appropriated aggregates arise from the causes of the latent tendencies of mind, thought, and the mental consciousness.

original: mi dge bar yongs su brtags so //
analyzed: mi dge bar yongs su brtags so //
translated: Beings whose latent tendencies of mind, thought, and the mental consciousness are developed impute virtue and nonvirtue.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni zag pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni zag pa ste /
translated: The happiness of samadhi and the meditative absorptions are called 'contaminants' because they are the causes of the latent tendencies of mind, thought, and the mental consciousness.

original: de dag la ni ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par grol bas na zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par grol bas na zag pa med pa ste /
translated: They are uncontaminated because they are liberated from concentration and meditative absorption.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pas gsal bar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pas gsal bar bshad pa'o //
translated: All virtuous phenomena are explained by the Omniscient One.

original: sems dang ; yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags brtas pa'i byis pa rnams kyis mtho ris dang / ngan song gi rgyu dge ba dang mi dge ba bcu sems can la phan pa dang / gnod pa'i mtshan nyid can la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthus yongs su brtags so //
analyzed: sems dang ; yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags brtas pa'i byis pa rnams kyis mtho ris dang / ngan song gi rgyu dge ba dang mi dge ba bcu sems can la phan pa dang / gnod pa'i mtshan nyid can la dge ba dang mi dge ba'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i mthus yongs su brtags so //
translated: The ten virtuous and nonvirtuous causes of the higher realms and lower realms, which are the development of the habitual tendencies of mind, mentation, and the mental consciousness, are imputed by childish beings through the power of the full ripening of the habitual tendencies of virtue and nonvirtue, which are characterized by benefiting and harming sentient beings.

original: rmi lam bzang po dang rmi lam ngan pa mthong ba lta bur bde ba dang / sdug bsngal rnam par smin par snang bas rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi tshogs so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: rmi lam bzang po dang rmi lam ngan pa mthong ba lta bur bde ba dang / sdug bsngal rnam par smin par snang bas rnam par shes pa brgyad kyi tshogs so sor snang ngo //
translated: Like seeing good and bad dreams, the eight collections of consciousness appear individually, manifesting as the ripening of happiness and suffering.

original: de la skad cig ma'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun rnams 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: de la skad cig ma'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa bdun rnams 'byung ngo ;
translated: The seven consciousnesses, which are imbued with the habitual tendencies of the instant, arise.

original: / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni zag pa med pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pas skad cig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni zag pa med pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pas skad cig pa ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata-essence, the fundamental consciousness, is not momentary, because it is perfumed by the uncontaminated predispositions.

original: skad cig pa gzhan du phyir mtshams sbyor bas rtag pa dang / chad pa dang bral ba rgyun mi 'chad par rtag tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: skad cig pa gzhan du phyir mtshams sbyor bas rtag pa dang / chad pa dang bral ba rgyun mi 'chad par rtag tu 'byung ngo //
translated: It is permanent, because it is connected to another moment, and it is free from annihilation and permanence, because it is uninterrupted and always occurring.

original: mu stegs can dang / nyan thos kyi rtag pa dang mi rtag par brtags pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir de skad cig pa ma yin par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang / nyan thos kyi rtag pa dang mi rtag par brtags pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir de skad cig pa ma yin par dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is not momentary, because it is intended to eliminate the tīrthikas’ and śrāvakas’ imagined permanence and impermanence.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: As the Sūtra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni ston pas brtags pa'i tshig go zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba 'di ni ston pas brtags pa'i tshig go zhes 'byung ste /
translated: “Son of noble family, ‘conditioned’ and ‘unconditioned’ are terms designated by the Teacher.

original: dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pas na 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pas na 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: Since it is not created by any creator, it is unconditioned.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'brel pa'i phyir 'dus byas te lan du mar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'brel pa'i phyir 'dus byas te lan du mar bshad pa'o //
translated: Since it is connected in a continuum of moments, it is conditioned, explained many times.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bdun ni @251a * //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bdun ni @251a * //
translated: Because the residues of the contaminated are fully matured, the seven consciousnesses

original: skad cig pa rnams so //
analyzed: skad cig pa rnams so //
translated: are momentary.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga mu stegs can rnams kyis rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga mu stegs can rnams kyis rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: The five consciousnesses of eye, etc., are inferred by the tīrthikas,

original: rang gi sems snang ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba ma rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they do not understand that they are the appearance of one’s own mind.

original: 'gag pa na yid kyi rnam par shes pa kha dog dang / nga rod dang / dbyibs su nye bar skye ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i bag chags 'gag par ma gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa na yid kyi rnam par shes pa kha dog dang / nga rod dang / dbyibs su nye bar skye ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i bag chags 'gag par ma gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: When they cease, the mental consciousness arises in the form of color, shape, and extent, until the residues of virtue and nonvirtue cease.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de phyi rol gyi sbom po dang phra mo mi dmigs pa de na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa shin tu gyur te /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de phyi rol gyi sbom po dang phra mo mi dmigs pa de na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa shin tu gyur te /
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, the gross and subtle external are not perceived, then the consciousness of the ground of all has been transformed.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gzugs mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gzugs mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa mi dmigs te /
translated: The signs of attachment, etc., the beautiful form, the ugly form, etc., are not perceived.

original: de'i tshe zag pa med cing rtag pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa mi 'gyur bar grub pas grub pa'i phyir mi ldog go //
analyzed: de'i tshe zag pa med cing rtag pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa mi 'gyur bar grub pas grub pa'i phyir mi ldog go //
translated: At that time, it is established as unchanging, imbued with the latent tendencies of the undefiled and permanent, and therefore it does not revert.

original: rdo rje dang gser la sogs pa lta bur rtag pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje dang gser la sogs pa lta bur rtag pa ste /
translated: It is permanent, like a diamond or gold,

original: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas bskal par bzhag kyang zad pa med pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pas bskal par bzhag kyang zad pa med pa lta bu ste /
translated: and like the fact that, even if it were to remain for an eon, it would not be exhausted, because it has abandoned false conceptualization.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang gtsang ba'i dngos po phyin ci log pa rnams kyis de'i phyir yang nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang gtsang ba'i dngos po phyin ci log pa rnams kyis de'i phyir yang nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is also not afflicted by the errors of permanence, self, purity, and so on.

original: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i chos rnam par rtog pas chos yongs su dag pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i thugs rje ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i chos rnam par rtog pas chos yongs su dag pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i thugs rje ste /
translated: The compassion that follows from the purification of phenomena is the conceptualization of impermanence, selflessness, suffering, ugliness, and emptiness.

original: de ltar na chos ston pa yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na chos ston pa yang 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the teaching of the Dharma also arises.

original: des na nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni spang gi / dge ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni spang gi / dge ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the conceptualization of affliction is abandoned, but not virtue.

original: de'i phyir ston pa de la nyon mongs pa kun du rtog pa med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir ston pa de la nyon mongs pa kun du rtog pa med de /
translated: Therefore, the Teacher has no afflictive thoughts.🔽Since he has exhausted the obscurations, who could prevent him from benefiting migrating beings and engaging in virtue?

original: sgrib pa zad pas 'gro ba la phan pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i dge ba sus dgag / ji ltar mdo sde 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa zad pas 'gro ba la phan pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i dge ba sus dgag / ji ltar mdo sde 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: As it says in this sutra:

original: mtshan nyid dang ni bya ba dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' //🔽rnam rtog rnam shes bzlog pa na //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni bya ba dang // dngos por mya ngan nga mi 'da' // rnam rtog rnam shes bzlog pa na //
translated: I do not pass into nirvana in terms of characteristics, actions,🔽and entities.🔽I am nirvana,

original: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o //
translated: the reversal of conceptual consciousness.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: Thus,

original: der ni thams cad mkhyen pas log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong bar dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: der ni thams cad mkhyen pas log pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong bar dgongs pa ste /
translated: the Omniscient One intends to abandon false conceptualization.

original: gzhan du na gsol pa'i lan du chos ston pa ji ltar na 'byung /
analyzed: gzhan du na gsol pa'i lan du chos ston pa ji ltar na 'byung /
translated: Otherwise, how could the teaching of the dharma occur in response to requests?

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u drug pa las skad cig mar 'jig pa dpyad pa bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u drug pa las skad cig mar 'jig pa dpyad pa bzhi pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fourth chapter of the commentary on the Transmission of Lanka, called “The Analysis of Momentary Destruction.”

original: // / @251b yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
analyzed: // / @251b yang blo gros chen pos gsol pa /
translated: Again, Mahāmati made a request:

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas na sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal to zhes pa der thams cad mkhyen pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi khyad par rgyas par gsungs pa
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par byas na sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro zhes bka' stsal to zhes pa der thams cad mkhyen pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi khyad par rgyas par gsungs pa
translated: The Omniscient One has extensively taught the distinctions of the perfections there:

original: ste / bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags te /
analyzed: ste / bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags te /
translated: “Attachment to ‘I’ and ‘mine,’

original: 'bras bu re ba ni 'jig rten ba'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu re ba ni 'jig rten ba'i sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and hoping for results are the worldly perfections of generosity, ethics, and so on.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni phyi rol du mngon par chags te 'bras bu re bar zhugs pa na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni phyi rol du mngon par chags te 'bras bu re bar zhugs pa na /
translated: When one engages in the supramundane perfections with attachment to external results and hoping for results,

original: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos rnams kyi'o //
translated: they are the perfections of the noble śrāvakas.

original: blo gros chen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Mahāmati, the supramundane dharmas are called ‘the perfections of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.’ And so on.

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs kyi bag chags las skyes pa'i rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs par 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du sna tshogs kyi bag chags las skyes pa'i rang gi sems snang ba'i rnam par rtog pas rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs par 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Like dreams, magical illusions, and so on, the various appearances of one’s mind arise from habitual tendencies.  The conceptual mind apprehends them as permanent or impermanent, beautiful or ugly, and so on.

original: shes rab kyis gzhigs pa ni phyi rol gyi don mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyis gzhigs pa ni phyi rol gyi don mi mthong ngo //
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom, one does not see external objects.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rang gi sems gzugs su snang ba la mtshan nyid rnams kyi sra ba dang gsher ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du de ltar mngon par chags pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la mngon par chags par mi byed de /🔽de ltar phyi'i don du mngon par chags pa med par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rang gi sems gzugs su snang ba la mtshan nyid rnams kyi sra ba dang gsher ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du de ltar mngon par chags pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams la mngon par chags par mi byed de / de ltar phyi'i don du mngon par chags pa med par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, one does not cling to the appearances of one’s own mind as forms, nor does one cling to the great elements that are imputed to have the characteristics of solidity, fluidity, and so on.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, without clinging to external objects, the perfection of generosity arises for the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi snang ba'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du de dag las phan pa dang bde bar 'byung ngo //🔽de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa rnams kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol du phyin pa rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' bar chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs shing phyi rol gyi don du mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi snang ba'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du de dag las phan pa dang bde bar 'byung ngo // de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i chos dang / zang zing dang mi 'jigs pa rnams kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol du phyin pa rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' bar chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs shing phyi rol gyi don du mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir
translated: The way in which the world appears is the way in which benefit and happiness arise for sentient beings.🔽Similarly, the bodhisattva's perfection of generosity is completed by means of the Dharma, material things and fearlessness.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol du phyin pa rdzogs par byed cing byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba yang thob par 'gyur ro //🔽chos dang gang zag la @252a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol du phyin pa rdzogs par byed cing byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba yang thob par 'gyur ro // chos dang gang zag la @252a * //
translated: On the bodhisattva's ground of Perfect Joy, the perfection of generosity is completed and the bodhisattva ground of Perfect Joy is attained because of the realization of the selflessness of persons and phenomena and because of the absence of attachment to external objects.

original: bdag med par ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bdag med par ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is the selflessness of persons and phenomena realized?

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas skad cig 'jig cing thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' stong pa rang bzhin gnyis kyis kyang stong zhing bya ba dang byed pa po dang 'brel te /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pas skad cig 'jig cing thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' stong pa rang bzhin gnyis kyis kyang stong zhing bya ba dang byed pa po dang 'brel te /
translated: The Omniscient One has said that all things are momentary, perishable, empty of beginning and end, empty of intrinsic nature, and related as action and agent.

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa lhag pa'i chos dang bral ba mi gnyis pa skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'byung zhing brjod du med par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa lhag pa'i chos dang bral ba mi gnyis pa skad cig ma'i rgyun du 'byung zhing brjod du med par gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are devoid of the remaining attributes such as arising, enduring, and ceasing, are nondual, arise in a continuum of moments, and are inexpressible.🔽If they were permanent, they would not be momentary.

original: skad cig pa dang skad cig pa ma yin par rtag na dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: skad cig pa dang skad cig pa ma yin par rtag na dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: The Samdhinirmocana states:

original: ji ltar 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas par 'byung ba de ltar 'dir yang dgongs pa yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas par 'byung ba de ltar 'dir yang dgongs pa yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: Just as the conditioned and the unconditioned occur, so too should the intention be understood here.

original: gzhan du na chos nyid dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na chos nyid dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict reality.

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the intention should be explained.🔽The childish conceive the conditioned

original: stong pa mi rtag skad cig par //
analyzed: stong pa mi rtag skad cig par //
translated: As empty, impermanent, and momentary,

original: 'dus byas la ni byis pa rtog /'bab chu mar me sa bon dpes //
analyzed: 'dus byas la ni byis pa rtog /'bab chu mar me sa bon dpes //
translated: Using the examples of a waterfall, a flame, and a seed.

original: skad cig pa yi don du rtog / ces pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig pa yi don du rtog / ces pa ste /
translated: It is imagined that it is momentary.

original: 'bab chu dang sa bon la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam pa can ni skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'bab chu dang sa bon la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam pa can ni skye ba med pa ste /
translated: The two aspects of a waterfall and a seed and so on are not produced.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam pa sna tshogs nor ba'i rnam pa rnams ni med bas na der byis pa rnams kyis skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin par ci zhig rnam par rtog ces thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam pa sna tshogs nor ba'i rnam pa rnams ni med bas na der byis pa rnams kyis skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin par ci zhig rnam par rtog ces thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: Like a dream, a magical display and so on, the dependent is not the various aspects of error. Therefore, the Omniscient One thinks, “What do the childish imagine there, as momentary or not momentary?”🔽But if the dependent is not produced in the various aspects, how could the completely existent, which is other, be momentary or not momentary?

original: 'on te gzhan gyi dbang rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa rnams la skye ba med na yongs su grub pa gzhan la skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa kho na ji ltar na yod par 'gyur zhes de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi dbang rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa rnams la skye ba med na yongs su grub pa gzhan la skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa kho na ji ltar na yod par 'gyur zhes de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Omniscient One, thinking thus, doubts, and then declares:

original: byed pa med cing skad cig pa //
analyzed: byed pa med cing skad cig pa //
translated: It is without activity and momentary.

original: dben pa med pa spangs pa dang // chos rnams skye ba med pa ni //
analyzed: dben pa med pa spangs pa dang // chos rnams skye ba med pa ni //
translated: The non-existence of isolation, the abandonment, and the non-production of phenomena,

original: skad cig don du ngas bshad do //
analyzed: skad cig don du ngas bshad do //
translated: I have explained for the sake of the moment.

original: zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa la thams cad mkhyen pas don dam par skad cig tu 'jig par grub pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa la thams cad mkhyen pas don dam par skad cig tu 'jig par grub pa ste /
translated: This is the accomplishment of the thoroughly established nature as momentary disintegration in the ultimate by the Omniscient One.

original: gnyis su med pa'i yang dag par rig pa de la gnod pa med cing rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir na yod do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i yang dag par rig pa de la gnod pa med cing rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir na yod do //
translated: Since that non-dual correct awareness is not impaired and is of one nature, it exists.

original: chos thams cad la ni byed pa med /
analyzed: chos thams cad la ni byed pa med /
translated: All phenomena are without activity.

original: byed pa gang gis kyang su yang mi byed de /
analyzed: byed pa gang gis kyang su yang mi byed de /
translated: By no activity whatsoever is anything made.

original: nam skad cig pa gcig pa de ni skad cig pa gnyis po med na su zhig bya ba dang byed pa po dang @252b mngon par 'brel par 'gyur /
analyzed: nam skad cig pa gcig pa de ni skad cig pa gnyis po med na su zhig bya ba dang byed pa po dang @252b mngon par 'brel par 'gyur /
translated: When there is only one moment, if there is no second moment, who would be connected with the action and the agent?

original: ji ltar lung ston pa po rnams kyi byed pa po ni rang dbang can dang / bya ba 'dod pa'i gtso bo ni las dang / sgrub pa'i mchog ni bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa ni rgyun rtag par brtags te gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la 'dis byed do zhes ni rigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar lung ston pa po rnams kyi byed pa po ni rang dbang can dang / bya ba 'dod pa'i gtso bo ni las dang / sgrub pa'i mchog ni bya ba la sogs par rtogs pa ni rgyun rtag par brtags te gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la 'dis byed do zhes ni rigs so //
translated: The consciousness that has the aspect of duality is conceived to be the creator.

original: gang yang bya ba dang byed pa po gnyis las dben zhing mi gnyis pa de ni bya ba dang byed pa por 'byed pa'i byed pa dang bral bas na skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i rim gyi chos rnams skad cig pa la med do //
analyzed: gang yang bya ba dang byed pa po gnyis las dben zhing mi gnyis pa de ni bya ba dang byed pa por 'byed pa'i byed pa dang bral bas na skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i rim gyi chos rnams skad cig pa la med do //
translated: That which is devoid of the duality of activity and agent, and is nondual, is free from the activity that distinguishes activity and agent. Therefore, the sequence of phenomena such as arising, enduring, and ceasing do not exist in the momentary.

original: bdag med pa gnyis la yang med de /
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis la yang med de /
translated: They also do not exist in the two kinds of selflessness.

original: lan du mar sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: lan du mar sgrub pa'o //
translated: This is proven many times.

original: des na chos rnams skye ba med pa ni skad cig pa'i don no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na chos rnams skye ba med pa ni skad cig pa'i don no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the absence of arising of phenomena is the meaning of momentariness. This is the intended meaning of the Omniscient One.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni //
translated: Dependent origination

original: byung ba med ces seng ge'i sgra //
analyzed: byung ba med ces seng ge'i sgra //
translated: “There is no arising” is the lion’s roar.

original: de nyid sgrub par mdzad pas na //🔽skyes ma thag tu 'jig par ni //
analyzed: de nyid sgrub par mdzad pas na // skyes ma thag tu 'jig par ni //
translated: Because it is established in reality,

original: byis pa rnams la nga mi 'chad //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la nga mi 'chad //
translated: I do not teach to the childish🔽that things are destroyed as soon as they arise.

original: dngos po rnams ni rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni rnam rtog pa //
translated: Things are imagined to be

original: bar chad med par 'gro bar g-yo //
analyzed: bar chad med par 'gro bar g-yo //
translated: moving without obstruction.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i skad cig pa gcig gi rim thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis byis pa rnams la mi 'chad do //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i skad cig pa gcig gi rim thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis byis pa rnams la mi 'chad do //
translated: The Omniscient Ones do not teach to the childish that all things are momentary, destroyed as soon as they arise.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'i chos rnams ni rgyun du gnas pa la 'chad do zhes dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / rga ba dang / mi rtag pa'i chos rnams ni rgyun du gnas pa la 'chad do zhes dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: The meaning is that they teach that things, which are subject to arising, enduring, aging, and being impermanent, exist in a continuous series.

original: sems ni 'byung bar byed pa yi //
analyzed: sems ni 'byung bar byed pa yi //
translated: The cause of the arising of the mind

original: rgyu ni ma rig de yin te //
analyzed: rgyu ni ma rig de yin te //
translated: is ignorance.

original: ji srid gzugs dag mi shes pa //
analyzed: ji srid gzugs dag mi shes pa //
translated: As long as one does not understand form,

original: de srid bar du de gnas ci //
analyzed: de srid bar du de gnas ci //
translated: for that long one remains in that state.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'di byed do zhes byed pa por 'brel te dngos po rnams kyi rim gro ba rnam par rtog pas g-yo ba de ni sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dis 'di byed do zhes byed pa por 'brel te dngos po rnams kyi rim gro ba rnam par rtog pas g-yo ba de ni sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa ste /
translated: This is the connection: “This one does this.” The movement of the imagination of the various activities of things is the ignorance of sentient beings.

original: byed pa por rang dbang can gyis gnas pa'i las byed do zhes byed pa dang / byed pa por rtog pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa por rang dbang can gyis gnas pa'i las byed do zhes byed pa dang / byed pa por rtog pa ste /
translated: The imagination of the agent is the activity of the independent agent who performs the action.

original: de lta bur rtag pa dang / bdag dang / byed pa po la mngon par chags pa'i phyir 'khor bar gdags so //
analyzed: de lta bur rtag pa dang / bdag dang / byed pa po la mngon par chags pa'i phyir 'khor bar gdags so //
translated: Thus, the designation of cyclic existence is due to the attachment to permanence, self, and agent.

original: skad cig tu 'jig pa yongs su shes pas ni bdag tu chags pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: skad cig tu 'jig pa yongs su shes pas ni bdag tu chags pa med par 'gyur /
translated: By understanding momentariness, attachment to self is eliminated.

original: bdag tu chags pa med na longs spyod kyi don du las mi byed do //🔽sems rnams rnam pa sna tshogs su bslad pas bde ba @253a * //
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa med na longs spyod kyi don du las mi byed do // sems rnams rnam pa sna tshogs su bslad pas bde ba @253a * //
translated: When there is no attachment to self, one does not perform actions for the sake of enjoyment.

original: dang ; sdug bsngal du 'byed pas dbye ba na skad cig tu 'jig pa mngon sum du grub bo //
analyzed: dang ; sdug bsngal du 'byed pas dbye ba na skad cig tu 'jig pa mngon sum du grub bo //
translated: The mind is polluted in various ways, and pleasure and pain are distinguished. Thus, momentariness is established by direct perception.

original: der glengs pa /
analyzed: der glengs pa /
translated: This is discussed there.

original: gal te thams cad skad cig tu 'jig na dus gzhan du de nyid 'di yin no zhes par ji ltar na 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te thams cad skad cig tu 'jig na dus gzhan du de nyid 'di yin no zhes par ji ltar na 'gyur /
translated: If everything is momentary, how can it be said that this is the same as that at another time?

original: de ni 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir shes pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan 'byung ba'i phyir shes pa 'jug ste /
translated: It is said to be the same because another moment that is similar to it arises.

original: skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad nas yang skye ba lta bu yin gyi se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa bzhin du 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan mtshams sbyor ba med par thams cad skad cig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skra dang rtsva la sogs pa bcad nas yang skye ba lta bu yin gyi se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa bzhin du 'dra ba'i skad cig pa gzhan mtshams sbyor ba med par thams cad skad cig pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as hair and grass, etc. that have been cut grow again, but not without the connection of another moment that is similar to it, as is the case with the sound of a finger snap, etc.

original: de bzhin du skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa la dgongs te thams cad mkhyen pas mtshams sbyor gnas ston par mdzad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa la dgongs te thams cad mkhyen pas mtshams sbyor gnas ston par mdzad pa /
translated: In the same way, the Omniscient One, intending to teach that some things are momentary and some are not, taught the connection and duration of things.🔽The yogi’s meditative absorption,🔽gold, the relics of the Victorious Ones,

original: rnal 'byor can gyi snyoms 'jug dang // gser dang rgyal ba'i ring bsrel dang // 'od snang gnas kyi gzhal med khang //🔽'jig rten rgyu yis 'jig pa med //
analyzed: rnal 'byor can gyi snyoms 'jug dang // gser dang rgyal ba'i ring bsrel dang // 'od snang gnas kyi gzhal med khang // 'jig rten rgyu yis 'jig pa med //
translated: and the celestial palaces of the luminous abodes

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: are not destroyed by the destruction of the world.

original: rgyus btab pa skad cig ma'i rgyun du bskal par 'khor bar yang gnas te /🔽ji ltar gser dang / bde bar gshegs pa'i ring bsrel dang / rdo rje rin po che dang / 'od snang ba'i gzhal med khang dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i lus la sogs pa bskal pa'i gnas bstan no //

analyzed: kha cig ni skad cig pa gzhan du sdod pa med par skad cig pa de nyid la se gol gyi sgra la sogs pa lta bur rnam par 'jig go //
translated: The duration of the life of the sentient beings of the hells is not determined; they can die before the end of an eon.

original: gnas pa rnams dang thob pa'i chos //🔽sangs rgyas ye shes phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: gnas pa rnams dang thob pa'i chos // sangs rgyas ye shes phun sum tshogs //
translated: The duration of the life of the sentient beings of the realm of fine-materiality is fixed; they necessarily live one eon.🔽The duration of the life of the sentient beings of the realm of desire is not fixed; there is no life that would last only one instant.

original: dge slong nyid dang shes thob rnams //
analyzed: dge slong nyid dang shes thob rnams //
translated: The sentient beings of the realm of desire are born, die and enter into the mother’s womb in an instant.

original: skad cig mar ni ji ltar mthong //🔽zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas rgyun rtag pas rtag pa nyid du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig mar ni ji ltar mthong //🔽zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas rgyun rtag pas rtag pa nyid du dgongs pa'o //
