original: gal te de dag rnams kyang skad cig pa gcig tu gnas su zin na ni de'i tshe 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba kho na dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa kho na dang dge slong ni dge slong ma yin pa kho na'i glags su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de dag rnams kyang skad cig pa gcig tu gnas su zin na ni de'i tshe 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'dod chags dang ma bral ba kho na dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa kho na dang dge slong ni dge slong ma yin pa kho na'i glags su 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were to endure for a single moment, then one who is free from attachment would be one who is not free from attachment, one who is omniscient would be one who is not omniscient, and a monk would be one who is not a monk.

original: gal te 'dri ba'i skad cig pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur na ni des na skad cig pa'i rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dri ba'i skad cig pa gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba med par 'gyur na ni des na skad cig pa'i rgyun chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the moment of asking were not to be connected to another moment, then the continuum of moments would be severed.

original: de'i phyir dgongs pas skad cig pa kho na ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pas skad cig pa kho na ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is momentary only in terms of an intention.

original: mu stegs byed pa'i rgyu lta bur rtag pa'i dngos por yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs byed pa'i rgyu lta bur rtag pa'i dngos por yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that it is a permanent entity, like the cause of the tīrthikas.

original: @253b de ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bul sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: @253b de ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bul sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Since it is unborn, it is like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: sgyu ma dri za'i grong la sogs //
analyzed: sgyu ma dri za'i grong la sogs //
translated: Like illusions, cities of gandharvas, and so on,

original: gzugs rnams ji ltar skad cig pa //
analyzed: gzugs rnams ji ltar skad cig pa //
translated: how are forms momentary?

original: 'byung ba ma yin gzugs rnams dang // 'byung ba de dag gang du song //
analyzed: 'byung ba ma yin gzugs rnams dang // 'byung ba de dag gang du song //
translated: Forms are not elements, and where do the elements go?

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don med pas 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs su snang ba rnams dri za'i grong khyer dang sgyu ma dang / rmi lam la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa ma skyes pas na der skad cig pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don med pas 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs su snang ba rnams dri za'i grong khyer dang sgyu ma dang / rmi lam la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa ma skyes pas na der skad cig pa dang /
translated: Since external objects do not exist, the appearances of forms of the elements and derivative form are like the appearances of a city of gandharvas, illusions, dreams, etc. Since the various aspects of the dependent nature are not produced, they are momentary and not momentary.

original: skad cig pa ma yin pa kho nar ci yod /
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin pa kho nar ci yod /
translated: What is there?

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as previously explained.

original: de de ltar chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi don du mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir mu stegs byed dang / nyan thos rnams las lhag par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed cir byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba thob bo //
analyzed: de de ltar chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi don du mngon par chags pa med pa'i phyir mu stegs byed dang / nyan thos rnams las lhag par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rdzogs par byed cir byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba thob bo //
translated: Thus, by realizing the selflessness of phenomena and persons, he surpasses the tīrthikas and śrāvakas because he is not attached to permanence, self, and external objects. He completes the perfection of generosity and attains the bodhisattva ground Joyful.🔽The bodhisattva who is the chief of the venerable ones,

original: btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor dam pa la /
analyzed: btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor dam pa la /
translated: in the excellent yoga,

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni mu stegs byed dang nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor la mchog chos dang / gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir sa'i dbang po rnams rnal 'byor dam pa la rnal 'byor pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni mu stegs byed dang nyan thos kyi rnal 'byor la mchog chos dang / gang zag la bdag med pa rtogs pa'i phyir sa'i dbang po rnams rnal 'byor dam pa la rnal 'byor pa yin no //
translated: is called a yogī. The yogī is the one who is in the excellent yoga of the bodhisattva who is the chief of the venerable ones, because he realizes the selflessness of phenomena and persons.

original: gang dmigs pa de nyid la rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug par sgom pa de ni tshul khrims te /
analyzed: gang dmigs pa de nyid la rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug par sgom pa de ni tshul khrims te /
translated: That which is the cultivation of non-conceptuality with regard to that very object is morality.🔽That which is the cultivation of non-conceptuality with regard to that very object is morality.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi dngos po med pas mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa'i ngang tshul du byed de /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi dngos po med pas mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa'i ngang tshul du byed de /
translated: The so-called perfection is the state of non-engagement of the conceptualization of the beautiful and the ugly, etc. due to the non-existence of external entities of form.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad nas sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs te mi dmigs pa de na /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad nas sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs te mi dmigs pa de na /
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom, the coarse and subtle are dissected and not observed,

original: gnyis su med pa yongs su shes pa de tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa yongs su shes pa de tshul khrims yin te /
translated: that non-dual thorough knowledge is morality.

original: de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol du phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol du phyin pa'o //
translated: That is the perfection of morality of that one.🔽When, through thorough knowledge of the apprehended and the apprehender, that conceptualization does not engage, that is the perfection of patience.🔽That is the perfection of patience of that one.🔽That is the perfection of patience of that one.

original: gang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa yongs su shes nas rnam par rtog pa de ni mi 'jug par bzod pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol du phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba gnyis kyi rnam pa stong pa nyid yongs su shes nas rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol du phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa yongs su shes nas rnam par rtog pa de ni mi 'jug par bzod pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol du phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba gnyis kyi rnam pa stong pa nyid yongs su shes nas rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa ni bzod pa'i pha rol du phyin pa'o //
translated: When, through thorough knowledge of the emptiness of the aspect of the duality of the apprehended and the apprehender, conceptualization does not engage, that is the perfection of patience.

original: brtson 'grus gang gis nam gyi cha stong dang / nam gyi cha smad la brtson par byed cing rnal 'byor dang mthun par mthong bas rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang gis nam gyi cha stong dang / nam gyi cha smad la brtson par byed cing rnal 'byor dang mthun par mthong bas rnam par rtog pa ldog pa'i phyir /
translated: The perfection of effort is when one is diligent in the first and last watches of the night, and through seeing in accordance with yoga, conceptualization is reversed.

original: de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa ni nam shes rab kyis dpyod pa'i brtson 'grus kyis sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par @254a * //
analyzed: de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa ni nam shes rab kyis dpyod pa'i brtson 'grus kyis sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par @254a * //
translated: The perfection of effort is when, through the effort of analyzing with wisdom, the coarse and subtle are distinguished,

original: gzhigs te / mi dmigs pa de na rnam par rtog pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhigs te / mi dmigs pa de na rnam par rtog pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: and when conceptualization does not engage in that non-apprehension.🔽The perfection of concentration is when, in order to reverse conceptualization, one does not fall into the extreme of grasping the nirvāṇa of the tīrthikas.

original: gang rnam par rtog pa bzlog pa'i phyir mu stegs can gyi mya ngan las 'das par 'dzin par mi ltung ba de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas rtag pa dang
analyzed: gang rnam par rtog pa bzlog pa'i phyir mu stegs can gyi mya ngan las 'das par 'dzin par mi ltung ba de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas rtag pa dang
translated: The perfection of concentration is when, through fully understanding the selflessness of phenomena and persons, one does not fall into the extreme of grasping the nirvāṇa of the tīrthikas in order to reverse conceptualization.

original: / bdag dang phyi rol gyi don rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir mu stegs can gyi mngon par chags par ltung bar mi 'gyur ba de ni gnyis su med pa'i bsam gtan te /🔽bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: / bdag dang phyi rol gyi don rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir mu stegs can gyi mngon par chags par ltung bar mi 'gyur ba de ni gnyis su med pa'i bsam gtan te / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of concentration is the concentration that does not fall into the attachment of the tīrthikas, because it turns away from the self and external objects.

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nam rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / blo rab tu 'byed pa'i bar du rab tu phyen mtha' gnyis su mi ltung zhing gnas rab tu gyur pa mngon du 'gro ba mi 'jigs pas bdag gi 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa thob par bya ba'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba de ni shes rab
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nam rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / blo rab tu 'byed pa'i bar du rab tu phyen mtha' gnyis su mi ltung zhing gnas rab tu gyur pa mngon du 'gro ba mi 'jigs pas bdag gi 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa thob par bya ba'i phyir rab tu sbyor ba de ni shes rab
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the wisdom that does not fall into the two extremes, from the absence of conceptual thoughts in one’s own mind up to the discernment of the most subtle object of knowledge, and that is directed toward the transformation of the basis, the attainment of the fearlessness of the noble ones, and the attainment of the knowledge that comes from one’s own realization.

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po med par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dngos po med par gyur pa ste /
translated: The absence of conceptual thoughts in one’s own mind is the absence of the entity of conceptual thoughts.

original: nam blo rab tu 'byed pa'i shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: nam blo rab tu 'byed pa'i shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: The discernment of the most subtle object of knowledge is the discernment of the most subtle object of knowledge by means of the wisdom that analyzes.

original: phyi rol gyi don rab tu phye bas sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhig cing phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi ltung zhing mi dmigs pa de ni dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i shes pa'i log par gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don rab tu phye bas sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhig cing phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du mi ltung zhing mi dmigs pa de ni dmigs su med pa'i tshul gyis 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i shes pa'i log par gyur te /
translated: By distinguishing external objects, the coarse and subtle are destroyed, and one does not fall into the characteristics of the aggregates, etc., and does not observe them. That is the reversal of the consciousness of the apprehender and the apprehended by way of non-observation.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Without thought and without appearance, one abides in ultimate truth.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rnam par mi rtog cing mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: Likewise, the perfection of wisdom is non-conceptual and without signs.

original: shes rab dang / thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thog mar byas pa las rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab dang / thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thog mar byas pa las rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: The perfections of wisdom, means, aspiration, power, and knowledge are distinguished from the perfection of wisdom that is foremost.

original: sa bcu'i dbang po rnams kyi bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i sa bcur 'byed pa rnams kyis snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du dbye bas phye ba na sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i phyir 'jug go //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang po rnams kyi bdag dang gzhan la phan pa'i sa bcur 'byed pa rnams kyis snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin du dbye bas phye ba na sangs rgyas nyid 'thob pa'i phyir 'jug go //
translated: The ten grounds are divided into ten grounds that benefit oneself and others by the faculties of the ten grounds. When divided by the concentration with appearance and the concentration without appearance, one enters in order to attain buddhahood.

original: de ltar na des thams cad du khyab par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na des thams cad du khyab par gyur pa ste /
translated: Thus, it pervades everything.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dpyad pa'o //
translated: This concludes the analysis of the perfection of wisdom.🔽This is the fifth chapter in the explication of the noble Sutra of the Descent into Lanka, composed by the great master Sri Dipamkarasrljnana, called the lamp that illuminates the ultimate.🔽THE PERFECTION OF METHOD🔽THE PERFECTION OF METHOD🔽THE PERFECTION OF METHOD

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u drug pa las sa dang pha rol du phyin pa dpyad pa lnga pa'o /🔽// / de nas yang bcom ldan @254b 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u drug pa las sa dang pha rol du phyin pa dpyad pa lnga pa'o / // / de nas yang bcom ldan @254b 'das la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos 'di skad ces gsol to //

original: sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can no zhes pa'o //
translated: THE PERFECTION OF METHOD🔽THE PERFECTION OF

original: ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dgra bcom pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bar lung bstan zhes bya ba de la ci dgongs she na /
analyzed: ci'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dgra bcom pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bar lung bstan zhes bya ba de la ci dgongs she na /
translated: What was his intention in saying that?

original: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bas na 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni sangs rgyas su gdon mi za zhes so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bas na 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni sangs rgyas su gdon mi za zhes so //
translated: Because all beings have the essence of the Tathagata, it is certain that those who are free from passion will become Buddhas.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang bsam pa'i don la gsung par 'gyur ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa bsal ba'i don du nyan thos rnams la sangs rgyas su de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bar lung bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang bsam pa'i don la gsung par 'gyur ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa bsal ba'i don du nyan thos rnams la sangs rgyas su de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bar lung bstan to //
translated: The Omniscient One will speak in accordance with the meaning of the thought, in order to remove the desire of the Bodhisattvas for complete Nirvana, he prophesied that the Sravakas will become Buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi nub mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas gang gi nub mo yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de'i bar du bcom ldan 'das kyis yi ge gcig kyang ma
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi nub mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas gang gi nub mo yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa de'i bar du bcom ldan 'das kyis yi ge gcig kyang ma
translated: The Bhagavān did not speak or explain a single syllable from the night he fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening until the night he passed into parinirvāṇa.🔽The Bhagavān’s statement that he taught all the topics of the scriptures is to be understood as meaning that the Omniscient One taught the same Dharma that the tathāgatas of the past taught.

original: gsungs ma bshad ces bya ba der dgongs te gsungs pa'i don thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa ni ji bzhin du sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos ston pa de bzhin du ngas kyang chos de kho na nyid bshad kyi /
analyzed: gsungs ma bshad ces bya ba der dgongs te gsungs pa'i don thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa ni ji bzhin du sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis chos ston pa de bzhin du ngas kyang chos de kho na nyid bshad kyi /
translated: I have taught the same reality as they did.

original: sngar med pa ni cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar med pa ni cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: There is not the slightest thing that is new.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa lags te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa lags te /
translated: The tathāgatas are always in meditative equipoise.

original: mi rtog mi dpyod par 'phrul pa dag kyang sprul nas de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba mdzad de rnam par shes pa rnams kyang skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad /
analyzed: mi rtog mi dpyod par 'phrul pa dag kyang sprul nas de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bya ba mdzad de rnam par shes pa rnams kyang skad cig ma gcig nas gcig tu tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid du bshad /
translated: Without conceptualizing or analyzing, they emanate emanations and those emanations perform the deeds of the Tathagata.

original: lag na rdo rje yang khor mor rtag tu zham 'bring du 'brang thog ma'i mthar mi 'dogs la mya ngan las 'das par 'dogs /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje yang khor mor rtag tu zham 'bring du 'brang thog ma'i mthar mi 'dogs la mya ngan las 'das par 'dogs /
translated: Vajrapani is always in attendance and he is not attached to the beginning and he is attached to nirvana.

original: bdud dang bdud kyi las rnams dang ; las kyi rgyu rnams dang / bram ze'i bu mo tsanytsa dang / mdzes ma kun du rgyu dang / lhung bzed bkrus bzhin pa la sogs pa las kyi sgrib pa dag gda' na /
analyzed: bdud dang bdud kyi las rnams dang ; las kyi rgyu rnams dang / bram ze'i bu mo tsanytsa dang / mdzes ma kun du rgyu dang / lhung bzed bkrus bzhin pa la sogs pa las kyi sgrib pa dag gda' na /
translated: Mara and the deeds of Mara, the causes of karma, the Brahmin girl Cunchi, the wandering ascetic Sundari, the washing of the begging bowl and so forth are karmic obscurations.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis nongs pa dag ma spangs par rnam pa thams cad @255a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis nongs pa dag ma spangs par rnam pa thams cad @255a * //
translated: Bhagavan, if that is so, how is it that the Bhagavan, without abandoning faults, has attained omniscience?

original: mkhyen pa nyid thob ces bya bar bstan pa de dag phan tshun du 'gal ba rnams thams cad mkhyen pas spangs par gsungs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽blo gros chen po de'i phyir shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mkhyen pa nyid thob ces bya bar bstan pa de dag phan tshun du 'gal ba rnams thams cad mkhyen pas spangs par gsungs pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / blo gros chen po de'i phyir shin tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān has said that the Omniscient One has abandoned all mutually contradictory things, such as “attaining omniscience.”

original: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i dbyings la yang dgongs nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa rnams kyang rab tu spro bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i dbyings la yang dgongs nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa rnams kyang rab tu spro bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Mahāmati, therefore, I will teach you the ultimate truth, the sphere of activity of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, which is free from the faults of the tīrthikas’ and śrāvakas’ views.

original: blo gros chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di dang / gzhan dag na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa rnams gang dag nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa yod de /
analyzed: blo gros chen po sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di dang / gzhan dag na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa rnams gang dag nyan thos kyi theg pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod pa yod de /
translated: Mahāmati, in this buddha field and others, there are those who practice the bodhisattva conduct who wish to attain nirvāṇa through the vehicle of the śrāvakas.

original: de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa 'dod pa las bzlog par bya ba dang / theg pa chen po la rab tu spro bar bya ba'i phyir sprul pa'i nyan thos rnams la sprul pa'i sku dag gis lung bstan gyi /
analyzed: de dag nyan thos kyi theg pa 'dod pa las bzlog par bya ba dang / theg pa chen po la rab tu spro bar bya ba'i phyir sprul pa'i nyan thos rnams la sprul pa'i sku dag gis lung bstan gyi /
translated: In order to turn them away from the desire for the Śrāvaka Vehicle and to inspire them with enthusiasm for the Great Vehicle, the Emanation Body gives predictions to the Emanation Śrāvakas.

original: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But not to the Buddhas of Reality.

original: blo gros chen po de la dgongs nas nyan thos lung bstan to //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de la dgongs nas nyan thos lung bstan to //
translated: With that in mind, Mahāmati, I predicted the Śrāvakas.

original: blo gros chen po rnam par grol ba ro gcig pa'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas rnams nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa ni bye brag med mod kyi zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
analyzed: blo gros chen po rnam par grol ba ro gcig pa'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas rnams nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa ni bye brag med mod kyi zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang /
translated: Mahāmati, because of the single taste of liberation, the Śrāvakas, the Solitary Buddhas, and the Buddhas are not distinguished in terms of the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions.

original: mi mdzes par bsgoms pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang bar phyin ci log las 'byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ste /
analyzed: mi mdzes par bsgoms pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang bar phyin ci log las 'byung ba'i 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ste /
translated: By meditating on impermanence, suffering, and the unattractive, they abandon the afflictions of desire and so forth that arise from the error of permanence, self, pleasure, and purity.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa ni byang chub gsum du yang bye brag med do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rtogs pa ni byang chub gsum du yang bye brag med do //
translated: The realization of the four noble truths is not distinguished in the three enlightenments.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas ni nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas ni nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
translated: By the complete understanding of the selflessness of the person, the afflictions are eliminated.

original: chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs te /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs te /
translated: By the complete understanding of the selflessness of phenomena, the obscurations to omniscience are eliminated.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa de yang mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i bag chags dang bcas te spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa kho nar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa de yang mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i bag chags dang bcas te spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa kho nar 'gyur ro ;
translated: And that obscuration of the afflictions, together with the instinct for non-equipoise, having been eliminated, one becomes only the omniscience of the Tathagatas.

original: / bcom ldan 'das kyis de nyid bsgrub par mdzad pa shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: / bcom ldan 'das kyis de nyid bsgrub par mdzad pa shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat has not eliminated the obscurations to the knowable, which is the object of attainment.

original: blo gros chen po shes bya'i sgrib pa ni chos la bdag med pa mthong ba'i bye brag gis rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo gros chen po shes bya'i sgrib pa ni chos la bdag med pa mthong ba'i bye brag gis rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Mahamati, the obscurations to the knowable are purified by the distinction of seeing the selflessness of phenomena.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa'i @255b phyir gang zag la bdag med pa mthong ba la bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa'i @255b phyir gang zag la bdag med pa mthong ba la bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The afflictive obstructions are abandoned by means of the cultivation of the insight into the selflessness of persons in order to reverse the mental consciousness.

original: chos kyi sgrib pa rnam par grol ba de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags bzlog pa'i phyir rnam par ngag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sgrib pa rnam par grol ba de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags bzlog pa'i phyir rnam par ngag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The liberation from the obstructions to omniscience is the reversal of the habitual tendencies of the foundation consciousness.

original: sngon gyi chos kyi lus la dgongs te sngon dang phyis med pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir sngon bshad pa'i yi ge de dag nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtog mi dpyod par chos 'chad de /
analyzed: sngon gyi chos kyi lus la dgongs te sngon dang phyis med pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir sngon bshad pa'i yi ge de dag nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa mi rtog mi dpyod par chos 'chad de /
translated: The Tathāgata teaches the Dharma without conceptualization or analysis, by means of those very syllables that were explained previously, because the body of the Dharma that existed previously is not lost.

original: mkhyen bzhin du mdzad pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / mi rtog mi dpyod do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: mkhyen bzhin du mdzad pa dang / dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / mi rtog mi dpyod do zhes pa ste /
translated: He does so knowingly, without any loss of mindfulness, and without conceptualization or analysis.

original: dran pa nyams pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi sku dang rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku la bzhugs te rnal 'byor pa rnams la dngos po chos ston cing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad mdzad do //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa med pa'i phyir chos kyi sku dang rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku la bzhugs te rnal 'byor pa rnams la dngos po chos ston cing sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa thams cad mdzad do //
translated: Because of the absence of any loss of mindfulness, he abides in the Dharma Body and the Beatific Body, and teaches the Dharma to the yogis and yoginis, and performs all the deeds of a Buddha.

original: bslad pa lta ba du mar ltung ba dang / nyon mongs pas dkrugs pa rnams la sprul pa rnams kyis rtsod pa dang / lan glan pa dang / mu stegs can dang / bdud pham par byed cing thabs du mar chos ston to //
analyzed: bslad pa lta ba du mar ltung ba dang / nyon mongs pas dkrugs pa rnams la sprul pa rnams kyis rtsod pa dang / lan glan pa dang / mu stegs can dang / bdud pham par byed cing thabs du mar chos ston to //
translated: For those who are confused by the many views, and those who are disturbed by the afflictions, he manifests emanations who debate, answer questions, and defeat the tirthikas and maras, and who teach the Dharma in many ways.

original: nyan thos rnams la ni sangs rgyas su lung ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la ni sangs rgyas su lung ston par mdzad do //
translated: For the shravakas, he manifests as a Buddha and gives predictions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo ni don dam pa pha'i tshul nyid ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo ni don dam pa pha'i tshul nyid ston to //
translated: The Tathagata shows the nature of the ultimate, which is the way of the father.

original: sprul pa'i sku rnams kyi ni shes rab dang thabs rnams kyis sems can rnams gzung ba'i phyir go rims kyis gang zag la bdag med par bstan nas phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rab tu 'byed pas skad cig tu 'jig pa la zhugs pa rnams gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i tshul la gzung par bya ba'i phyir snod du gyur pa rnams la chos la bdag med pa ston cing sems can gyi don
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku rnams kyi ni shes rab dang thabs rnams kyis sems can rnams gzung ba'i phyir go rims kyis gang zag la bdag med par bstan nas phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rab tu 'byed pas skad cig tu 'jig pa la zhugs pa rnams gnyis su med pa'i don dam pa'i tshul la gzung par bya ba'i phyir snod du gyur pa rnams la chos la bdag med pa ston cing sems can gyi don
translated: The emanation bodies, by means of their wisdom and means, in order to take hold of sentient beings, first teach the selflessness of persons, and then, by means of the analysis of the aggregates, elements, sense spheres, etc., in order to take hold of those who have entered into the momentary disintegration of the aggregates, they teach the selflessness of phenomena to those who have become vessels for the nondual ultimate way.

original: rnam pa mang po mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam pa mang po mdzad do //
translated: They perform many kinds of activities for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: sems can gang dag la bdud kyal ka byed pa'i rigs can gyis chos kyi bar chad byed pa de dag la btsun gtso 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje cha nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can gang dag la bdud kyal ka byed pa'i rigs can gyis chos kyi bar chad byed pa de dag la btsun gtso 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje cha nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: Those sentient beings who are of the type to be deceived by Māra, who create obstacles to the Dharma, are taken care of by the noble lord Vajrapāṇi.

original: sems can rnams skyo bar byed pa'i las kyi rgyud rab tu 'byed pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can rnams skyo bar byed pa'i las kyi rgyud rab tu 'byed pa gsungs te /
translated: He teaches the tantra of the cause of the activity of discouraging sentient beings.

original: kye ma'o 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag go zhes rtog par longs spyod kyis mos pa kha cig yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽kha cig ni rtag pa'i bdag tu mngon par chags pas skad cig tu 'jig pa thos te /
analyzed: kye ma'o 'du byed rnams ni mi rtag go zhes rtog par longs spyod kyis mos pa kha cig yid 'byung bar 'gyur ro // kha cig ni rtag pa'i bdag tu mngon par chags pas skad cig tu 'jig pa thos te /
translated: “Alas! Conditioned things are impermanent!” Some people, who are attached to the enjoyment of their bodies, become disgusted with the world.

original: bdag med pas skrag cing chos dang gang zag la bdag med pas don dam pa'i tshul la mi 'jug pa de dag la sems kyi skad cig ma @256a * //
analyzed: bdag med pas skrag cing chos dang gang zag la bdag med pas don dam pa'i tshul la mi 'jug pa de dag la sems kyi skad cig ma @256a * //
translated: Others, attached to a permanent self, are frightened by the teaching of momentariness and selflessness, and do not enter into the ultimate truth of the selflessness of persons and things.

original: gcig tu rgyun rtag pas srid pa dang / thar pa'i gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ston to //🔽sems gcig po rtog go zhes byed pa por smra bar mngon par chags pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po chud pa nyid spyi dang khyad par du dgongs te /
analyzed: gcig tu rgyun rtag pas srid pa dang / thar pa'i gnas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ston to // sems gcig po rtog go zhes byed pa por smra bar mngon par chags pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po chud pa nyid spyi dang khyad par du dgongs te /
translated: For their sake, the Buddha teaches the all-base consciousness, which is the cause of both affliction and purification, and which is the permanent continuum of the mind in a single moment.

original: sems can rnams la khyab pa dang rtag pa ston to //
analyzed: sems can rnams la khyab pa dang rtag pa ston to //
translated: For those who are attached to the idea of a single mind, and who believe in a creator, the Buddha teaches the essence of the Tathāgata, which is all-pervading and permanent, with a special intention.

original: de de bzhin du thabs du mas sngags kyi rgyud dang / sprul pa gtong bar gsungs kyang gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang por gyur pa ston to //
analyzed: de de bzhin du thabs du mas sngags kyi rgyud dang / sprul pa gtong bar gsungs kyang gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang por gyur pa ston to //
translated: Thus, although the Tathāgata has taught the various methods of the tantras of mantra and the sending forth of emanations, he shows himself as the lord of the yoga of various forms.

original: mos pa tha dad pa sems can gyi don du sangs rgyas gar mkhan gyi thabs sna tshogs 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa tha dad pa sems can gyi don du sangs rgyas gar mkhan gyi thabs sna tshogs 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: This inconceivable variety of the Buddha’s methods, like those of a dancer, for the sake of sentient beings with various inclinations,

original: bro ba dang / sman ra sa yan dang / mig rtsi dang / gter mi zad pa dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang / phug dang gzhal med khang dang / longs spyod rnam pa du ma sbyin pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: bro ba dang / sman ra sa yan dang / mig rtsi dang / gter mi zad pa dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang / phug dang gzhal med khang dang / longs spyod rnam pa du ma sbyin pa'i rnal 'byor gyi dbang po rnams so //
translated: is the lord of the yoga of the gift of various enjoyments, such as the gift of taste, the gift of medicine, the gift of collyrium, the gift of inexhaustible treasure, the gift of the wish-fulfilling gem, the gift of caves and palaces.

original: lhung bzed bkrus bzhin du slar ji ltar gshegs she na /
analyzed: lhung bzed bkrus bzhin du slar ji ltar gshegs she na /
translated: How is it that the Tathāgata, like a washed-up bowl, departs again?

original: de ni chos bcu pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni chos bcu pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Lord has said this in the Daśadharmaka Sūtra:

original: bsod nams chung zhing nyan thos rnams kyi yi chad pa bstsal ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams chung zhing nyan thos rnams kyi yi chad pa bstsal ba'i don du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: “The Tathāgata has taught this for the sake of dispelling the despair of those of little merit, the śrāvakas.”

original: de de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis sngags kyi tshul dang / cho 'phrul rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mi snang bas spang bar nus kyang skur pa la btang snyoms mdzad pa ni bsod nams chung zhing skur pa mang ba'i sems can rnams kyi yid mi bde ba bstsal ba'i don du tsanytsa dang /
analyzed: de de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis sngags kyi tshul dang / cho 'phrul rnams kyi 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mi snang bas spang bar nus kyang skur pa la btang snyoms mdzad pa ni bsod nams chung zhing skur pa mang ba'i sems can rnams kyi yid mi bde ba bstsal ba'i don du tsanytsa dang /
translated: Likewise, the Omniscient Ones are able to abandon the world's insults by the supernormal power of the Mantra method, but they ignore them in order to remove the mental unhappiness of beings who have little merit and are much insulted.

original: mdzes ma mu stegs kyis skur pa la btang snyoms mdzad do //
analyzed: mdzes ma mu stegs kyis skur pa la btang snyoms mdzad do //
translated: They ignore the insults of Cunda and Sundari, the heretic.

original: lha sbyin gyis pha bong las yar te phog pa la btang snyoms su mdzad pa ni sems can mang pos sman byin pa'i bsod nams kyi don dang / de dus gzhan du skyo bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lha sbyin gyis pha bong las yar te phog pa la btang snyoms su mdzad pa ni sems can mang pos sman byin pa'i bsod nams kyi don dang / de dus gzhan du skyo bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: They ignore the insult of Devadatta's stone, in order to benefit many beings by the merit of giving medicine, and in order to make him remorseful at another time.

original: chos bcu pa las log pa lha sbyin ni rnam par thar pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: chos bcu pa las log pa lha sbyin ni rnam par thar pa thob pa ste /
translated: The Dasadharmaka Sutra says that Devadatta, the schismatic, attained liberation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa che ba kho nar mi dang lha la sogs pa'i sems can rnams la sgrogs par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa che ba kho nar mi dang lha la sogs pa'i sems can rnams la sgrogs par byed do //
translated: He proclaimed to men, gods, and other beings that the Tathagata was great.

original: gang yang sangs rgyas dang / chos dang dge 'dun la mi bden par byed pa de ni de lta bur sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang sangs rgyas dang / chos dang dge 'dun la mi bden par byed pa de ni de lta bur sems can dmyal bar 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
translated: Whoever acts falsely toward the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha will go to such a hell.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi byang chub bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: Thus, the enlightenment of the Buddha is inconceivable.

original: dran pa mnyam pa med pa @256b dang ; / mi rtog mi dpyod pa dang / bag chags kyi sa bzhi spangs pa ste zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa mnyam pa med pa @256b dang ; / mi rtog mi dpyod pa dang / bag chags kyi sa bzhi spangs pa ste zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: The mindfulness that is unequaled, non-conceptual, non-analytical, and free from the four habitual tendencies, refers to the fundamental consciousness, the afflicted mind, the mental consciousness,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes par bag chags rnam bzhi yongs su smin pa ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes par bag chags rnam bzhi yongs su smin pa ste /
translated: and the four types of habitual tendencies in the eye and other consciousnesses that have fully matured.

original: de dag tu bstan pa dang / mi bden pa'i bag chags ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / gnyis ka dang / lung du mi ston par brtsams so //
analyzed: de dag tu bstan pa dang / mi bden pa'i bag chags ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / gnyis ka dang / lung du mi ston par brtsams so //
translated: The taught and false habitual tendencies are undertaken as virtuous, non-virtuous, both, and neutral.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las rab tu gyur pa na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po nyid me long gi ye shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i bag chags ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las rab tu gyur pa na de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po nyid me long gi ye shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: When the latent tendencies of the outflows are completely transformed from the consciousness of the ground of all, the essence of the tathagatas becomes mirror-like primordial wisdom.

original: 'pho ba gnyis dang bral ba ni 'khor ba'i 'pho ba dang / yongs su 'grib pa'i 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: 'pho ba gnyis dang bral ba ni 'khor ba'i 'pho ba dang / yongs su 'grib pa'i 'pho ba ste /
translated: Free from two transmigrations means free from the transmigration of samsara and the transmigration of complete diminution.

original: de dag bral ba ni 'pho ba gnyis dang bral bar brtag go //
analyzed: de dag bral ba ni 'pho ba gnyis dang bral bar brtag go //
translated: Being free from those two is considered to be free from two transmigrations.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pas gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa bsgom pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pas gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa bsgom pas 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ngo //
translated: Because the obscurations of affliction and the obscurations of cognition are abandoned means that by meditating on the four noble truths, because of thoroughly knowing the selflessness of persons, by meditating on impermanence, suffering, and the unattractive, the obscurations of affliction such as attachment are abandoned.

original: chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ngo //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ngo //
translated: By thoroughly knowing the selflessness of phenomena, the obscurations of cognition are abandoned.

original: blo gros chen po yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bdun rnams ni dge ba zag pa med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba ni 'khor ba ma yin te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa bdun rnams ni dge ba zag pa med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba ni 'khor ba ma yin te /
translated: Mahamati, the seven, the mind, the mental consciousness, and the eye consciousness, etc., are not samsara, being free from the side of the virtuous uncontaminated.

original: bag chags kyi rgyu las 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi rgyu las 'byung ba'i phyir skad cig pa'o //
translated: They are momentary because they arise from the cause of habitual tendencies.🔽Mahamati, the tathiigatagarbha is the cause of samsara and nirvana, of happiness and suffering.

original: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni 'khor zhing mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bdun rnams skad cig pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu las 'byung bas na 'khor bar mi 'khor ro //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni 'khor zhing mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin te zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa bdun rnams skad cig pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu las 'byung bas na 'khor bar mi 'khor ro //
translated: The seven consciousnesses do not cycle in samsara because they arise from the cause of momentary habitual tendencies.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i gnas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni rdo rje dang gser la sogs pa bzhin du skad cig ma'i rgyun rtag pa'i phyir 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'i gnas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni rdo rje dang gser la sogs pa bzhin du skad cig ma'i rgyun rtag pa'i phyir 'khor ba ste /
translated: The tathiigatagarbha, the abode of the contaminated and the uncontaminated, is samsara because it is the cause of the momentary stream, like a diamond or gold, etc.

original: dus kyi khyad par du byed pa na dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa dang / 'khor ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po @257a * //🔽'khor bar 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus kyi khyad par du byed pa na dri ma dang bcas pa dang dri ma med pa dang / 'khor ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po @257a * // 'khor bar 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is distinguished in terms of time, it is said to be with stains and without stains, and to be the cause of samsara and of suffering.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir bden ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi dngos po med pa'i phyir bden ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of the bliss of nirvana is the cause of truth, because it is the absence of the entity of suffering.

original: bden pa shes pa la ni mi shes pa thams cad sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: bden pa shes pa la ni mi shes pa thams cad sdug bsngal lo //
translated: For the knowledge of truth, all ignorance is suffering.🔽The childish, ordinary beings do not know it.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bos mi shes so zhes pa ni kha cig stong pa nyid kyis g-yengs pa'i blo can thams cad med ces pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bos mi shes so zhes pa ni kha cig stong pa nyid kyis g-yengs pa'i blo can thams cad med ces pa ste /
translated: Some, with minds confused by emptiness, say that everything is nonexistent.

original: thams cad rtag par yong ces pa rtag pa'am chad par smra bar ltung zhing skad cig ma'i rgyun du rtag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po khong du chud par mi byed do //
analyzed: thams cad rtag par yong ces pa rtag pa'am chad par smra bar ltung zhing skad cig ma'i rgyun du rtag pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po khong du chud par mi byed do //
translated: Others, who are eternalists, fall into the extreme of eternalism or nihilism, and do not understand the tathiigatagarbha, which is the continuum of moments.

original: skad cig ma'i phyogs la g-yengs pas blo rtag tu chad pa'am rtag tu chad pa med par rtog go //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i phyogs la g-yengs pas blo rtag tu chad pa'am rtag tu chad pa med par rtog go //
translated: Because of distraction toward the momentary aspect, the mind is conceived as either always interrupted or always uninterrupted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni shes rab can rnams kyis shes te de ltar thams cad bsdu ba'i don du bshad nas yan lag gi don du cung zad cig bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po ni shes rab can rnams kyis shes te de ltar thams cad bsdu ba'i don du bshad nas yan lag gi don du cung zad cig bshad par bya ste /
translated: The essence of the Tathāgata is known by the wise. Thus, having explained the meaning of the inclusion of all in this way, I will now explain it a little in terms of the meaning of the branches.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyi sku gsum ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin tha dad pas rnam par 'byed do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyi sku gsum ni snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin tha dad pas rnam par 'byed do //
translated: The bodies of the Omniscient Ones are distinguished by the different concentrations with and without appearances.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku rnams ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku rnams ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The essential bodies are non-dual.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yul te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi yul te /
translated: Likewise, they are the object of the yogis.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi dbang po thams cad kyi yul las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyi dbang po thams cad kyi yul las 'das pa'o //
translated: They are beyond the objects of all the sense faculties of foolish ordinary beings.

original: bdud kyal ka can gyi rigs rnams kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje de yongs su srung ba'i don du de zham 'bring du mi 'brang ngo //
analyzed: bdud kyal ka can gyi rigs rnams kyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje de yongs su srung ba'i don du de zham 'bring du mi 'brang ngo //
translated: Because he is not the object of the class of māras who are tricksters, the noble Vajrapāṇi does not follow him as a bodyguard.

original: sprul pa rnams ni las las skyes pa'i ma yin te /
analyzed: sprul pa rnams ni las las skyes pa'i ma yin te /
translated: Emanations are not born from karma.

original: de dag las ni de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de dag las ni de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan pa yang ma yin /
translated: The Tathāgata is not other than those emanations,

original: gzhan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is he not other.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid gcig por gyur te /
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa nyid gcig por gyur te /
translated: The Tathāgata himself is the only one who enters into the meditative absorption that is both with appearance and without appearance.

original: rnam pa mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: He becomes manifold.

original: des na gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the conventions of other and not other are not appropriate.

original: sngon med pa dang / phyis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i yi ge de dag nyid kyi snga mas bshad pa bzhin du thog ma dad tha mar dge ba 'chad kyi lhag par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon med pa dang / phyis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i yi ge de dag nyid kyi snga mas bshad pa bzhin du thog ma dad tha mar dge ba 'chad kyi lhag par ni ma yin no //
translated: Those syllables that are not prior and do not arise later are explained as being virtuous in the beginning and virtuous in the end, but they are not superior.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi las las ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnams 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi las las ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnams 'byung ba ste /
translated: The emanations that are the actions of the accumulations of merit and wisdom are natural emanations,

original: sprul pa'i rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: but not emanations that are aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / @257b skye mched la sogs pa sprul pa rnams kyis ston gyi /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / @257b skye mched la sogs pa sprul pa rnams kyis ston gyi /
translated: The emanations of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases are displayed,

original: ngo bo nyid rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the natural ones.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams la ni gnyis su med pa dang gnyis ka yang ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams la ni gnyis su med pa dang gnyis ka yang ngo //
translated: For yogins, there are both nondual and dual.

translated: Therefore, attachment to self, stinginess, harming others, etc. are inferred from craving.

original: gal te log pa'i shes pa'i bya ba ma gtogs par sdug bsngal rjes su 'bral bar 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dben pa'i ye shes skyes su zin yang ngam grog la sogs pa yul spong bzhin de nyid du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te log pa'i shes pa'i bya ba ma gtogs par sdug bsngal rjes su 'bral bar 'gyur na ni de'i tshe dben pa'i ye shes skyes su zin yang ngam grog la sogs pa yul spong bzhin de nyid du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If, apart from the activity of a false cognition, there were a separation from suffering, then at that time, even though the knowledge of isolation has arisen, one would fall into that very [suffering], like a mosquito or a fly falling into a place of isolation.

original: de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gnod pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: This is the measure of the harm to the opposing factors.

original: gzhan dag gis 'bru la sogs pa la srog tu kun brtags pa'i slong ba la sbyin pa yang sdig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'bru la sogs pa la srog tu kun brtags pa'i slong ba la sbyin pa yang sdig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Giving to beggars who impute life to grains and so on would also be a sin.

original: de ci'i phyir bdag tu chags pa'i log pa'i shes pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir bdag tu chags pa'i log pa'i shes pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ngo //
translated: Why is that? The suffering of saṃsāra arises from the false cognition of attachment to self.

original: bdag med pa shes pas 'dod chags dang bral ba 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal bzlog go //
analyzed: bdag med pa shes pas 'dod chags dang bral ba 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal bzlog go //
translated: The suffering of saṃsāra is averted by the detachment that comes from knowing selflessness.

original: der btsog pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bza' ba dang / mi za ba la sogs pa mi dgos so //
analyzed: der btsog pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bza' ba dang / mi za ba la sogs pa mi dgos so //
translated: There, cleanliness, impurity, eating, not eating, and so on are not necessary.

original: cha byad rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rgyan la sogs pa dang / thal bas bskus pa dang / dri ma 'chang ba dang / ba glang dang / ri dags kyi brtul zhugs dang / khrus dang / zan mi za ba la @259b sogs pa sbyin sreg la sogs pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: cha byad rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rgyan la sogs pa dang / thal bas bskus pa dang / dri ma 'chang ba dang / ba glang dang / ri dags kyi brtul zhugs dang / khrus dang / zan mi za ba la @259b sogs pa sbyin sreg la sogs pa yang rung ste /
translated: Various costumes, ornaments, and so on, smearing oneself with ashes, carrying a skull-cup, the practice of the cow and the deer, bathing, fasting, and so on, even fire sacrifices,

original: gang gis 'dod chags las skyo ba thar bar 'gyur ba bdag tu sred pa las mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis 'dod chags las skyo ba thar bar 'gyur ba bdag tu sred pa las mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not turn away from craving for a self, which is what causes distress from passion and so on.

original: zhi ba pa rnams /
analyzed: zhi ba pa rnams /
translated: The Pacificationists say:

original: gser la sogs pa rku ba dang // ba lang sha yang za ba dang // bram ze stong yang bsad pas kyang //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa rku ba dang // ba lang sha yang za ba dang // bram ze stong yang bsad pas kyang //
translated: Even stealing gold and so on, eating beef, and even killing a thousand brahmans,

original: yang dag rig na mi gos so //
analyzed: yang dag rig na mi gos so //
translated: if you are a knower of reality, you are not defiled.🔽If you kill the world of the created and uncreated,

original: yod pa rnams ni byas pa dang // rgyu dang mi rgyu 'jig rten bsad //
analyzed: yod pa rnams ni byas pa dang // rgyu dang mi rgyu 'jig rten bsad //
translated: the existent and the non-existent,

original: chang 'thung la sogs nyes pa yis //
analyzed: chang 'thung la sogs nyes pa yis //
translated: by the faults of drinking alcohol and so on,

original: yang dag rig pa la mi gos //
analyzed: yang dag rig pa la mi gos //
translated: you are not defiled by the knower of reality.

original: zhes so // tshangs spyod pa la sogs pa yis //
analyzed: zhes so // tshangs spyod pa la sogs pa yis //
translated: By celibacy and so on,

original: ci phyir lus ni ltung bar byed //
analyzed: ci phyir lus ni ltung bar byed //
translated: why do you bring the body down?

original: yang dag shes las de dag grol //
analyzed: yang dag shes las de dag grol //
translated: They are liberated from the knowledge of reality.

original: de dag la ni gzir gyur med //🔽ces zer ro //🔽de ste mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa bsgom pas 'dod chags kyis skyo ba la gnyis dang gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor du gyur na ni de'i tshe bdag tu chags pa dang / ser sna dang /
analyzed: de dag la ni gzir gyur med // ces zer ro // de ste mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / stong pa bsgom pas 'dod chags kyis skyo ba la gnyis dang gnyis su med pa'i rnal 'byor du gyur na ni de'i tshe bdag tu chags pa dang / ser sna dang /
translated: They are not oppressed by them.

original: gzhan la gnod pa'i dngos bo med pas ji ltar na rku ba dang / chang dang / gzhan gyi bung med la smrel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa'i dngos bo med pas ji ltar na rku ba dang / chang dang / gzhan gyi bung med la smrel bar 'gyur /
translated: If, by meditating on impermanence, suffering, impurity, and emptiness, one becomes disgusted with desire, and if one becomes a yogi/nī of non-duality, then at that time, since there is no basis for attachment to self, miserliness, and harming others, how could one steal, drink alcohol, or have sex with another’s wife?

original: srog gcod pa'i sdig pa yang ji ltar na byed /
analyzed: srog gcod pa'i sdig pa yang ji ltar na byed /
translated: How could one commit the sin of killing?

original: 'dod chags kyi skyo ba tshangs par spyod pa yang ji ltar na yang gdung bar byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi skyo ba tshangs par spyod pa yang ji ltar na yang gdung bar byed /
translated: How could one torment oneself with the austerity of celibacy, which is disgusted with desire?

original: 'on te de kho na nyid yi ge 'bru de brjod pas na ni der zhugs pas na ci'i phyir na 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te de kho na nyid yi ge 'bru de brjod pas na ni der zhugs pas na ci'i phyir na 'dod chags dang bral bar mi 'gyur /
translated: But if, by uttering the syllable of reality, one enters into it, then why would one not become free from desire?

original: bdag tu chags pa las ni 'khor bar sdug bsngal 'byung na chags pa dang ma bral gyi bar du ji ltar na 'grol /
analyzed: bdag tu chags pa las ni 'khor bar sdug bsngal 'byung na chags pa dang ma bral gyi bar du ji ltar na 'grol /
translated: Since suffering in cyclic existence arises from attachment to a self, how can there be liberation as long as one is not free from attachment?

original: de'i phyir chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas mthar zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes sangs rgyas blo ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas mthar zhing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes sangs rgyas blo ni de lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, having fully understood the selflessness of persons and phenomena, one becomes a final knower, an omniscient one.🔽The Bhagavān permitted meat that is pure in three respects.

original: mtha' gsum yongs su dag pa'i sha ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ngo zhes pa ni gang gnang ba yang med la bkag ba yang med de /
analyzed: mtha' gsum yongs su dag pa'i sha ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ngo zhes pa ni gang gnang ba yang med la bkag ba yang med de /
translated: There is nothing that is permitted and nothing that is prohibited.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mtha' gsum yongs su dag pa'i sha dkon par gsungs so //
analyzed: mtha' gsum yongs su dag pa'i sha dkon par gsungs so //
translated: Meat that is pure in three respects is said to be rare.

original: snying rje can gyi byang chub sems dpa' la ni de yang mdo sde 'dir bkag pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje can gyi byang chub sems dpa' la ni de yang mdo sde 'dir bkag pa ste /
translated: For a compassionate bodhisattva, that is also prohibited in this sūtra.

original: sngags smra ba rnams la ni sha za rnams kyis bar chad byed cing gnod pa byed pas na khyad par du bkag go //
analyzed: sngags smra ba rnams la ni sha za rnams kyis bar chad byed cing gnod pa byed pas na khyad par du bkag go //
translated: For those who recite mantras, it is especially prohibited because flesh-eaters create obstacles and harm them.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i nad la ni ba mar dang / 'bru mar dang / til dang / til mar dang / gro la sogs par gyur pa ni gnyen po'o //🔽des na btsog pa dang gtsang ba'i sha snying rje can @260a * //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i nad la ni ba mar dang / 'bru mar dang / til dang / til mar dang / gro la sogs par gyur pa ni gnyen po'o // des na btsog pa dang gtsang ba'i sha snying rje can @260a * //
translated: For diseases such as wind, butter, oil, sesame, sesame oil, wheat, etc. are the remedies.

original: gyis mi bza'o //
analyzed: gyis mi bza'o //
translated: Therefore, the compassionate one should not eat meat, whether pure or impure.

original: 'phags pa'i nyan thos rnams yang dag par lta ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam pa thams cad shes pa las gnas pa rnams ji ltar na sha la sogs pa'i ro la mngon par chags par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nyan thos rnams yang dag par lta ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa bsgom pa'i lam gyi rnam pa thams cad shes pa las gnas pa rnams ji ltar na sha la sogs pa'i ro la mngon par chags par 'gyur /
translated: How can the noble śrāvakas, who are established in the knowledge of all aspects of the path of cultivation such as right view, impermanence, suffering, ugliness, etc., become attached to the taste of meat, etc.?

original: btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhugs pa dar las g-yogs pa lta bur shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag snang ngo //
analyzed: btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la zhugs pa dar las g-yogs pa lta bur shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag snang ngo //
translated: The foremost venerable bodhisattvas, who have entered omniscience, are like a covering cloth, illuminating the entire maṇḍala of knowables.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sgrib pa med par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams ni sgrib pa med par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen te /
translated: The Blessed Ones know everything without obstruction.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of all aspects is the reality of the Buddha.

original: de'i dngos po bas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po bas na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni chos nyid do //
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is the reality of the Buddha, because it is the reality of that.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa rnams kyis shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir de dag la bkres pa ga la zhig ste /
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa rnams kyis shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir de dag la bkres pa ga la zhig ste /
translated: How can those who have entered the concentration of light and the concentration of no light have hunger, since they have abandoned the obscurations of the knowable, the obscurations of affliction, and the obscurations of karma?

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa la gnas pa rnams lta bur ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang du 'tsho ba'i dbang po dus thams cad du gnas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa la gnas pa rnams lta bur ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang du 'tsho ba'i dbang po dus thams cad du gnas so //
translated: Like those who abide in the state of absorption in cessation, the faculty of life force remains for them at all times under the power of concentration.

original: mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen cing gzugs sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po ting nge 'dzin gyi ro bdud rtsis 'tsho ba de dag la rnying pa mi mdzes pa'i sha la sogs pa'i ro myang bar ga las na
analyzed: mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen cing gzugs sna tshogs kyi rnal 'byor gyi dbang po ting nge 'dzin gyi ro bdud rtsis 'tsho ba de dag la rnying pa mi mdzes pa'i sha la sogs pa'i ro myang bar ga las na
translated: How can those who are completely pure, free from attachment, omniscient, and live on the nectar of the taste of concentration, the faculty of yoga of various forms, have a taste for the flesh and so on of old, ugly beings?

original: 'gyur / sems can thams cad rgyud rangs par mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'gyur / sems can thams cad rgyud rangs par mdzad pa /
translated: He is the one who delights the mindstreams of all sentient beings.🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por thabs sna tshogs can byang chub sems kyi sems rgyu spangs pa rtag pa dang / gnyis pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i chos thabs sna tshogs kyis ston pa dang / don dam pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por thabs sna tshogs can byang chub sems kyi sems rgyu spangs pa rtag pa dang / gnyis pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i chos thabs sna tshogs kyis ston pa dang / don dam pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dang /
translated: The mind of enlightenment, which is the cause of the mind of enlightenment, is the essence of the Tathagata, which is the abandonment of the cause of the mind of dualism, and which is the teaching of the Dharma of non-duality by various means.🔽The ultimate is the arising of things and non-things,

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu yon tan gyi tshogs dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa las rgyu dang 'bras bur byung ba dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan mang du 'byung ba dang / sems kyi tshogs khyad par can dang dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi gsung la mnga' ba la sogs @260b pa'i yon tan can dang /
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu yon tan gyi tshogs dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa las rgyu dang 'bras bur byung ba dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa yon tan mang du 'byung ba dang / sems kyi tshogs khyad par can dang dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi gsung la mnga' ba la sogs @260b pa'i yon tan can dang /
translated: the arising of the collection of qualities of the wish-fulfilling jewel, the arising of cause and effect from the stages and perfections, the arising of the many qualities such as the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so forth, and the arising of the special collection of the mind, the mastery of speech, and so forth.

original: cho 'phrul rgya che ba dang / ye shes dpal bzang pos chud pa'i mun pa chen po mtha' dag bcom ste /
analyzed: cho 'phrul rgya che ba dang / ye shes dpal bzang pos chud pa'i mun pa chen po mtha' dag bcom ste /
translated: The great miracles, the great darkness that is filled with the excellent glory of pristine consciousness is destroyed.

original: rab tu snang bar byas pa dang / rab rib dang ling tog bcom ste nyi ma'i yon tan gyis 'jig rten mtha' dag snang bar mdzad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa rnams te /🔽mchog tu yongs su dag cing /🔽'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen cing rnal 'byor gyi dbang po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag de ltar sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yongs su skyob par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu snang bar byas pa dang / rab rib dang ling tog bcom ste nyi ma'i yon tan gyis 'jig rten mtha' dag snang bar mdzad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa rnams te / mchog tu yongs su dag cing / 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen cing rnal 'byor gyi dbang po sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag de ltar sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yongs su skyob par zhugs pa'o //
translated: the Omniscient Ones, who have destroyed the darkness of ignorance and the cataracts of the eyes, who illuminate the world with the light of the sun of knowledge, who are the supreme refuge of all beings.

original: mchod sbyin pa kha cig ni rang byung rang nyid kyis mchod sbyin gyi don du lugs byas so zhes rtog pa de 'dir dpyad par bya ste /🔽gal te de 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig na ni rtsed mo'i phyir bya ste /🔽gzhan la sdug bsngal bar byed pa de la ci mkho //

original: 'on te 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid yin na ni nang gi 'dod pas bslad de rnam pa mang por sdug bsngal bar gyur pa de'i mi shes pa yang sus byas /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid yin na ni nang gi 'dod pas bslad de rnam pa mang por sdug bsngal bar gyur pa de'i mi shes pa yang sus byas /
translated: But if they are free from desire, then who is it that, deluded by internal desire, suffers in many ways?

original: des na ci yang sus kyang mi byed de /
analyzed: des na ci yang sus kyang mi byed de /
translated: Therefore, no one does anything.

original: gser gyi 'byung gnas bzhin du sems can rnams kyi chud pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: gser gyi 'byung gnas bzhin du sems can rnams kyi chud pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: Like a source of gold, the elements of sentient beings are naturally pure.

original: ji lta bur zhe na ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyun gyi dbang dang / mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig ba ni gnyis kyi rnam pa glo bur du byung ba'i dri ma dang bral na dag ba'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyun gyi dbang dang / mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig ba ni gnyis kyi rnam pa glo bur du byung ba'i dri ma dang bral na dag ba'i sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro //
translated: How so? When the two kinds of ignorance, which are not in meditative equipoise, are removed from the continuum of self and others, which are like adventitious stains, they become pure Buddhas.

original: bsam pa dag pa de dag ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal yongs su skyob cing mi 'jigs pa sbyin par thams cad du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa de dag ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal yongs su skyob cing mi 'jigs pa sbyin par thams cad du zhugs pa'o //
translated: Those whose intentions are pure are completely engaged in protecting the suffering of others and giving them fearlessness.

original: de dag gis bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams kyis ro'i sred pa thams cad yongs su spong na sems can la gnod par 'gyur pa'i sha za ba'i ro la chags par 'gyur ba lta zhig ci smos /
analyzed: de dag gis bstan pa la zhugs pa rnams kyis ro'i sred pa thams cad yongs su spong na sems can la gnod par 'gyur pa'i sha za ba'i ro la chags par 'gyur ba lta zhig ci smos /
translated: How much more so for those who have entered the teaching and have given up all craving for the taste of meat, to crave the taste of meat that is harmful to living beings!

original: kha zas ni sman bzhin du bza'i rgyags shing rlom pa'i phyir na ma yin te /
analyzed: kha zas ni sman bzhin du bza'i rgyags shing rlom pa'i phyir na ma yin te /
translated: Food is for the purpose of medicine, not for the purpose of intoxication or pride.

original: mkhas pa rnams la gang ni sdig pa med pa rnams de lta bu ni lus gso ba 'ba' zhig gi phyir rung ngo //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams la gang ni sdig pa med pa rnams de lta bu ni lus gso ba 'ba' zhig gi phyir rung ngo //
translated: For the wise, it is appropriate to eat meat only for the sake of nourishing the body.

original: nan tan can rnams la ni bye brag tu ste /
analyzed: nan tan can rnams la ni bye brag tu ste /
translated: For those who are diligent, it is appropriate in particular.

original: slong ba'i zas su gang ltung zhing khyim bdag gis byin pa ni 'bras chan bzhin du de @261a * //
analyzed: slong ba'i zas su gang ltung zhing khyim bdag gis byin pa ni 'bras chan bzhin du de @261a * //
translated: The food of those who are diligent is the food that falls to them as beggars, given by householders, like rice.

original: dag gi zas gtso yin te /
analyzed: dag gi zas gtso yin te /
translated: That is their main food.

original: ci 'dis dbang po bzhin du gzhan la gnod par byas te zas rnyed dam /
analyzed: ci 'dis dbang po bzhin du gzhan la gnod par byas te zas rnyed dam /
translated: Do they get food by harming others, like the sense faculties?🔽Or do they get it by their own efforts?

original: 'on te ci bdag nyid kyis ji lta bu zhig tu 'byung ngam zhes rnam par mi brtag par blangs la nan tan pa rnams 'byung ste 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'on te ci bdag nyid kyis ji lta bu zhig tu 'byung ngam zhes rnam par mi brtag par blangs la nan tan pa rnams 'byung ste 'gro'o //
translated: Without such analysis, they accept and go forth as diligent ones.

original: brgyud pa las sdig par 'gyur du zin na ni 'gron pa la yang sdig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brgyud pa las sdig par 'gyur du zin na ni 'gron pa la yang sdig par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were sinful to transmit, then it would be sinful to transmit to a guest.

original: gal te 'gron po lam du mi 'gro na ni mi rgod la ma byin par blang bar ji ltar na 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te 'gron po lam du mi 'gro na ni mi rgod la ma byin par blang bar ji ltar na 'gyur /
translated: If the guest does not go on the road, how can it be taking what is not given to the robber?

original: gal te ma bskyed na ni ji ltar na gsod par 'gyur /
